Reviews.Title: “Sun, sand and sea with Ultimate Service”
Reviews.Author: Edward K
Reviews.Content: This Royal Resorts location on the outskirts of Playa del Carmen has all the amenities a tourist will want in a holiday including golf, ocean sports, beach activities, shopping and a large variety of great restaurants in Playa del Carmen. Walk 5th avenue at night to experience a carnival atmosphere with a taste of Europe. A safe and friendly family resort with a multitude of excursions for everyones pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Resorts are the best!”
Reviews.Author: gman015
Reviews.Content: If you want to enjoy a safe, affordable and outstanding service resort in Cancun or Playa del Carmen, go to a Royal Resort location. The Royal Hacienda is their newest resort and it gets better evey year.

Reviews.Title: “A Royal Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: cjaw288
Reviews.Content: True to form, the Royal Resorts will WOW you with the Royal Haciendas - from the welcoming staff, outstanding service, the Mexican motif, great restaurants, fabulous rooms, amenities galore and an ocean to swim in and enjoy! Very close to Playa del Carmen - SHOPPING!!!! and just a ferry boat away from Cozumel, and a brief ride into Cancun. What more would you want? Make your plans now!

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Want In A Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: My family has been going to the Royal Haciendas for the past four years, and we still enjoy this summer vacation. The resort staff is friendly and helpful. The entire resort is immaculately manicured every day. The villas have daily maid service. The resort offers shuttle service to Playa del Carmen, where there is an abundance of restaurants, shops, and entertainment. This is the place for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on the Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie623
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Royal Resorts for many years and have never been disappointed. We now own a week in March at The Royal Haciendas, but first owned a week in March at the Royal Sands in Cancun prior to construction of their Royal Haciendas resort here in Playa del Carmen. We love the ambiance of The Royal Haciendas, and are considering selling our lovely villa at The Royal Sands to enjoy a second week at The Royal Haciendas. The penthouse villa (upper floor) is lovely with not only great views of the resort and beach but also lovely decor in the villa. The "suite" portion of the villa includes the king size master bedroom, huge private bathroom, living & dining room, lovely kitchen, great patio with whirlpool and seating plus dining table and chairs. The "lockoff" portion is similar to a hotel room with two double beds, lovely bathroom and large closet, plus a kitchenette with refrig., microwave, plus coffee pot, and dinner + glassware to eat within the villa. The patio is small but has a great view. The resort is full of first class personnel, who will accomodate you in every way possible, and you have a personal concierge to answer questions and make arrangements when needed. This is not a resort for spring breakers, therefore, it allows couples and families the ability to fully enjoy this 5-star resort in style. Clicking on the resort info will show you the amenities included. I highly recommend this to anyone traveling to Mexico. Playa del Carmen has a European flair which is always wonderful with great restaurants and nightlife for all if on e desires, and the area is safe for those who want to experience all this area of the Mayan Riviera has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis on the Maya Riviera”
Reviews.Author: PhilKalina
Reviews.Content: We just spent our 4th week at the Royal Haciendas. Prior years, we stayed in a deluxe penthouse unit, a beachfront lock off, and most recently, a pool view suite. This resort was built in three stages and just completed a few years ago. The property is vast and it can take an hour or so to walk around all the grounds. This is certainly an upscale property, that caters to families and couples. It is close to the city of Playa del Carmen, but isolated by tracts of jungle. As you enter the property, you pass by new golf courses and golf resorts. The RH is near the end of the road, nestled on the shores of the Caribbean. The units are built around two pools, including lap pools and kiddie pools. Each of the two sections has its own pool bar/restaurant and heated public hot tubs. Children are not to be in these hot tubs without an adult, but this was not enforced. Our suite overlooked one of the hot tubs, and there was a fair amount of laughter and conversation we could hear, especially during Happy Hour (3-6PM). Still, the mood of the place was quite laid back, and you could easily find a quiet place on the beach, or in one of the several hammocks. The grounds are immaculate, and beautifully landscaped. As a photographer, I had plenty of photo opportunities. The pools are sparkling clean, heated (except the lap pools), and very well-maintained. The pools are infinity-designed, as you can look down the pool and see the Carribbean at nearly the same level. The La Palapa restaurant is the main eatery there. We just had a breakfast there once with our concierge. As others have noted, this is a weak spot of the resort, as the menu is varied, but uninspired. After a week, you easily get tired of eating there. It is beautifully positioned right near the water, and you can even choose a table outdoors, right near the beach. The other restaurant is Los Murales, an upscale seafood restaurant that we have enjoyed twice. My spouse had the coconut shrimp, which was the best I've ever tasted. I had the tuna, and it was cooked as I asked, with a pink center. The desserts are worth trying too. The murals on the walls are exceptional, and this is a very romantic place to have a nice dinner. Reservations are a must. We had a personal concierge, Arturo, who was exceptionally helpful at making our reservations, arranging our tours, and even delivering our tickets to our room. Mind you, we do not own a unit on this resort, but are members of the Royal Resorts in Cancun (Royal Islander). We were given every amenity that a resident member would be offered. There are several activities for children and adults scheduled throughout the day. This time, we preferred to be on our own. We would walk outside the resort in front, along the mangrove swamps. We saw and photographed many birds, including a pair of pygmy owls. We encourage guests to walk the beautiful beaches on the way to Playa del Carmen (about 2.5 miles). Once there, you can eat at any of the beachside clubs or restaurants. We ate at Mamitas, one year. and this year, Kool. The ceviche is exceptional. Prices can be a bit high, but you deserve the best after your trek along the beach. Venture into the city along 5th avenue for a shopping treat. The stores and eateries are diverse, and feature food and wares from all over the world, not just Mexico. Take a taxi back to the resort (about $10.00). We also went to Xcaret, which is a large eco-park that has various exhibits of native plants and animals, It also has an evening spectacular that dramatizes the history of Mexico with song and dance. It should not be missed! Puerto Morelos is a short drive north of the resort, and is a relatively untouched little town, with great restaurants and the best snorkeling on the Riviera Maya. I should mention that the units of the RH are very nice. Granite countertops, a hot tub on your balcony, upscale furnishings, etc. Maid service is offered every day except Sunday. I'm sure you can find a few negatives about the resort, but they are minor compared to the quality of the service, and superior atmosphere that has been created on this special oasis on the Riviera Maya. Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “best of playa”
Reviews.Author: tjleighton
Reviews.Content: The Royal Hacienda is a Royal experience to say the least. They customer service is top notch. The rooms are perfect and roomy, the views are outstanding, pools are huge and the beach is nice. The best part is traveling with family. They have a great kid program that keeps them busy throughout the day with various activities from making sand castles, pinata party, water balloon throw, soccer, ect. At night you can drop them off for a few hours and have dinner and a stroll on the beach while they watch a movie. There is a complimentary shuttle to town so no need to rent a car, taxi back if you want to stay out later. The beach is private and there isnt any peddlers, the resort is great at keeping it peaceful and very clean. There is complimentary snorkle gear and jackets for the kids, kayaking, noodles for the pool and an awesome happy hour daily. The grocery store is well appointed and priced great. We didnt go to the restaurants but ate at the pool daily for lunch, it was good and affordable. We did the buffet for breakfast but took it to our room for a more laid back approach to having breakfast but the view is nice from the beach front restaurant. There are two pools and take notice one is more laid back and quiet the other is louder, music, drinking and fun. All the activities happen there. Great place for families!

Reviews.Title: “All bases covered”
Reviews.Author: Melody M
Reviews.Content: First time at this resort and we would go again. Staff was friendly and happy to answer our questions. We felt safe here and noticed the security the resort supplied. Beaches were patroled continually,cameras and good lighting. Loved the beach service,those waiters sure put on the miles. We enjoyed the swim up bar and the great shrimp tacos. Lots of activities provided for our entertainment. Spanish lessons every morning ,really enjoyed our instructor Jorde. TV and internet were inconsistent,sometimes they worked and sometimes they didn't. The market was well stocked,reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mansana_Bonita
Reviews.Content: This resort would be lovely for families & retired couples but not for honeymooners. When we arrived, the service wasn't at the standard that we had recieved at other Mexico resorts. It was pretty ordinary in particularly at the front desk. The best service was from the bell boys & staff at the pool resruarants. When we saw our room (two small double beds) on the bottom floor at the back of the hotel, we were quite disappointed. We went to the front desk to see if we could have a room with one queen or king bed, they told us they didn't have any which I can understand however when I asked if they could change our room, higher or pool or beach room - they wouldn't even try! The hotel wasn't fully booked & it was our honeymoon. Apart from that the hotel was ok but we were quite upset with the standard of service from that day due to the importance of our trip

Reviews.Title: “My Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: M_DMester
Reviews.Content: The honeymoon at the resort was fantastic. The staff could not do enough for us to help make our stay enjoyable. We had a wedding ceremony on the beach on Monday, and Patricia the planner did a great job making sure everything was as we wanted. I can't wait to go back. We went into Playa Del Carmen to shop and eat a couple of times, and the food was very very good. Taxis into town were $10-$12. I hope we can spend all our anniversaries there.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed another wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: GrammaH
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a wonderful two weeks at the Royal Haciendas! The weather was awesome! The staff makes you feel so special! Everyone is so friendly and helpful! The activities personel are just wonderful with the kids! The grounds are beatiful with attention to all details!!! Can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: julesvurn
Reviews.Content: spent a week there, very much impressed with the accomodations, the location, the service, everything first rate, i was vacationing with the family and we had a wonderful time, most people have a time share there, we did not, that was not a problem at all. they have a huge place there with multiple swimming pools and we never had a problem with finding a place to swim or sit and relax, in the beach area there is a little bit more of competition to find places to sit and relax, but is never super crowded. It is not the best beach in the world a little bit too rocky and windy for my taste, but with so many swimming pools available is not a big deal. the big pools allowed for kids to swim and slopes progressively so that adults can swim with their kids. At times we would go with our kids to the children pools and most of the time we were there by ourselves. for people that want to go into playa del carmen take into consideration that the shuttle bus only provides service sporadically during the day and thus you have to book way in advance to get it. taking taxi will cost you around $15 dollars each way. There seems to be construction of a road that will potentially shorten the time and expense. the store in site is pretty good, you can find almost everything there. going to walmart in town could save you a couple of books.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort well cared for, with great staff”
Reviews.Author: MarinaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: I dont know how anyone could complain about this resort. It is almost new, well cared for on the grounds and in the room care. The cleaning staff go above and beyond as does all of the staff and the location is very close to Playa's 5th avenue..150 pesos cab ride. As a former hotel manager, I really appreciate how well organized and run this property is. If you can trade your timeshare to stay here, you wont regret it. The swim up bars are a real treat as are the fitness workouts you can get mid day in the pool. Beach is nice and swimming while not the best, a short walk can get you all that you need. Enjoy yourself and have the time of your life!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: PrairieItalian
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a stay at this resort. The resort has every amenity available, is very safe, and has extremely attentive and pleasant staff. We had a great condo near the main reception and market, which I preferred ( however, beach front would have been great too for the stunning ocean views!). I enjoyed having breakfast on the deck, and the outdoor hot tub in our suite was a hit with our kids. Other perks: - fun kids activities, great gym and plenty of beach front to laze,snorkel or walk along. - stunning golf course next door. - Regarding the restaurants on site, we thought the pool side grills offered great tasty choices, and didn`t mind the price at all. We only bought drinks at the pool side bar during happy hour. Some things I would change: less processed foods in the market on site, and infuse more local culture into the resort. At times we thought the atmosphere was a tad sanitized. We did have the benefit of staying the first few days of our trip at the Riviera Maya Suites in Playa del Carmen and prefered the convenience of its location over this one. All in all though we certainly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “royal haciendas”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: I'm a long-time royal resorts member,but this was my first stay at this property. It's quieter and more laid-back than the properties in Cancun's hotel zone, so a great place to "unlax". The restaurants are more limited in their menus and seatings, and you must shuttle (free) or take a taxi (not free) to go to Playa Del Carmen for shopping and/or greater restaurant selection.. Back on the plus side, it's much closer to good snorkeling and the eco-parks of Xelha and Xcaret. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “everything but the food”
Reviews.Author: LauraB09
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful. Food is only marginable. Food too pricey for the quality.The pool, rooms, service and beach are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gingerma
Reviews.Content: The whole place is just gorgeous! Staff is courteous and helpful. The free shuttle is great, take it in to town and get a $10 cab back whenever you're ready. We spent a week here in Feb. and will be back in Oct. for our regular week. Can't wait. Going to the Sands in May and 2wks in Oct. too. Cant say enough great thing about the Royals!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Front Accomadations”
Reviews.Author: Warren S
Reviews.Content: We joined relatives who are owner/members. We found property to be clean and tastefully designed, staff very courteous and friendly, restaurants very good. The activities were very enjoyable---yoga, spanish language class, water aerobics were three we enjoyed. Claudia was our maid and she provided excellent service. The yoga and Spanish instructor was also very good....Fabiola. Chris and Justin were our relative's concierge and provided personal attention and very nice perks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Lover025
Reviews.Content: My husband, two children (1 and 3 years old) and I stayed at the resort. The grounds were beautiful... the pools (including two children's) were great... the rooms (we chose one with a kitchen/living room) were clean and fantastic.... the service was great... the beach was icky (there was a ton of garbage washing onto the shore and I didn't see any employees picking-up the jugs, disposable forks, pieces of plastic and other trash). The beach wasn't also well raked... there was a lot of coral/seaweed that washed onto the shore. I would stay here again (definitely); however, there needs to be more clean-up on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: noraltc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in January 2012 and were very pleasently surprised by the whole property. The staff were cheerful and helpful, the entire place including gardens and beach were clean and very well maintained. A little out from the main centre of Playa Del Carmen but this was probably a bonus. The complementary shuttle bus to Playa did get fully booked early and the service stops at 6 pm which means you need a taxi if you choose to eat out. I would heartily recommend the Royal Haciendas for all visitors. Although really top quality accommodation it was also very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Hour - ding, ding, ding”
Reviews.Author: panter
Reviews.Content: Couldn't agree more with all the positive reviews. Grounds are beautiful, pools just the right temperature; rooms have everything you need and daily housekeeping to boot. Grocery store on the main level is pretty well stocked with all the necessities. We usually left the resort for dinner, but the poolside restaurants were great for lunch. Best was happy hour from 3 -6. all drinks 2 for 1 and they were strong. Lots of activities during the day. At night you could sit on the beach, and they projected movies from the side of resort. It was a nice touch. We were never approached to purchase a timeshare unit. Would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Hacienda Review”
Reviews.Author: Dot T
Reviews.Content: Wonderful resort. Well maintained, employees very courteous, and food is excellent in the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Rivera Mayan Location”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyTfromDallas
Reviews.Content: Facilities, staff, location of the Royal Haciendas combine to make this a perfect resort. Extremely clean, upscale amenities, restaurant is great. Beautiful beach, warm, friendly staff, and a close to everything location make this a wonderful home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, not an all inclusive fan!”
Reviews.Author: Nikki H
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th year staying at the Royal Haciendas and we just love it. All the servers are so nice and friendly. The food is good and they have great drinks. This is not an all inclusive but we just love it. You get what you pay for. We stay in a villa with my in laws and our two daughters and there is more than enough room. They are clean and very well kept. We will continue coming back here. So much space around the pools, great access to the beach, short drive into downtown and many kid activities without it being overwhelming. A great market to get supplies, food and beverage. We went up to Canun and stayed at an all incusive the last two nights of our 2 week vacation and we were homesick for the Royal Hacienda. We love it!

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather do an all inclusive”
Reviews.Author: steelchick
Reviews.Content: I have been to Riviera Maya 9 times in the last 4 years. This was my first timeshare exchange. I really missed the convenience of my food and drinks being included. These resorts charge a lot of money for food and beverages. We had to go out to Playa Del Carmen for dinner every night and it was quite expensive not to mention a hassle after being in the sun all day. The Hotel was very pretty but the water at this resort was not the beautiful blue color you associate with Mexico. We traveled south to Akumal Beach which had pretty light blue water and my husband snorkeled with the Sea Turtles. Aside from a dead body laying on the beach it was quite nice. Some poor man had gone snorkeling and must have had a heart attack, he was covered up with a blanket but his feet were sticking out, it was a bit disturbing. Cancun had the same water, really blue and pretty. We did a day trip to Xplor. My first time zip lining and it was fun. I have traveled to Xelha and found that park much bigger and nicer than Xplor, but we still had fun at Xplor. I would prefer to come back and stay at an all inclusive. We did have alot of fun and enjoyed our adventures nightly down to Playa, just pricey. We also found the Royal Haciendas boring, nothing to do in the evening thank God we went to Playa at night. One great place for pizza in Playa was Bip Bip, right on the corner of 5th and the Royal resort, we ate their twice. Also, Madre Tierra was a great place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 20th wedding anniversary vacation”
Reviews.Author: shalldog
Reviews.Content: We had heard not to travel to mexico, lots of our friends were concerned for us going. let me just say we never once felt unsafe or scared. we went into playa del carmen twice for dinner and to shop. The royal hacienda resort is a beautiful and unbelievably clean resort. the people were amazing the staff was amazing we had a fantastic time. We hope to go back spring break 2013 and take are two boys.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: This was a great place. Very low key, but nice. It had two pools with swim-up bars, nice places to eat and a decent beach.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: RCLINT12
Reviews.Content: Accomadations to the staff to the attractions make this a 5 star experience. The fact that there is something for everyone makes this a destination where you can't go wrong. We love it here so much that we will be coming back yearly for several years to get everything we want to do off of our bucket list. Thank you so much to The Royal Resorts and Thomas Moore travel for making our vacation one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort but something to know before you go....”
Reviews.Author: CocoCParis
Reviews.Content: Royal Haciendas is one of the best beach resorts I've experienced. The service is 5 stars, the staff couldn't be any friendlier, the villas are high end, the restaurants are wonderful, the gym is among best hotel gyms and the spa is world class. Here's the issue....some of the other guests. Because this is a timeshare type resort, many other guests are owners or "members" and feel that they own the place. In a sense they do, but if they wanted that type of experience, they should have bought their own vacation home, and not simply a fraction of one. I couldn't help but notice how many guests, especially the 60+ crowd, exhibited the "it's all about me" attitude. They would stake territory at the beach at 6am, then leave for 4 or 5 hours, despite the rule that this is not allowed for more than one hour. They would insist on bringing their small children into the whirlpools although 1) it's a health hazard to small children; and 2) it's against the resort's rules. Again, all about them. Guests would complain to the gym attendant that he was late in opening the gym at 7am, although he was in fact on time and in many cases, early. And after all, it's a vacation - lighten up!! Lots of very self-centered, typical baby boomer entitlement mentality. Another experience that was astounding...the resort offers a lovely complimentary coffee service in the lobby. It's nothing major, regular and decaf coffee, sweeteners, cream, cups, etc. Mostly for those waiting for an early morning tour or departure to the airport. While waiting to get a cup myself one morning, the woman in front of me (once again in the 60+ crowd) brought her in-room coffee maker carafe and filled it, leaving the pot completely empty, nothing for me or anyone else. And she thought nothing of it. Now there are at least 2 coffee makers in every villa and coffee can be purchased at a very reasonable price in the little market near the lobby, not to mention it can be purchased from the restaurants. Either out of cheapness or laziness, she chose to fill an entire carafe of "complimentary" coffee, once again exhibiting the "all about me" behavior. I would be concerned if I owned a week or more at this resort, that these would be the guests I may end up sharing the resort with for the next 40 to 50 years. No thank you!! Again, this should not reflect on the management of the resort - they are just stuck with such selfish people as guests and unfortunately, when they try to correct such problems, they get a backlash. It's unfortunate but Royal Haciendas is a wonderful five star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel/TimeShare!”
Reviews.Author: Marti S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I own a timeshare at the Royal Haciendas and we visit it every May (second week). Royal Haciendas has been around since 2006 and the resort is not only beautiful but also clean! The staff is second to none! I love the pool area and the pool bar and grill makes the best Shrimp Tacos ever! If you like alcoholic drinks, try and Clementina - it is delicious and also pretty to look at! We have never been disappointed with our time at Royal Haciendas. The restaurants are great, the activities are fun and it is a great place to stay! I would recommend this to anyone who hasn't gone - it's definitely worth a try! This is one of the Royal Resorts ( i believe they have 7 resorts currently) and I think this one is the best hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with all the comforts of home”
Reviews.Author: biffytreepod
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Haciendas for the first time 1/28/12-2/4/12. This is a timeshare property for those that aren't aware. We own a week at the Royal Sands in Cancun but had only visited for the day prior to this stay. We rented our 1 bedroom suite, master bedroom, kitchen/living room,directly from an owner via TUG-2. The resort is spacious but very easy to navigate. We loved the huge bedroom, bathroom, and deck with a jacuzzi. The weather was a little rainy so we spent more time in our unit than we planned so it was great to have the extra space. Check in was a breeze but we had an evening flight and came in after the rush. Everything was spotlessly clean and you constantly see staff cleaning outside. We purchased staples for breakfast to eat in our room at the onsite market. Prices are a little high but it's very convenient. There were many senior adults vacationing with their adult children and grandchildren. Some couples in the 40-50 age range. Overall, quieter than what we see in Cancun during our summer stays. Happy hour is held daily from 3-6pm at the pool bars. Drinks and beer are half price and free chips and salsa but make sure to get the menu to see what drinks are included. We ordered pizza twice in our room on rainy evenings when we didn't feel like venturing out and it was fast and hot. We ate a number of times at the pool grill and liked all the food we tried. We ate at La Palapa del Sol, largest restaurant on property, twice for dinner and lunch once for breakfast buffet. Service was great at every meal. Servers very personable. The breakfast buffet was priced well but could use a little better variety of foods. Lunch has a daily special that included salad bar, soup and desserts or you could order off the menu. This was a good value if you liked the entree special. Dinner had a themed buffet or again order off the menu. We aren't big buffet people so we ordered off the menu twice and food was good but basic. The resort offers free shuttles into Playa del Carmen but they fill up quickly so we only managed to use it once when someone cancelled. A round trip cab trip cost around $25 so we only ate out off property twice due to the cost and the weather not being great. The beach is nice and walkable in either direction. This isn't a great swimming beach but wasn't a big factor for us in January. People were saving beach palapas and lounge chairs at the pool but we still managed to find them most times without doing the saving game ourselves. Wifi is available but was really slow in our villa. We had better luck at the pool with our IPhones so that was fine with us. We did meet with a timeshare rep to see what was available but weren't pressured to do so. We did not buy and there were no hard feelings on either side. We didn't use the on resort travel services for any excursions because it was easy to use public transportation to get to whatever sites we wanted to see. I would definitely return to this resort in the future. I think our 19 & 21 y/o sons would prefer Cancun to this resort but for a quiet adult trip we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “family vacation or couples get-a-way...”
Reviews.Author: RJ_MN_01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at two of the other Royal properties (2) previous times, Royal Mayan and Royal Cancun. Since we enjoyed both of these location for our family vacation we decided to but a week every other year at this property, Royal Haciendas. My wife and our (2) children (11 YO girl and 9 YO boy) once again had a fantastic time. We loved the property it is set up so adults are not being run over by kids whereas children/teens do not feel overly confided or bored. The beaches are beautiful and great for swimming, snorkeling, or just laying out. The pools are huge and have separate areas to lap swim, lounge, or water play. The grounds are extremely well kept and as with all Royal properties we have stayed at they are constantly keeping up with maintenance. We were there over New Years and they said they were at 90+% occupancy for check in but we never felt over run with other gets or waited to anything. The restaurant on property has a great selection and is priced reasonable but they also offer a shuttle to down town Play for free at different times if you want to head down for shopping of a meal. The grocery on sight serves US brands along with very well priced local brands that are comparable quality. My family highly recommends this property especially after we have done a few group tours and herd form other guests at resorts their pain points (either crowded locations, poor service, over priced value). The service of waiter and cleaning staff was extremely good and friendly. By the end of the trip many of them knew our names and often greeted us by name when walking around property.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time.”
Reviews.Author: shhhitsasecret
Reviews.Content: This is our last night at RH, we head to The Royal in Cancun (real resort) tomorrow. This is the second time we have stayed at the RH both times have been good and with our families. My only con's of this resort are: 1. Nothing is open past 10:30pm. Although PDC is a $14.00 cab ride per 2 people. 2. Activites are geared toward children and/or seniors. 3. The food is very bland. My Pro's of this resort are: 1. Excellent dive center. 2. Best Massage ever in the Spa. 3. The employees are attentive to your needs. I am 35, this resort is perfect for families and senior citizens. For those looking for more nightlife I would suggest the Playacar resort area.....much cheaper to get to PDC even walkable and the playacar resorts are much more lively at night.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: Carlos G
Reviews.Content: We had such an amazing time. This place is so beautiful...pictures do not do it Justice. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “January is the time to go to this resort”
Reviews.Author: carhou
Reviews.Content: We had a lock-off, which was decorated nicely and had adequate room for the two of us. We had a small patio which overlooked one of the wonderful heated pools and a partial view of the ocean. Maid service was provided everyday. The resort provided free schuttle service to Playa Del Carmen, which was a tourist trap. The ocean was protected by the second largest coral reef in the world, allowing for calm waters. The beach was just as nice as Cancun's, but the garbage that floated up onto the beach was ugly and happened just about everyday we were there. Happy Hour-1/2 price for drinks, started at 3PM until??. We ate at the resort's eatery on the beach. Good quality, but nothing outstanding-I am not a fan of Mexican, but we did have various beef, pork and seafood options. We did the aqua aerobics, which was fun, and there were many side trips offered by Thomas Moore. We didn't do any of them this time but will next year. Quoting the Terminator-we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “If you know what to expect, it's a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: Sam C
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying facilities are overall really nice; decent rooms, great pools and nice spaces. We choose this hotel because of the price, reviews and pictures of the property. However, there were many things which set us off. 1. Beware of the "Ocean View"; it doesn't mean you are actually right next to the beach, but that you can had a glimpse of the ocean from your balcony. You can be right next to the lobby and will still have a slight view of the sea. 2. Junior suites actually have a two-bed configuration. No king size beds 3. We booked through Expedia; nowhere there does it say this is a time share. It wouldn't have mattered, if it wasn't due to the fact there was no shampoo and was not provided upon request. In general no amenities were provided. This should be let known in advance. 4. Picture in Expedia for the Junior Suite was actually for the king size Suite; the reception acknowledged there could be a mistake, but didn't give us a a king-size room, even though there was plenty of availability during our stay 5. In my opinion, there are not enough stairs to access the villas. You have to walk a lot in the halls. Why wouldn't they have a set of stairs per "building section"? 6. Page 8 of the welcoming package pretty much delivers the following message: "we'll try our best to attend to your requests; however, don't expect us to act quick and no, you won't be subject to any form of compensation... you are pretty much on your own". This might work for time share owners... but for guests like me? It was a little harsh and didn't like it. The same message could be delivered in a different way... or have a different welcome package overall for guests (meaning not-time-share-owners) 7. The room was supposed to have HDTV; ours actually had an old bulky TV instead If this was a regular hotel, this would have been an amazing stay; the way it is now, I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: tski_1999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Haciendas from Jan 7-14 and had a wonderfull vacation. We exchanged our timeshare through Interval for a studio unit which was more than adequate for my wife and I. The suite is the lock-off portion of the 2 bedroom villa and contained minor cooking appliances including a microwave, bar fridge, bar sink, toaster and enough dishes and cutlery for 2 people. It would have been nice to have a burner and frying pan but we easily made due. We ate all of our breakfasts in the room and enjoyed lunches at the pool bar. For dinner we ate at the beach restaurant 3 nights which was very good and the remainder of the nights went to 5th Ave in Playa. The store on-site was more than adequate and very well priced for a resort. We were assigned a concierge at check-in and received Arena who was excellent for advice and helped us the whole week. We did go to a timeshare presentation (they caught me at a good time during happy hour :0)). It was not high sales by any means but wished we would have skipped it which we have always done in the past. We attended the beach party and the taco party which were nice but not memorable as both started to have that flavour of an all inclusive which we try and do every year but also enjoy the timeshare experience. The pools and beach were great and we always looked forward to Happy Hour. As for tours etc we played golf at the course on-site. They do have clubs at the resort you can sign out for free but you should book in advance and if you are counting on a name brand set like Ping, Cobra, Nike etc you will be better off renting. My wife used the resort's clubs which were fine for her and I rented at the course as they didn't have any at the resort for me that day. The green fees were about $125 for a round before twilight which is quite reasonable and it cost $55 for the clubs which is pretty standard. The course is pretty new but is quite nice. We also rented a car one day to go see the ruins as we wanted to see a couple of them but didn't want to spend more than a day on an organized tour. (This was later reaffirmed when we passed a tour bus on the side of the road with a younger guy who had obviously enjoyed the party the night before getting sick behind the bus while the bus of about 40 people waited). The rental place on-site was very helpfull and for about $80 for the day we received a midsize car. I didn't find it that bad driving in the area with the exception that there are speed bumps everywhere that you have to watch for. The taxis and buses drive about 20 km's over the speed limit but you get used to them. We drove to Ek Balam first which was about 2.5 hours through Tulum and Coba. It had been reccomended to us by Arena to go there and we were glad we did as were able to climb the pyramid and it seemed like it wasn't as touristy (fewer buses). We then doubled back to Coba where there were a ton of buses and people but it was nice to see also. After seeing the ruins we stopped at a roadside restaurant in Coba for lunch which was really nice. Swung by Tulum on the way back to take some pictures and then back to the Royal Haciendas for dinner. We also used the fitness facility on a daily basis while we were there. It is very well equipped and we never had to wait for any equipment even during the busy time between 7:30 and 9 am. The one thing that we did notice at this resort was the pride of the staff and the actual owners of being a part of Royal Haciendas. You could tell alot of the owners new each other and were very welcoming to others. We popped into the sports bar one night and they were singing karaoke which really felt like we were at someone's house party. We haven't seen that at the other exchanges we have stayed at over the past years. We would definately return to the Royal Haciendas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful as Always!”
Reviews.Author: ktydlw
Reviews.Content: We are owners at the Royal Haciendas. We have never been disappointed! We were there this year the 1st week of November and then again New Year's week. The resort is spotless - both inside the rooms and on the overall property. We love the staff - they are extremely friendly. Arely is our favorite concierge. She always has a smile on her face and takes the time every day to walk around the pool and beach areas to check on the guests. She goes out of her way to be of assistance. Santiago is our favorite bell hop. Again, always a smile and knows the guests by name. The villas are truly like going home. The beds are extremely comfortable, the kitchens are fully stocked with dishes, cookware, utensils, etc. and the bathrooms are very large. The physical area of the property is large enough that you don't have to get up early to find a pool chair. The resort offers shuttle service into Playa until 6:30 pm. After that, you need to take a taxi which costs $11 for 4 people each way. The last free shuttle back to the resort is at 6pm. Playa has many amazing restaurants - most of which we found on trip advisor. The upscale restaurant - Los Morales - at the Haciendas is very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “It's an amazing property, best experience of my trip, beware of taxi”
Reviews.Author: PinkNeve31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, basically crashed with a friend last minute and it was such a pleasure. The rooms are basically beautiful apartments. There is so much space, full kitchen and bathrooms. Everything about it was perfect. We spent a lot of time in the back yard area where we blasted music and soaked in the private jacuzzi. No one complained about us, everything was spotless, and the privacy is surprising. There is every amenity you can imagine, right down to the king sized beds. The front desk didnt give our friend a hard time about adding guests last minute, like other hotels did. There were also pull down beds in the living room area, even these beds were incredibly comfortable, providing space for up to 8 people. There were a lot of families there, and seems like this particular hotel is preferred for families and couples. I loved this facility, however I did have one terrible experience that I must alert the public of so that you may protect yourself. There is one taxi service that runs throughout ALL the hotels. Although each taxi driver has to check in and notes which room they are taking where, the taxi and hotel are not associated with eachother. So, My purse string broke in the cab and my bag was left behind. The cab driver took my purse, did not report it to lost and found. The cab driver took my wallet and charged hundreds of dollars on my credit cards to local Autozone. All my cash, cards, phone,camera, etc were gone - mid trip. It was a night mare. Even though the hotel knows exactly who our driver was, and the police had his info, they did not pursue him and nothing was done to get justice, or return my belongings. So please be careful with your bags, and do not take an eye off your property. If anything is left behind, it will be taken. So keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own shampoo!”
Reviews.Author: jtfree
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back in the snowy Colorado mountains from The Royal Haciendas. It is a very beautiful property and we had a nice room at the front overlooking one of the hot tubs and a view up the beach to the North. We requested one bed but at the rate we payed, a "B" side is all we could get. The beds are small, (doubles), and the mattress could have been firmer for our liking. There are NO AMENITIES in the units as they are truly condos. A few bars of soap in the bathroom are all they supply. So bring your own and you won't need to meet with your "personal concierge" because the only thing Alan did for us was to give us our "welcome gift", (bathroom amenities) and invite us to meet Rigo at the taco party Tues. aft. We said hello as we enjoyed the free tacos and rum-n-cokes. Very nice, Thank You. Alan came by our cabana at the beach the next two days to remind us of the "low key" membership meeting with Rigo we needed to schedule. We were honest and told him we weren't interested in buying but he said that's OK, we could tell our family and friends about the opportunity. How about a discount on a couples massage or lunch? 20-30 minutes tops. OK, we'll meet and talk with Rigo. After lunch in The Palapa del Sol, (very good grouper, limited menu, especially drinks), it was off to the sales office to get the numbers. We again told Rigo we were not interested in buying any interval ownership anywhere. They tried one last offer of another week stay in the next two years, ($890 total. $250 deposit now, the rest refundable upon purchase) At this point it didn't seem to be a very low pressure presentation. We left and got back to the pool. The unit was very nice with a double granite vanity in the bathroom and also a nice kitchenette with it's own sink, mini fridge, toaster, coffee maker and microwave. No coffee/tea basket so again, bring your own. Filters were there as well as plates, glasses & flatware. The market on sight is great with prices comparable to the places we bought supplies at in town on 5th Ave. No ice machines anywhere so $2 a big bag wasn't bad. The resort is money free so everything has to be charged to your room and then when you leave you can pay in cash or Visa/Mastercard. No Discover or Amex. A mix of spanish and english channels on TV. Friendly staff, Carlos @ the swim up bar & Hugo in The Palapa are both great. Good food, we had breakfast the first morning and a couple of dinners in The Palapa del Sol. Also take out from Palapa Express for pizza one night, Great! Last night was our 22nd Anniv. dinner in the fine dining room, Los Murales. Very good but we should have asked how much the recommended local wine cost before uncorking it. It was good but we could have gotten a nice bottle of champagne instead. The North side up the beach has a chain link fence that's falling down and needs attention. Also a funky smell coming from that area. South towards Playa del Carmen was our preferred beachcombing stroll. Don't go looking for shells in this area. What we did find were small. We would return without hesitation, the mix of young families and retirees was pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Jamie H
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Royal Haciendas for the week after Christmas. Because there were 6 of us (adults) we had a 2 bedroom villa. Because we got the room for around $230 per night, it was a really affordable option for a family vacation (versus an all inclusive), especially over the holiday week when most hotels cost double. The room was amazing and very spacious- even for 6 adults. We were on the first floor of phase 1, and enjoyed being able to walk off our patio right to the beach. The whirlpools on the patios are a really nice touch and one of us enjoyed it daily. The kitchen is fully functional for cooking meals, and we took advantage of that. We bought food and beer from the Mega grocery store in Playa del Carmen, and this saved us a lot of money. Because we wanted to try some restaurants in Playa del Carmen, and we wanted to do a few days of excursions, we were glad we could find such a high quality resort that wasn't an all inclusive. Even though it is a time share, we never even got approached about purchasing. No pressure whatsoever. And while the resort was full during our stay, it is so spacious that it never felt crowded and we were always able to get beach chairs. One thing to note- this is a timeshare that operates on a Saturday-Saturday schedule. Because we were staying until Monday, we did have to switch rooms on Saturday morning. The resort moved us to the closest available room (only 3 down from our old one) and allowed us to switch at 9am because the prior reservation never showed up. It took less than an hour to move (with the help of a bellboy), and we considered it only a small inconvience. The only real problem we ever had is that the wireless is a bit unreliable, with sometimes it not working at all, but overall it wasn't a big issue for us. As mentioned in other reviews, the grounds are beautifully mainted, and the pools are gorgeous. The beach has nice sand, and lots of palappas and beach chairs. One side of the beach is more rocky, and one side more sandy. We did snorkle in the reef right off the beach and saw some decent fish and coral. As others have mentioned, the hot tubs could be hotter, and did tend to be full of kids. There really isn't much nightlife, if that is what you are looking for. Most of the nights we were pretty tired after activities or happy hour, and it was nice to just relax on the patio with some games and a Corona. We did enjoy some half price drinks at happy hour, 3-6, at the pool swimup bar that were delicous, but otherwise we didn't eat at any of the resort resaurants as they were fairly expensive. We also didn't use the resort shuttle, as we had rented a van (the resort provides free parking right outside our room). The Royal Haciendas did seem to be the closest resort to Playa del Carmen (besides Playacar) and we were glad we could get there in a short car ride. The location of Royal Haciendas really couldnt be better. 40 mins south of the airpot, 5-10 mins from Playa del Carmen, and 40 mins north of Xel-ha / Tulum. We did go to Xel-ha, Xplor, Tulum, and Akumal. All were amazing and I would highly reccommend them. Xel-ha is more of a snorkeling/drinking/relaxing day, and Xplor was more adventurous. The ziplines at Xplor were the best (and safest) I have ever been on. Most of Xplor's other activities are in caves, so I wouldn't reccomend Xplor for anyone claustrophobia. I would definitely reccommend at trip to Akumal- especially if you have your own car. It is a free beach, and you will find amazing coral and fish and sea turtles right off the beach! There is no need to pay for a snorkel trip. It is worth investing in your own snorkel equipment for a trip to the riveria maya if you like to snorkel. Best snorkeling we have ever had (compared to Jamaica, xel-ha, St Kits, barbados) and it was free. Overall, the Royal Haciendas is a great value for the beautiful spacious rooms. It is in a great locaiton to explore all the activities the Riveria Maya has to offer. The pools and beach are also great for just a day of laying in the sun and relaxing. We will definetely return to the Royal Haciendas next time we come to the riveria Maya.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Haciendas Resort”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Beautiful clean , spacious rooms . Beach was amazing with white sand and wonderful swimming areas . Staff were very friendly and helpful .

Reviews.Title: “Finally! Playa My Style”
Reviews.Author: hdbeachbum
Reviews.Content: After trying 4 other resorts in Playa, most all inclusive, I have finally found the PERFECT balance of class, comfort and flexibility. We were recommended by a friend who owns here and upon arrival things ticked along according to plan [most unusual im Mexico!] We enjoyed a premier suite for a reasonable cost and took advantage of the free shuttle into Playa to buy groceries at Mega and cooked great fish and seafood in our well equipped kitchen. When we did not feel like cooking there were numerous restaurants on site [one of which is very good] and the always available 5th Ave Stroll. The staff is very helpful and the entire resort is very clean and well laid out. The ocean view from our suite was the icing on the cake. Ownership is a serious option for me after this holiday and the sales center was not pushing or aggressive in any way. Give it a try...you might buy!

Reviews.Title: “5 stars all around”
Reviews.Author: kateReading_Pa
Reviews.Content: This is a timeshare location that we exchanged weith Interval. Elegant, Beautiful rooms, friendly staff, great activities- especially the yoga class. The water ws too choppy to use the kaykas or snorkel right from the beach but we took long walks on the beautiful beach. There is a small market on site with decent food. A free shuttle to town is available. We made the mistake of "buying" excursions from the airport but the staff made a deal with us and gave us a trip to Xel-Ha in exchange. Saved a bunch of money on that! Met some great people from other parts of the county.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: LovesTheBeach946
Reviews.Content: This is our family's sixth trip to a Royal Resort during the last week of the year. The first three trips were to the resorts in Cancun (Sands, Caribbean and Mayan) but the last three years have been at the Haciendas. We're a big group (17 in all) with ages ranging from 4 to 68, with teens, young adults and 40-something parents. Some of us like to sit by the pool or beach, others like more adventure, some like to cook in the condo and others like to eat out every meal. The Royal Haciendas works for all of us. The rooms are beautiful and spacious (we cooked Christmas dinner for 17 in one condo), the pools are wonderful and the beach is terrific. It is a quick cab ride to the wonderful restaurants in Playa del Carmen and various groups booked excursions (swimming with the dolphins was a favorite) through Thomas More travel, with pick up and drop off right in the Haciendas lobby! The only downside is that there is not much action at night (especially for teens and young adults) but we let them take a cab to Playa del Carmen every evening and eat and socialize on 5th Avenue. We always feel very safe, both at the resort and in Playa del Carmen.For the little ones (in our group 4 & 7), the activities are great. While I know that many people prefer all-inclusives, we love this because it allows you to eat at really interesting restaurants in the city, cook in the room or eat at the resort.....and it costs much less!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: RobinMtLaurel
Reviews.Content: Twice in one year! Yes, we so enjoyed our stay in January that we went again in May. The service is impeccable, the staff (hotel, concierge, bartenders, etc) are gracious, polite, and very attentive. The grounds and facilities are spotless and beautiful lush with Mexican flora and fauna. There is never a problem getting a lounge chair at the pool or the beach. The free shuttle to Playa is a great bonus too! The only problem is the long wait till we get to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Appeals to all travelers”
Reviews.Author: Cat_9079
Reviews.Content: The resort has beautiful rooms with balcony views, large bathrooms with granite and lovely tilework. Kitchenette (microwave, mini-fridge) and larger rooms have a full size kitchen, adequate for preparing meals and avoiding pricey restaurants on the property. Several pools and a beautiful stretch of beach, both of which are meticulously maintained. The resort is off the main highway 307 and just a block south is an OXXO quickie mart for water and other snacks. Also look for Soriana or other grocers for a longer stay. The atmosphere was very relaxed in December, mostly older couples and a few young families - not a party spot - very relaxing. Beware that service can be an issue - we were booked to an occupied room, and resolving issues takes a while. Also the power went out for several hours but did not disrupt our vacation. The hotel is very protective of their towels, and will ask you multiple times if they were returned even though every transaction requires a record on your room key. Note: a hold is put on your credit card upon check-in to cover any expenses at the resort then settled at check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: pier-c1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at three Royal Resort property's and enjoyed every trip. In December 2011 we booked our second trip to the Royal Hacienda. Royal Hacienda is a first class resort. The Staff and service is fantastic.The resort grounds and villas are beautiful and very well maintained. We took our grandson and he did not want to come home. So many activity's for children and adults. It is a true family destination and I would highly recommend Royal Hacienda!! One tip when eating at one of the pool bars ask for David Chimal. David's service and personal touch will make your lunch very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment”
Reviews.Author: Greg P
Reviews.Content: If you want to be treated like Royalty go to the Royal Haciendas in Pleya Del Carmen. Friendly knowledgeable staff that make your stay a memorable one. Spacious suites. Immaculate beach and pool area. Everyone is is treated like family, like you are at home with them.

Reviews.Title: “One word: Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Marie F
Reviews.Content: My parents visited The Royal Haciendas and loved it so much they bought a 50-year time share. My first experience with the hotel was last January and it was absolutely fabulous. Our villa was gorgeous and our personal concierge, Betty, was just fantastic. The staff is great about keeping the beach front clean and free of any trash as well as having fun activities. The rooms are always sparkling and the food is fabulous! Everything about the resort was first-class. The resort itself is located in a central area, so the drive to downtown Playa is around 10 minutes. The staff is great about making sure your travel accommodations are all set.

Reviews.Title: “When only the best will do!”
Reviews.Author: Ewp7773
Reviews.Content: The facility is always sparkling clean. The staff always smiles and is very helpful. The food all around the resort is very good quality and value. The beach is wonderful as is the assistants that bring us drinks. Very clean beach, pool and showers! WE LOVE IT ALL, and have been for a full week for the last 4 years, so we have the experience to speak:)

Reviews.Title: “Totally Relax @ The Royal Haciendas”
Reviews.Author: Nor-Cal_Chic
Reviews.Content: Yes, you too can totally relax without a care in the world! We stayed at this property (our first time) November 12th - 19th, 2011. We arrived at the Royal in a hotel/airport shuttle van and that's when the "royal" treatment began. Our suite was on the 4th Floor and was much more spacious than I expected. The partial ocean view spectacular from our lanai (in spanish?) had its own jacuzzi tub, WOW. The swim up bars... fabulous, the mojitos,the fish tacos... está buenisimo ! And the beach, wow the beach, every morning-every evening, deserved a walk on the beach, this one is very nice, not so much for snorkling, but for a dip or stroll, oh yes! The free shuttle in town (to Playa's famed 5th Ave) is a great deal - come home in a taxi if it's after 6:30, no problemo. The security is great, you never felt unsafe!! The grounds are lovely and well kept. The room service we used only once (after spending a long afternoon with the pool bartenders) and the Cheeseburger with fries, did the trick, very yummy. The grocery store on site, so convenient, we never had to go anywhere else for water, snaks, tequilla (the really good stuff), etc. The breakfast buffet was handy we'd go after our walk on the beach just about every morning, great made to order omlette, each day a little something different would appear, but the omlette station was a staple. Everyone is very helpful. We learned that this is a time share property but we really appreciated that we were not hassled, yet everyone went out of the way to make you feel extremely welcome. Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: kathyncny
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from the perfect vacation at the Royal Haciendas in Playa del Carmen. We have friends who have a time-share there and were lucky enough to be invited to stay with them for a week. Although it is a time-share, we never felt like we stood out and were being targeted to purchase one. If they were doing it, it must have been very low-key. We had never been to Mexico and stayed at one of these resorts because we have always done the all-inclusive resort. Having experienced the all-inclusive, this was a much quieter alternative. There was not constant activity and by evening, when you were ready to wind down anyhow it was quiet outside. At the all-inclusive resorts, it can tend to be noisy at night with the shows going on. Since we were with our friends, we had the B suite but, of course had access to the other living quarters there as well. The kitchen in the A side is fully functional and we were able to have a few dinners in and not go out to dinner every night. However, we did have breakfast on the balcony every morning and usually lunch as well. If you are considering a stay here and you wouldn't be using both sides, I would recommend you spend the extra money and take the A side. If you are in the B side alone, if would be difficult to have any more then snacks in your room. Mexico is not inexpensive anymore. You can expect to pay the same price for drinks and meals as you do at any nice restraurant in the States. There is a "happy hour" that starts at 3:00 every day though where the drinks are half-price. We did experience the dining at the seafood restraurant at the hotel. It was absolutely superb in every way! The service was impeccable, food fabulous and presentation picture perfect. It happened to be my husband's birthday the night we went, and they brought out a beautiful flaming dessert compliments of the restraurant. Don't miss going there! The beach was lovely and clean. The left side of the beach is probably better for swimming. The right side of the beach has some rocks but is good for snorkeling. Do not miss walking on the beach. Come out of the hotel, turn right and just beyond the bend is the most amazing beach you will ever want. The day we walked down there, I felt like we must have just died and entered the gates of heaven. It was breathtaking! The service was great everyplace. The people working at the hotel are very friendly and courteous. Your room is cleaned thoroughly every day - including, wiping down completely your balcony. If you go, I think you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for another great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: clp8413
Reviews.Content: I'm so happy that we made our 3rd visit to The Royal Haciendas during Thanksgiving week. Although we're not owners, we received the exact accommodations we requested and had a beautiful view of the Caribbean Sea. Everyone is always very helpful here, from the reservations staff to the wait staff at the pool, and especially the kids' club folks, whom we visit quite often, as we have a 7 year-old and a 5 year-old. A special "shout out" to Jorge, who kept our kids entertained during our stay and provided restaurant recommendations for the future. In addition to having a ton of activities for kids, there are also multiple activities for adults and teens and many golf course options nearby. Or, you can pull up a chair by the pool or beach and just enjoy a day in the sun. The condo-hotel rooms come with a fully-equipped kitchen. The bathroom has double sinks, but our 1-bedroom suite only had a shower, no bathtub. Laundry is on the first floor and 2 loads cost $7 USD. There is also a grocery store on premises with US brands, including half-and-half, which seems to be hard to find at the grocery stores in PDC. I have never visited the spa, so I can't make any comments. For those of you wondering if it's safe to visit Mexico, the answer is "yes!" We rented a car, drove all over and felt safe the entire time. The Royal Haciendas is a short distance from the town of Playa del Carmen and we drove into PDC almost every evening. We also visited Xplor and Croco Cun Zoo, but mainly hung out at The Royal's beautiful pool and beach. It was a highly preferred way to spend Thanksgiving, rather than being in the kitchen all day! In fact, we enjoyed a great Thanksgiving Day dinner at Los Murales that evening. Thanks again for making our stay so much fun and relaxing -- which was just what we wanted. We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, can't wait to go "home"”
Reviews.Author: lorienborzoi
Reviews.Content: When you own here, it is referred to as "Home" with good reason. The accommodations are comfortable and always the cleanest. Staff has always been eager to help, greatest dive shop on the Yucatan. Easy place to really relax.

Reviews.Title: “A week at the Royal Hacienda”
Reviews.Author: pearlhouse
Reviews.Content: Our most recent trip to The Royal Haciendas just north of Playa del Carmen. First off the weather really stunk!!! This was a week (October 15-22, 2011) where the whole area was under a tropical depression, which meant rain and more rain and cooler cloudy days where it even made it hard to use the pool unless you were a polar bear. Started raining right after our arrival Sat morning. I hope you can understand that when I write a review I include lots of details about our whole vacation. Some of this stuff will bore you, but my reasoning tells me that there are a lot of first timers out there going to Mexico that want this info. There were four of us, my brother and I and our wives, so we opted to book our own private transportation with Thomas More travel. All the Royal resorts are associated with Thomas More travel as their transportation and tour representatives. I did this in advance per the internet. Cost for all four of us was $150 US roundtrip. All we had to do was claim our baggage and proceed out the door of the terminal where all the cabs and vans were located. I had printed up a voucher to present to a Thomas More Rep. who was dressed as described in blue and yellow. Very easy to find as there were several of these reps just waiting for us. He took all of our bags and led us to an area (about 25 steps) where there were several vans waiting. He took my voucher after I signed it and gave it to a driver who loaded our bags and we were off in a matter of minutes. It’s a good 40 minute ride to the R. H. Since this was our own private van my brother asked the driver if he could stop at a store for us to pick up some essentials. No problem. We got a case of beer and some bottled water and some snacks etc. and were on our way. When we arrived at the R.H. we were met at the front lobby by a hostess and a young lady (Sophia) who ended up being our concierge for the week. Everyone that checks in gets a concierge assigned to them for the time they are there. Whether you want use them is up to you. She quickly looked us up on their list of arrivals found our names and gave my brother and I a form to fill out, and then showed us the front desk where we would check in. We were able to sit down at a table with some very comfortable lounges to fill out the info. I had booked (2) 1bedroom suites through Interval International. I am not an owner at R.H. so I had traded our timeshare for one of the 1 BR suites. After I had done that at home 2 weeks later I found a getaway on Interval Int. for another exact same 1 BR and the same week, so I immediately booked it also. This was a real bargain at $237 for the week. The table we sat down at had a stack of rolled moist towels to use for cooling off, which the women thought was a really nice touch after our long journey from Cleveland, Ohio. After we filled the forms out we presented them to the clerk at the desk who was just waiting for us to check in. He was a very nice guy who joked with us the whole time throughout the sign in procedure. Since the wife and I had been to other Royal Resorts several times we were familiar with the check in process, but never the less he explained the whole process for my brother and sister-in-law. He gave us our unit keys along with a map of the resort and showed us where our units were on the map. He gave us a phone number to call once we were in our rooms so we could have our bags delivered. As we set out for our rooms our concierge saw us and offered to lead us directly to them. We had hoped our rooms would be together but ended up with a couple of units in between us. We had D324 and D328 which were located in the first phase of the resort. Once we were in our units Sophia showed us all the features including our own private Hot Tub which was located out on our balcony which overlooked the resort and also a beautiful ocean view. We could even see Cozumel out in the distance. As near as I could tell most all units should have some kind of a view of the ocean. Really nice comfortable furniture on the balcony, a table 4 chairs and a couple of extra reclining chairs with foot rests so you could really lounge if you wanted to right next to the hot tub. All granite counters in the kitchen and also in the double sink bathroom. The shower was all marble very large which my wife really liked. Sophia gave us her work number and said we could call her with any questions that should come up or to arrange any side trips that we might be interested in. Our other choice for side trips would be to stop at the Thomas More travel desk. Also she told us about the two free parties that were put on by the R.H. One on Monday and the other a Taco party on Tuesday. She also explained to us about the orientation meeting in the morning in the sales office room. This was just a general information gathering about the resort and the resort facilities. Never the less there was coffee and an excellent selection of pastries for all. It lasted less than an hour. Both parties were to be held by the pool but the rain took care of that and both were held in the sales office room also. The first included entertainment brought in from the Mayan show at Xcaret with Beer & Rum and coke along with a range of soft drinks and some snacks. The taco party offered all the Tacos you could eat with all the trimmings. Beer and soft drinks were also available. This is where Sophia introduced us to a sales manager and we thought the sales pressure was about to begin. But much to our surprise he only asked us how we came about getting our weeks reservations. Then he asked if we would meet him for breakfast in the morning at the La Palapa del Sol buffet. We hadn’t tried the breakfast buffet yet so we said yes. After we unpacked we made a trip down to the market store. Here we bought some breakfast items including coffee, orange juice, eggs, cereal etc. Also we bought some soft drinks and more snacks to last us for the week. The market has a little bit of everything. Food, beverages, snacks, a complete liquor wine selection and a decent selection of drug store supplies. Wednesday morning we met with the sales manager for breakfast. During the breakfast he explained how they still had some time share weeks left to sell at the R.H. He explained the benefits to owning a week at the R.H. and the pricing. That was it! This took about 5 minutes. He said if we were interested we should contact our concierge (Sophia). The rest of the breakfast he gave us a wealth of information about Mexico and told us about his life since growing up as a kid and his good fortunes as a sales manager. The breakfast was excellent with a lot of choices. An omelet station, waffles, eggs to order, my wife even asked for Huevos Rancheros (her favorite), and the chef took her over to the kitchen and had someone make up a dish just for her. There is a free shuttle into Playa del Carmen, all you have to do is call your concierge and sign up for a departure and return time slot. The shuttles do not run at night so you must take a cab back if you stay late. A cab ride back to the resort was about $10 for the 4 of us. Playa is a typical Mexican town with lots of booths and stores selling all sorts of stuff from silver jewelry to t-shirts etc. When you purchase from these people you really need to turn on your bargaining skills. I really like to do this as I consider it just one big game. Most of the time I end up buying nothing because I have offered to little and the seller acts like he is offended. But then as you walk away if you are close to his minimum price he will follow you and try to compromise with you. They too love to play this game so don’t let them try and embarrass you into agreeing on their price. As we walked the streets we also past many restaurants and open patio type bars where you can just sit by the street side and enjoy a cool drink and enjoy Mexico. Our first trip into town was to a restaurant that our concierge recommended to us as being genuine Mexican food. Since she lived in town this was a place she stopped at often for her breakfast before coming to work. It was within walking distance of where our shuttle had let us off. Name of the restaurant was La Cueva del Chango where we had a late breakfast. This was truly a great Mexican breakfast. You won’t believe all the ways they can serve eggs the Mexican way. A couple of days later we went back again to sample more of this great food and we were not disappointed. Lots of different ways for Mexican omelets, crepes and also their home made plum preserves also including you guessed it my wives favorite Huevos Rancheros. After our first breakfast we walked down the street about ¼ mile to the beach took our shoes off, and than walked along in the sand towards the pier that has the Cozumel ferry, about a quarter mile walk than back to where we met out shuttle back to the R.H. Being as we are familiar with all the Royal resorts in Cancun we made a 1 day side trip to the Royal Sands. They run a large shuttle bus from the Hacienda to the Sands on Thursday for only $9USD /person each way. We took this shuttle in the morning and spent the whole day at the Sands. We enjoyed both pools; one was a lot warmer than the other. I can’t explain this. We had lunch at the restaurant pool side. More swimming and also a walk along the beach. The wall of sand that was put up when the beach was washed out a couple of years ago is now slowing flattening out, although there are still areas where it is still over 2 feet high. At the end of the day we showered and got dressed and walked over to the Hacienda Sisal for dinner. That night they were having a Mexican buffet and featured Mexican dancers as the entertainment. After words we walked back over to the Sands and got a cab back to the R.H. We couldn’t take the shuttle back because it left earlier about 5pm. The cab ride was kind of expensive for the 4 of us. I can’t remember exactly but it was about $50 bucks. The cabby wanted to charge us more than the rate we were given when we left our resort. So I had to get the door man at the Sands involved and than we found out all the posted cab fares at the front desk were all out of date. This is something all Royal resorts should look at and keep it up to date. It was a long wild ride back to the R. Hacienda as this cabby had his speedometer disconnected and also all the other dashboard gages were not working. So he didn’t know how fast he was going and how much gas he had. He had to stop and put in a couple of extra liters. He drove like a wild maniac and in the dark and I was starting to wonder. Along the way we were stopped twice at check points by police who wanted to know where we had been and where were we going. After flashlights shined in all of our faces we were allowed to continue. But all in all it was a great day. One day the wife and I took a walk along the beach (south) towards Play del Carmen. This walk was probably the best I have ever had along a beach. The shoreline was almost flat down to the water so it made it very easy to walk. We walked about ¾‘s of a mile almost into town. The sand there was very very fine and almost pure white. I couldn’t believe along the way there was absolutely no debris of any kind, even though most of this shoreline is unused and just overgrown with trees and weeds. No seaweed, no tree limbs, no rocks, no dead fish, just pure white sand. The only person we saw was a fisherman checking his fishing nets and than on the way back we met another couple taking the same walk we had just taken. A couple of days later we took a walk towards Cancun (north) and this was totally different. Lots of washed up seaweed, logs and all kinds of other debris which I cannot explain. We walked about the same distance ¾’s of mile or so. Walking in this direction we passed several resorts but none were of same caliber as the R.H. We ate most of our meals at La Palapa del Sol the Royal Haciendas main restaurant.. Between the 4 of us I don’t think we had a bad meal. Most of them were excellent. Salads at lunch time were very good. Dinner time we ordered mostly from the menu. I will say by the end of the week the menu was a little boring. Saturday & Sunday night we had the themed buffet, Caribbean on Sat and Mexican on Sun. Both were excellent as there were more choices then I could actually try. One night we made reservations and had dinner at Los Murales Seafood Restaurant & Bar. This is a very nice quiet restaurant where you can have a semi private meal away from all others if you choose. We all started with a specialty of the house drink. We split two appetizers and each had a main dish along with 4 deserts. The food presentation was excellent with a lot of caring detail put into each dish that was served. The four us all rated our meal as medium to medium plus, 3 on a scale of 5. My brother paid the bill so I don’t know what the grand total was but a good estimate would be $250 -$275. Another night we had pizza and salads delivered to our suite for dinner. Drinks at the Rotunda bar in the evening were a little pricey $6 - $8. This bar is located just off the main lobby. As this bar is in the round it has several doorways that lead to various parts of the resort. This was the only bar open in the evening so you are sort of a captured audience. Even though this was the only bar open in the evening it closed at 10pm every night. That seemed a bit early but then there weren’t many people using it. There are two halves to this resort. Each half is shaped like a horseshoe. Thus phase I and II. Each phase has a very large pool with a pool bar. Each phase also has a lap pool which is used for exercise and games like volleyball. I believe there also two kiddie pools one on each side. We didn’t get to spend as much time as we would have liked at the two pool bars. The Phase I bar seemed to be more popular. But the music they played wasn’t to our taste. So we tried the other pool bar in Phase II. Carlos was the bartender at this bar. The music was much more to our liking so this became our afternoon hangout. If the weather would have been co-operative we would have spent more time here. We mentioned to him that we liked the music at his bar a lot better and he smiled. Then he told us if there was anything we wanted to hear he would change it for us. One day we asked him to crank it up a little because things were quiet. Another day we asked him to turn down the volume a little. Carlos was a very active bartender flipping liquor bottles around just like Tom Cruise did in his movie. This was just a little side entertainment. On three of the mornings our wives attended a yoga class. My sister-in-law is really into this stuff so she convinced my wife to join her. She said they were really well run and very similar to those she attends at home. The wife and I will probably return on our next trip to Mexico. On our previous trips to the Cancun area we made several side trips exploring the area. This week we just wanted to veg out and just enjoy each others company as well as the resorts facilities. All in all this is a very beautiful and well run resort. Five Stars all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: It is our third time staying here and we are never disappointed. Each visit makes you want to come back. Great suites with full kitchen, expansive balconies to watch the sunrise with coffee and see the sunset from your outdoor tub, great wait staff, good poolside service and restaurant.
