The hotel always feels uncrowded due to the large hotel grounds compared to the number of rooms. We plan to keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: shuytza
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week in a 1BR at Royal Haciendas. The suite was very spacious and well laid out. The bathroom was positioned so that you did not need to disturb the people sleeping in the other room. The beds however were not very comfortable. The murphy beds were very hard. The master bed has plastic pad which made sleeping uncomfortable. There were only 4 pillows in the unit for 4 people. Only 3 thin blankets. Only 4 not very large towels and 4 very small ones. So, basically, they provided the bare minimum, and none of it was luxurious by any standard. There was a Jacuzzi on the balcony which was awesome. The resort is beautifully maintained. The hot tubs are actually hot. The beach is very nice, but there are rocks in the water and see urchins too, so you need to be careful. All in all good, but needs some small touches to make it perfect.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING week”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week stay at The Royal Haciendas. We cannot be more appreciative of the service we received while staying there! My watch needed a new battery and I told our concierge, Justin. He took my watch and had it repaired at no cost to me. Our maid, Elisa, was fabulous and everyone was so friendly. The property is immaculate although the beach does leave a little to be desired but we knew that going in. The Riviera Maya is an up and coming region of the world and the people love to talk about their history. We booked 2 trips through the Thomas More desk at the resort and the tours were both bargains due to the content and guides. The resort offers a free shuttle at regular intervals into Playa del Carmen until 6:00 PM which was a valuable asset. We did not buy a unit this trip but it is definitely on our minds for the future. The sales staff is not pushy at all and very informative regarding the assets to the owners, employees, and community. Royal Resorts offers continuing education for their employees, shuttles to and from work as well as many other perks. We ate mostly at the La Palapa del Sol which was good food for the money but did not eat at either of the poolside diners. Our last dinner was at Los Murales, it was nice and the food was good but we enjoyed La Palapa del Sol more. Happy hour was used daily and there was some inconsistency of potency but it was normally stronger than weak. Alexander, at the poolside sports window in phase 2 was always a joy to joke with as well. We traveled this time without our kids but will most likely take then when we return. This was a fabulous, relaxing trip to celebrate our anniversary. It was hard to leave but we left saying "See you later" instead of "Goodbye".

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: TurquoiseWaters92
Reviews.Content: The most beautifully groomed resort that we've ever stayed in. Rooms were fine but the grounds were what amazed us. Nice sand beach that was clean. Friendly staff. Dive Balam shop right on grounds. Dives were a little pricey but convenient access to dive boat right on beach. Handy shuttle to Playa del Carmen but we didn't enjoy spending time in town. Too much pandering. We enjoyed the convenience of the store at the resort. Was much easier than hauling groceries from town. Our only complaint about the resort was the lukewarm hot tubs.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing suites - really large property - OK pool service”
Reviews.Author: ABitSpoiled
Reviews.Content: This is our first time here. If you've never been here before, this is how the rooms work. People own these units, and if you are not an owner, then you are renting from one who is. A "village" consists of one suite (approx. 800 sf) and one bedroom (approx. 300 sf). The suite has a fully equiped kitchen, a dining room, a living room, and a private separate bedroom with a spacious bathroom. There are also 2 murphy beds in the living room, which is very spacious so it is not crowded at all. It also has a very large balcony with a table for 4, 2 lounge chairs, and a jacuzzi tub. The adjoining bedroom has a separate door, and it is more like a standard hotel room: one bedroom, bathroom, and a small kitchenette with a micro, sink, small fridge, and coffee maker and some utensils. To make a long story short, be sure to check if you are paying for the suite or the bedroom. The suite we have is very nice and one of the nicest places we've ever rented in this area, so you will not be disappointed. There are a couple of negative things we have to say about this place. The property is VERY LARGE, there are only 2 restaurants on site, and you have to take a taxi to go anywhere ($10 one way). There is a free shuttle from the hotel to PDC, but you have to make reservations in advance. The service at the pool is below standard based on all of our previous stays in the Cancun/PDC area. We are used to the usual excellent service of the pool staff in Mexico; however, either there were not enough servers during our stay, or they just are not too much into customer service here. All in all, I would give a 5/5 rating to the room, a 3/5 rating to the amenities and conveniencies at the hotel, and a 3/5 to the service. One good thing that I must point out is that the supermarket at the hotel has very good prices, so don't hesitate to shop on site. You'll find almost everything you need at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Resort on the Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: RCuevas
Reviews.Content: The Royal Haciendas recovered nicely from tropical storm Rina. They were prepared for a hurricance, but luckily it didn't hit the coast as one. When we arrived on October 29, you couldn't even tell there had been a storm. The broken branches and flotsam were gone and the resort was spic and span. We traded our Hawaii Marriott timeshare to come to Playa Del Carmen, and I think we got the better deal. Our villa was facing the ocean in Phase I/II and it was a beautiful view. The third floor offered a terrific view of Cozumel and later in the week, the cruise ships departing on a clear night. This resort is staffed by tremendous people. the check in experience was quick and the staff were able to answer our questions or point us in the right direction. We had our own concierge, actually two, Arely and Luz and they saw to our needs and inquired about our stay often. Being a time share, we were not pressured into a presentation and that makes the stay so much more enjoyable. The villa's were of good size, over 1,000 feet with a jetted tub on the balcony, which was easily big enough for six people. Being in the C building, it was very quiet, though you could hear the ocean breaking at night. The beach was clean and maintained, the water was warm and clear. Not a bodysurfing beach, but easy to swim around and there are enough fish to make snorkeling worthwhile. The restaurants, the Palapa is mostly buffet, andthe one night we went, was asian night with teppan style cooking along with some sush rolls all worth the price. LOS MURALES, the higher end restaurant I've reviewed separately, this one is a keeper and should be a destination point for those close by. The table side prepared shrimp Caesar is a great way to get things started. I'm sorry to say I forget the Manager's name of the restaurant, but he was also terrific. He remembered us, made sure there were black napkins for those with darker clothes, (like I knew that mattered, but my wife did and she was pleased) The Rotonda bar was staffed by Leonardo and Bernardino, well chosen for this site. The happy hour was rollicking most nights and honestly, the regular price of drinks made happy hour the perfect draw. Caipirinhas were wonderful and the guys represented the resort spirit well. The one "complaint" we had was the drinks they served at the beach. They are high priced, low alcohol concoctions that were more reminiscent of a virgin daiquiri or colada. And we met four other people who felt the same. I'd advise that they could learn to pour from the Rotonda staff. We did bring this issue up with the beverage manager Teodoro, who gave us the opinion he was taking our issue under advisement. It was a good dialogue. The store on site was priced decently, better when you take into account what a roundtrip cab ride would cost ($24 or more with tip). We bought enough for 5 breakfasts and two lunches for $60, which is about 1/3 of what the restaurant would cost us. They had most of everything we needed, though I'd request a few more diet options. This resort is the place to go if you want to relax. It's pretty quiet, there are plenty of options for trips, sightseeing, scuba team is on site, but the hammocks also present a nice option. I'd recommend it highly and suggest you tell your friends.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Royal Haciendas...You are amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Robinann
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort the past four years and every visit has been fabulous! The grounds are magnificent, the setting consists of two huge courtyards surrounded by attractive low rise villas. Every villa overlooks the Caribbean and each courtyard has a huge pool with a swim up bar, a lap pool, a kiddie pool, two gigantic hot tubs and an activity desk for towels and sporting equipment. You will find dozens of hammocks to relax in the shade or scheduled activities in the pool, like aqua aerobics or pool volleyball. The beach is lovely with an area for swimming and a small reef area for snorkeling, snorkel gear is provided free of charge. Beach volleyball is offered every weekday at 3:00 which always provides for a fun afternoon. The resort offers free Kayaks for their guests as well as wave runners to rent by the hour or half hour. The activity desks has golf clubs for your use or you can rent top brand clubs as well. There is a 9 hole golf course adjoining the resort which will be an 18 hole course before too long. The dive center offers scuba excursions right off the beach. There is an activity board posted through out the resort so you can keep track of the fun things to do during your vacation. They even offer a ceramics area where you can paint a souvenir to take home and don't worry if you feel you aren't talented enough to paint. The gentleman who runs the shop is wonderful at embellishing your work and will make it look professional, if you want. Once you check into the resort you will be assigned a personal concierge who will welcome you with invitations to the orientation on Sunday morning, a welcome party on the pool deck on Sunday afternoon and a taco party typically early in the week, all free of charge. Your concierge is also always ready to help with reservations at the spa or local restaurants or give advice on things to do and see in the area. The Spa is a full service facility that is connected to the main lobby. My husband and I had a couples massage and it was a lovely experience, or if you want you can have a massage on the beach. There are two pool grills which serve food during the day, two of our favorite meals are their shrimp tacos or a grouper sandwich, prepared to your taste. There is a huge palapa which houses a restaurant facing the beach, open for breakfast, lunch or dinner with a different theme buffet every evening or you can order off the menu. They also offer a take out window with delivery to your villa if you would rather stay in for dinner. Los Murales is an elegant seafood restaurant on site but we have never eaten there, maybe next year. The resort offers a shuttle to and from town if you want to shop or try one of the hundreds of restaurants in Playa del Carmen. Unfortunately the shuttles last trip to the resort is at 6:00 PM which means you have to get a cab back to the hotel if you stay in town for dinner, fortunately cabs are plentiful, just make sure you confirm with the driver before you get in his car that the trip will cost no more than $10. We always rent a car at the airport for the week and then we have our freedom to drive to the resort and into town whenever we would like. This year Playa del Carmen and the Mexican riviera was threatened with hurricane Rina during our stay. At first we were concerned but everyone reassured us that we would be safe and they were taking precautions. We were amazed as we watched every staff member pitch in and remove or secure anything that could be blown away during the hurricane. The resort did ask us to bring our patio furniture into our room the night before the hurricane was expected to hit as a safety measure, which we did. The villas are beautiful and spacious and even bringing the lounge chairs and table and chairs inside didn't cramp our space. The day and night the storm hit was a rainy and windy experience but the next morning we woke to sun, and again every employee seemed to be there cleaning up after the storm. We were completely impressed as we watched the house cleaning staff, waiters, supervisors as well many many others carrying lounge chairs, putting up umbrellas, sweeping the mounds of sand off the pool decks and out of the pool. By 10:00am the guests started venturing outside and the resort was up and running. Thank you, Thank you Thank you everyone at the Royal Haciendas for making us feel safe and secure during hurricane Rina and for giving us back our vacation so quickly. We can't wait to come back and next year I think we will plan to stay two weeks at the Haciendas!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, not very mexican”
Reviews.Author: crvicunav
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great, be sure to book the villa (A), not the suite (B) so you can get the jacuzzi in the balcony. Staff is firndly but busy. I would visit the resort again. Palapa restaurant is allright, and delivery pizzas are excellent. The store is a bit overprized, but is useful to avoid a trip to Playa del Carmen. Pools and beach are excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Everything is really good...except the service...”
Reviews.Author: Djmenaka
Reviews.Content: This resort combines traditional colors and rooftops of mexican culture, with excellent resort design. Five pools, two huge jacuzzis (which were cold all the time), two pool bars with great cocktails and fast food, and many amenities such as game room, scuba shop, restaurants, bar, kids room, and much more. Service in general is OK, its the bar tenders in the pool bars who think they can say what ever they want, just because you´re having fun and drinking in front of them. Its just a shame.... If you land in Cancun´s airport, you should rent a car to get to Playa del Carmen and to visit all the archeological sites in the peninsula. DONT GET THE GPS SERVICE!!!! its totally not worth it !!! There are only like 3 mayor roads !!! Tip: You have to visit Chichen Itza, Coba and Tulum archeological site. You shoul do it in one day, so you dont have to use beach days on this. Now here´s the tip. Start early, by going north towards Cancun, and then west to Chichen Itza, it will take you about 3 hours, you´ll spend like 2 hours visiting the piramids at a good pace, so the morning is gone. Then go south towards Coba. Its a one hour trip and on the site you´ll spend a little less than an hour. After this, go south-east towards Tulum. Its a one hour ride, and there you´ll see the site in one hour and a half, and spend the rest of the afternoon on the site´s beach, which feels amazing. Then you´re ready to go back and take a well deserved swim in the pool ! If you´re not a fan of the beach or prefer the beach in Cancun, you can do the circuit the other way around and end the day in Cancun shopping or on the beach. Believe me, doing this circuit, you´ll save a lot of money, time and its completely worth it ! Playa del Carmen will become mexico´s top beach spot in the near future, no doubt about it. But I wouldnt come back. I believe there are too many awesome spots to visit in the caribbean and worldwide. It still was a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “FUN!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KevinE
Reviews.Content: We had a great vaca - Balam Dive shop has a boat right on the beach - they were real pro's. They ROCK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Way better than an all-inclusive!”
Reviews.Author: spike489
Reviews.Content: Well, it’s been a long time coming, but since we’ve been ‘jonesing’ about our next trip, I thought it appropriate to write a review of our favorite spot to stay in Mexico thus far. First, let me start by saying that we are not timeshare owners, and probably won’t ever be. However, we do love the Royal Haciendas. And to us, the Haciendas represents our evolvement in travel to Mexico. When we first started going south of the border, we thought all-inclusives were the only way to go. But after the first time we went to a non all-inclusive, we almost immediately outgrew them. I’m sure some of you will know what I mean when I say they definitely draw a different crowd. At the last all-inclusive we stayed at, we passed a crowd of people at the pool bar as we left for an excursion, and passed the same group in the same spot on our return about eight hours later. Nothing had changed, except for the volume of their hoots and the urine level in the pool. Here is an example of what I like about the Haciendas as opposed to your typical all-inclusive. Typical morning at an all-inclusive: Wake up, get dressed, wait for all my family to get up, take showers, get dressed, wait for my daughter while she cries because she no longer wants to wear the outfit she just put on, finally make it out of the room for our journey to the restaurant, which is quite a walk, wait in line for a table and server, then make a pig out of myself at the buffet because I’ve been starving from the moment I rolled out of bed. Typical morning at the Haciendas: Wake up, shuffle into the kitchen in my boxers, start brewing a pot of my favorite Mexican coffee as I eat a banana and toast a bagel, walk out onto the patio, sip my coffee, and relax as I listen to the waves crash. My wife and kids don’t want to get up yet, but that’s ok, because I don’t have to wait for my entire party to eat and I’m already enjoying my day.. and yes, I’m still in my boxers. Simply put, if I’m staying somewhere for a week, I don’t want to stay in a hotel room. It’s just a pain to have to make a trip to a restaurant anytime I want so much as a snack. At the Haciendas, the suites are huge, the full kitchen is great, and if you don’t want to make your grocery run into town the day you arrive, the onsite market is fairly reasonable and has all the basic food staples you need to see you through. And although my top priority is not to get my drink on, let’s face it, we’re on vacation, so it is still a priority, and the market has a decent assortment of beer, wine, and liquor to satisfy my needs. The thought of going to a grocery store in Playa to stock up for the week may be daunting for some, but trust me, at the Haciendas, it really couldn’t be any easier. There is a free shuttle that drops you off within a block of a huge Publix, and if you have a cumbersome load to transport back, a taxi ride is about ten bucks. Some people may think you’re saving money by staying at an all-inclusive, but I really don’t find that to be true. And the convenience of having your own kitchen (with full refrigerator, oven, stove, microwave, all utensils, cookware, glasses, and even granite countertops!) is worth the price of admission to me anyway. Another thing we like about the Haciendas is its proximity to town and the availability of different food options. The shuttle will drop you off in the center of Playa, where you can easily walk to over a dozen good, reasonably priced restaurants (La Vagabundo is a good example). Or you can stay at the resort and eat at one of their restaurants or even order a pizza (which is actually pretty good). We will typically eat breakfast in the room, and either lunch or dinner. So our third meal is either by the pool, at the resort, or in town. We found the quality of food to be quite good at the resort, although we typically stick with Mexican entrees. I guess if we were staying at an all-inclusive, we would feel compelled to eat at the proverbial onsite Japanese, Italian, or Steak restaurants, but I have always found them to be subpar. Even though the Haciendas is a timeshare property, the staff is not low-pressure, they are practically no-pressure. I’ve heard horror stories from others about getting hard sell, high pressure, and downright rude tactics employed by staff at other timeshare properties. But at the Haciendas, management definitely has a different philosophy and seems to understand those tactics won’t win over the majority of their clientele. And although I probably won’t ever be a timeshare owner, if I ever was, it would definitely be at the Haciendas. Our concierge was extremely friendly and even though he picked up on the fact that we weren’t buyers, he still went out of his way to help us out and answer any questions we had throughout the week. One of the things I enjoyed most about our last trip to the Haciendas was the quality of people we met. There were middle-aged couples with young kids like us, there were younger couples, and there was an older bunch as well. There were a few people who I thought might drown in the pool due to intoxication, but so few that they were more of an amusement than an annoyance. I’ve met a lot of nice people at all-inclusives before, but find that crowd a little more stand-offish, not quite as friendly, and have even experienced some anti-American sentiment from the European element who frequents them. I found everyone to be extremely friendly at the Haciendas, probably because so many people there are repeat visitors and view the place as more of a vacation home than a resort. That being said, it’s not a place for everyone’s taste, which is probably why I like it so much. I could go on and on about the pluses of this resort (great pools, friendly staff, good gym, nice spa, etc.), but if you like Mexico as much as we do and you haven’t tried a non-inclusive, the Haciendas won’t disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Line”
Reviews.Author: SteveSora
Reviews.Content: This place is on par with the Fours Seasons Maui. Great location, great staff, beautiful rooms and every amenity one might need. The vacation starts when they say "Welcome home!" and at the end of the week, you're sorry you can't afford another 51 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, amazingly clean, home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MTMx2
Reviews.Content: This resort is the cleanest resort we have ever stayed at, inside and out. There is not a leaf, or trash of any kind on the sidewalks or anywhere for that matter. It is big but very walkable. The pools are very nice, and warm which I loved. A swim up bar which has happy hour 3pm - 6 pm everyday, great drinks, friendly bartenders. The beach is also nice, the ocean warm also, like bath water. Some days clear, other days murky, some rocks along with a nice sandy bottom. The real rocky areas are roped off. We rented kayaks and snorkel gear to practice , not much to see there. Plenty of palapas, lots of shade if you like that ( like me) or lots of sunny spots. There is yoga. zumba, beach volleyball, a welcome taco party with all the tacos and beer you want! and a native cultural production beachside,( I think on Sunday) We ate at the pool side restaurant several times, great shrimp tacos! Ate at the buffet once, good if you like buffets. Dining choices are limited onsite. There is a market which is so convenient, for almost anything, and not too overly priced. They have food, beer, wine, liquor, toiletries, souvenirs..... We went to town a few times. 5th Ave. is something to see, lots of shops with very pushy workers, restaurants, vendors ,bands. Kind of like a carnival atmosphere which was ok with me after relaxing all day at the beautiful resort, the nightlife was fun. We ate at The Blue Lobster which was very intimate, friendly fresh and very good. We did a snorkel trip with Almost Heaven in Puerto Morales which was great. About 2 - 3 hrs, the snorkeling was good. Lots of fish, beautiful coral. Would have loved to do it twice if we had more time. We also did Xplor, which was pricey, about $ 125 per person, but that was an experience of a lifetime. Our son,( and us) loved it . LOTS of zip lines, jeep ride thru the jungle, rafting cenotes, swimming... and a big lunch is included. You can even drink the tap water. I was a bit worried at first, no one got even a bit queasy,thank God. It was a great trip, looking forward to going back with our daughter next time!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: odeem
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving we ask if they had umbrellas since it was raining outside. They provided us with them. They were old. We went to return them the next day. As I was in the process of returning them, one of the umbrellas blew inside out. I gave them back to the staff and they stated that I had to pay for it. Place does not provide any shampoo or conditioner like most resorts do. The place is large and they have only one lauder mat. There restaurants are not convenient to locations of most rooms. If you are not a walker very hard to get around resort. Staff has no customer service skills. Rooms are very out dated. Old tv and fridge no ice makers. No ice machine on premise. Resort should not be rated five stars. Maybe three stars. I stayed at the Royal Caribbean in Cancun which is also owned and managed by the Royal Resorts, and there staff and service is excellent. So,what is the problem here???

Reviews.Title: “Indifference”
Reviews.Author: Rod K
Reviews.Content: Travel dates October 8-October 15, 2011. Full Disclosure-We traded our Starwood time share for this place trough Interval International (II). We were met at the reception desk by aman with a name tag that said Alvarodo. He first assigned us to a room far from the beach. When we asked him if we could be closer to the beach he saaid that II assigned the rooms. We showed him our confirmation letter from them and he assigned us a different room closer to the beach, but not the one from our confirmation letter. When he asked for a $900 dollar deposit to cover room charges for the week. When we offered our Amex card he stated that the corporation policy would not allow him to accept it. This put us in a jam as we had planned our vacation. (We had these reservations since Feb and no where was it mentioned that Amex was not aaccepted.) The next day we rode the shuttle into town to buy groceries. We took a cab back as we had frozen foods. When we arrived at the hotel with ourweeks worth of groceries we tried to borrow a luggage cart to take the groceries to our room. We were denied use of the cart and ended up carrying the groceries ourselves as none of the bellhops offered. The third day we found a used medical syringe washed up on the beach and notified one of the dive boat crew. By that time we were done with this place and couldn't wait to leave. Just to add insult to injury the elevator wasn't working when it was time for check-out.. At no time during our visit did anyone ask us if we were enjoying our trip. On a positive note our assigned consierge,Mia, was very helpful. Also, Luis from AdoCar Rentals went out of his way to make sure everything was right.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You!”
Reviews.Author: dfc613
Reviews.Content: We are at the end of a wonderful week! Rooms are spacious and immaculate, people could not be nicer. Grounds are meticulous and activities are plenty. Would highly recommend and hope to come back. Ottaviano our concierge is outstanding, thanks for your help!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Diana D
Reviews.Content: I love The Royal Haciendas!! Our room was beautiful, the food was good and the drinks were awesome!! My husband and I enjoyed our stay there so much that we are thinking about going back during winter break with our kids. This resort is very relaxing and very beautiful. The resort has a little market, two restaurants, four pools and an activity center. They also have a travel agency that you can book all your tours with at a very low price. Its great fun for the whole family!

Reviews.Title: “Mi hogar en el Paraiso!”
Reviews.Author: mikeinncFayetteville
Reviews.Content: I consider myself to be a "founding member" of Royal Haciendas having purchased preconstruction in 2005 for its opening in 2006. I have been returning every year and this was my sixth year! Feliz Anniversario Royal Haciendas!! The physical structure of the resort is so different from anything in Cancun with its tall, sometimes overpowering resorts and hotels. RH, being located in the Riviera Maya, conforms to strict environmental conditions of the area and that is evident in the low (no more than 4 stories) height of the resort. The colors are very bright and colorful and reflect a laid-back lifestyle. It is very peaceful and relaxing at any time of the day. When you turn off the highway and start down the long, winding entry road, you are entering another world. The greenery and peaceful serenity take over your senses as you pass colorful bushes and flowers. The new golf course beckons to duffers. You wonder where this road leads until suddenly you spot an enormous mass of yellow and orange. As you draw closer it becomes clear that this is your destination. Your transportation swings into a magnificent covered entryway dominated at its center by a waterfall column. You alight from your vehicle and enter the magnificent main lobby where you are greeted by the Welcome Team. Immediately you feel like family for that is what you are at any Royal Resort. The team at RH takes it a step further to ensure your arrival and sign-in are handled without a hitch. If you are new to RH you will be escorted to your villa, otherwise if you're an old timer like me you just head on up. The villas at RH are the best of any Royals. Everything conforms to the local area from the furniture to the color scheme. Your balcony overlooks one of two gorgeous plazas, gardens and pools. Cozumel calls on the horizon on any day. Fountains gurgle and there is the sweet smell of flowers in the air. Your fully equipped kitchen will delight you if you're into cooking in. The bedrooms are large, have plenty of storage space, and the most comfortable beds. The shower in the master bath is a must see!! The lock-off suite is large and has sufficient kitchen utensils for two persons. The balcony is likewise large eoungh to seat two and has two chairs and a table. From the lobby entry you proceed down a corridor to the Rotunda Bar. The business office and Los Murales restaurant flank the bar. The market was just prior to the bar and is fully stocked with everything one needs. On up to the villas. The pool areas are great and the Aqua Grills and bars offer wonderful food and great libations. The bartenders tend to remember returning members and guests every year. La Palapa restaurant offers three meals daily to include a different theme night Sunday thru Friday. The al a carte menu has greatly improved over the years thanks to Jorge, the manager. Gracias Jorge!! Los Murales is the RH's newest restaurant. A beautiful place to dine. The service is impeccable, the food fantastic, and the prices very reasonable. Not what some expect. Give it a try. The activities staff keep things moving all week with a welcome party, taco party, and plenty of pool activities like water aerobics, pool and beach volleyball. This year we were offered a tour of RH Underground. What a great experience to see how this resort is managed and run. I have a much better appreciation for everything that happens here and for how my service fee is being spent. The education classes for employees really impressed me. So...I'm a founding member of RH for 6 years and love it so much I purchased an additonal unit for week 16. Any questions? Write me. Muchas gracias Royal Haciendas por 6 annos!! Regresso en Abril 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Haciendas exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: andrew w
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I am a picky and spoiled traveler just to give you some color on how seriously to take this rating. I travel 2 weeks a month for work as a Banker and have stayed in all types of hotels and resorts (Ritz, Mandarin, etc, etc). My friends and family say that I am very picky and hard to please. Long story short.... I was extremely pleased with the my stay Royal Haciendas. I couldn't stop talking about it with my wife when we were there. They has a 2-person hot tub on each villa balcony and I enjoyed that every single night. It was so relaxing to sit in your very own hot tub overlooking the beach and resort. You also have control of the temp, jets, etc. and I It was very well manicured and the service from the staff (from Pablo at the front desk to Francisco the property manager). Having travelled to time-share resorts before, I wasn't expecting much quality in regards to food as we usually eat at very fine restaurants. Well...I was wrong. I was very impressed with the food at the resort. The food at the resort restuarant (Los Murales) was 5-star. My meal was comparable to a meal at any fine hotel (i.e the Ritz). The resort was also the most impressive physically on the playa coast. I walked 30 minutes in both directions on the beach and nothing even came close to the beauty if the Royal Haciendas. I will defintely go back. My only critique is for those that really love walking around in the ocean- there are some rocks in the water so you do have to watch your step in some areas. This however, is obviously not a critique of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Well Planned Resort”
Reviews.Author: balti_less
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay at a Royal Resort in Playa Del Carmen and was really impressed with the quality of the units and the overall thought in designing the units. The units are all 2 bedroom units that can be locked off as a Master Suite (A side) and a Studio unit (B side). Stayed in the Master Suite which included a jacuzzi in the balcony. The kitchen is a full sized kitchen that is well equipped with a dishwasher. I am comparing this to the Mayan Palace which does not have a kitchen as nice as Royal Haciendas. Bought groceries in town and only used the restaurant one night. (The restaurant was reasonably priced, but was hit or miss on the night we went.) Only thing missing for me would be a washer and dryer (although there is a laundry center on site). The AC units are really powerful and kept the rooms incredibly cool. The rooms are large and even have a nice ceiling fans in the living room and bedroom. Did not use the pools since I was looking for a quiet break which the beach provided nicely. There are plenty of huts and beach chairs for all the guests. The lifeguards were friendly and attentive making you feel safer in the waters. Ordered drinks and lunch from the beach waiters who had a nice flag system if you wanted to order from the bar or restaurant. The beach has adequate sandy spots for swimming and lots of snorkeling areas. Overall a much better beach than the Mayan Palace. The only thing that could have been a little better was the check-in and check-out process which had some confusing moments and long waits with just 2 or 3 clerks available. The gate from highway 307 uses the Grand Coral entrance, with little or no signage indicating that you are entering the Royal Haciendas. Overall a nice resort to relax and wind down, with free wifi access that is even available on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “A Total Paradise”
Reviews.Author: APhillips2011
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to the Royal Haciendas and it gets better every time. The service is excellent, you feel at home from the moment you arrive. The views of the ocean and Cozumel are stunning as are the rest of the grounds. The rooms are meticulous, with that warm spanish hacienda decor, a balcony for every room and a whirlpool in the larger villas. We love this place because it is relaxing, there are activites to enjoy if you don't just want to lounge by the pool or hang at the pool bar. You get a personal concierge, (ours was Melissa and she was terrific and a shout out to Justin as well). They have a welcome party and a show, and orientation to help you get your week organized and the food is great. You can eat pool side, at the big Palapa with a scrumptious and extensive buffet or fine dining at Los Murales (pricey but worth at least one visit). P.S. We have never had any probelms with check out like stated in a recent posting form another reviewer.

Reviews.Title: “Total Disgust”
Reviews.Author: ray677
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place from the 17th to the 24th of September. We had dinner with our friends at the Palapa, the flank steak was impossible to chew. My friends cheeseburger with bacon had a single strip of bacon on it 2 inches long. My wife's Caesar salad with shrimp had mayonnaise on it instead of dressing and they used iceberg lettuce instead of romaine lettuce. It gets better: On the 23rd we decided to take a nap at 5 pm to rest up for dinner.. Our friends stayed in the second bedroom which is divided by a living room from our bedroom. We were asleep when our friend knocked on our bedroom door asking if we had a drinking glass in our room. He had gotten up and found the a women in the kitchen/living room section taking Inventory! He or we had not heard anyone knocking! She had come into the entrance for the living room. Apparently this hotel allows any staff to enter a guests room without notice to the guest, who is normally entitled to enjoy full privacy and security anywhere else in the world. Wait it gets even better: We tried to check out the evening of the 23rd, and were told that our credit card was denied!The clerk told us that we could not use his phone and had to use one at the end of the hall. When my wife called the credit card company she was upset, of course.....thinking the issue was with the credit card company. We were told that the problem was with the Royal Haciendas. When we checked in the hotel would put a "HOLD" of $10,500.00 pesos on our card until we checked out. Our bill was approximately $6,862.00 pesos. The Hotel now charged our card with $6,800.00 pesos WITHOUT taking the "HOLD" of $10,500.00 off our card!! This put us over the limit on the card by about $35.00 pesos. We asked to speak to the manager and requested that the hold of $10,500.00 be credited back to our account or that the the actual bill of $6,862.00 be deducted from the hold and the difference credited back to us. He advised us that he could not do so. We had to sign a debit slip with the actual hotel charge and were promised that the $10,500.00 would be taken off later. When I asked him why this mess was not explained to us by the clerk when first trying to check out and that we had to call our credit card company to find out what was going on, he had no answer. We are back in Cancun now where we live and still as of the 24th, no credit for the $10,500.00 hold has been made to our account. My wife and I are in our 60's, have traveled all over the world and this is the worst hotel experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Haciendas in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Lost_my_tan
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this resort. We have stayed at other Royal resorts and wanted to try this one. As with other Royals, the staff is very friendly and attentive. They go out of their way to make your stay the best it could be. There are two main restaurants, one casual and one fine dining, and two poolside. The resort has two pools and both have swim up bars. The grounds are very well maintained and the beach kept clean. The beach is protected by a reef so the wave action is minimal which allows for snorkeling and kayaking. Prices for the themed buffets and for drinks at the pool bars are a little on the high side. There is a market on site which has a wide selection of food and beverages. There are several restaurants in the area that offer a wide selection of dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: RainSeattleMom
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds are beautiful, it's quiet, and it has good food. Best and unexpected, however, was the impecable customer service. Seriously - even topped Disney and Nordstrom's in terms of customer service. "Welcome home" they always say. Our personal concierge, Mia, was always willing to help & give good advice and personal opinions. Rudolphe was our person who wanted to talk with us about a timeshare - he was really nice & Mia asked us a couple times to meet with him beyond the introduction, but they weren't too pushy about us declining. We went in September 2011 because the ocean is warm & the crowds are slim. Less people there meant it was easier to reserve trips to town in the van and/or excursions through Thomas Moore (onsight) with very little advanced notice. We didn't get a single storm during the day (except three minutes of warm rain on my head during a snorkel trip), and none of the hurricanes were in our area. Perfect warm, humid weather that makes you want to stay near water and stay out of the jungle. Great pools with plenty of chairs. The beach was not good for swimming due to rocks and sea urchins, but we did snorkel there & hung out in one sandy spot once; otherwise go elsewhere for good beaches. The restaurants and market aren't cheap, but convenient and yummy. We went to the market at least once a day for all our needs. It's not in town so you don't want to go here if you're a young partier, but families and older couples (and younger quiet couples like us) loved it. The older couples were funny to watch having a good time, and there weren't too many kids around. The welcome party on Saturday is a must - wow the show was great! The rooms was perfect for us - two full beds which means we fit better each taking our own bed; little kitchnette with coffee maker big enough for our needs; great shower; cable tv for movies and night & a dvd player with movie rentals at the market. Central location to everything!!! It was a quick jaunt to Cozumel, Playa, Explor, and while we didn't get to it much, also close to cenotes, ruins, Cancun and Tulum. I recommend this place for quiet and older couples plus families. Internet access was great in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Owners of the Royal Haciendas”
Reviews.Author: Mdossett
Reviews.Content: We have been to our resort twice. It should be our 4th time this December, but due to our Son's illness we have decided not to take the risk of leaving the country and having a medical emergency. We cant wait to go back and stay again, we love the resort and are always treated very well and the staff are super helpful. Great staff for the kids too,we will miss them this year. Our Host is Betty Salinas very nice lady. Hopfully we will be back in 2012 to see everyone. We are sending our friends this year to take our place, so you know its nice if you send your friends there.

Reviews.Title: “Not a quiet get away”
Reviews.Author: Mark T
Reviews.Content: T his is a nice resort but feels more like a hotel. The pool had lots of kids in it with very little parental control. Even though the hot tubs said "no children allowed", they were more like kiddy pools than hot tubs. The food at Los Morales in the resort was excellent. The dive shop at the resort is top notch and puts safety before all else!! The rooms are big and they all have individual hot tubs on the balconies. The staff was very friendly and always wore a smile. If you plan on going and do not want a lot of kids around, go after labor day when all the kids are in school.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment at Royal Haciendas”
Reviews.Author: vabstar
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our one-week trip to RH in Playa Del Carmen on Saturday, September 3. This time-share is gorgeous. I will confirm what others are saying: the grounds are picture-perfect, the units are spacious and comfortable, the pools, delightful, the beach a little rocky but lovely nonetheless, and the food in the Palapa Del Sol and the grills was delicious. Really. I don't own a timeshare. I went with family who traded for this place. I don't have an agenda here. But I was so taken with this place that I asked if I could go back with them next year, and that's something I just don't do. I want to see the world, not the same place over and over. But the level of service, the cleanliness, the friendly helpfulness of the staff here is really unbeatable. Every day, EVERY DAY, the maid was in our rooms for 2 hours, scrubbing the floors, changing the linens including the bedspreads, even washing the walls. If that's important to you, you'll really be happy here. The staff was always willing to help and everyone passed by with a smile and a "hola". Picture this: lying on a lounge chair under a straw umbrella 5 feet from the beautiful caribbean as a waiter brings you anything you could possibly want. Heaven. Happy hour from 3 to 6 p.m. was awesome, either on the beach or at the swim-up bar. The theme buffets, something I try to avoid at all costs, were really good. I couldn't believe it. There were a few draw-backs, but nothing that spoiled our vacation. They have a courtesy shuttle that goes into town every day, but the hours are short and they filled up fast. One time they passed us by while waiting to be picked up. Oh, well, mistakes happen, right? We took a cab back to the RH for 100 pesos. No big deal. My memories are so fond, I can't even remember if there was anything else. Oh, right. I loved one of their soups (I loved ALL of their soups) so much that I asked for the recipe and they hesitated and finally gave me ingredients but no recipe. Okay, I understand, it's a secret. It rained a couple of times but it was for brief periods and then the sun came shining out again. And with temps over 90 degrees every day, we hoped for some cooling off from the rain, but that never happened. Other than that, a truly wonderful vacation. I'll post again with the different adventures we went on and the restaurants we visited, but for now, I will tell you can't go wrong staying at the RH.

Reviews.Title: “A true vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Jana B
Reviews.Content: We go to the haciendas every year for a true vacation. It is the only time my family can get together for some quality bonding. This place is pretty versatile. It is beautiful with soft sand, warm seas, and lush greenery. It is not built up like Cancun so you still see some wildlife and greenery. There are days when you can just lay on the beach and swim in the ocean but watch out for a few rocks though. Other days, you can dive right off the beach with the Dive Balam boat. The company has some pretty fun staff. They have different dives everyday. I even got certified a couple years ago. Although, the certification process in the States is bit more detailed and slow pace. I feel as they skipped a few things at the Haciendas that would have been valuable to learn. The process is quick though and gets you diving asap. The cenote dives are my favorite and absolutely spectacular. The free kayak rentals are great too. You can paddle out a bit a get a very nice view. There is also ample room to play tennis in their well maintained tennis courts. They have a Spa if you are into that. It's way too expensive for my tastes. More expensive than in the States. Personally, all I need is the huge hot tubs to lounge in on colder days or when the sun goes down. They even have little jacuzzis on you balcony. They also have fun classes in the mornings like Zumba and Yoga. My parents take the Spanish class. The food selection is a little limited but what they offer is fairly tasty. They have one normal restaurant, Hacienda del Sol, and a very expensive one, Los Murales. The haciendas are also close to many of the ruins and other great things like zip lining, cenote swimming, Xplor, and Xcaret. Downtown is taxi drive away, which can get annoying. It is definitely worth it to go check out though. The actual city is very quaint and fun to walk around in. There is also some real authentic Mexican food at places like El Fogon. Of course there is nightlife too with fun beach bars. Overall, even though this place is not all inclusive I definitely think it is worth your money and an amazing place to stay. P.S. If you are looking for a party resort, this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Great unexpected trip”
Reviews.Author: lightblue1110
Reviews.Content: Due to Hurrican Irene my family and I ended up at the Royal Haciendas. We were at the Royal Islander in Cancun the week before. Other members of my family were already staying at the Haciendas so we joined them and got our own room. We were giving an emergency rate which was nice. The Royal Haciendas is a lovely property. Very clean and great views. The restaurant by the water had great views. Too much seaweed on the beach but they clean it daily. Very clean, great maid service. My biggest complaint is the tile all around the property is very slippery and I fell several times. Everyone in my family fell. I would like more dining options. I stayed at the hotel the whole week and did not chose to do any trips. It was very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Resort are Great and Consistent - thank goodness”
Reviews.Author: teuraj
Reviews.Content: I exchanged into this resort via II and would do it again without hesitation - I found the units to be as advertised (their website is great for 360 views, floor plans, etc) very well kept (not perfect) and very large. They are a little pushy about mainenance and cleaning when they want to do it but if you say no, they accept no / come back later. I had a 2/2 lockoff and it was only myself and my gilfriend and she was only there for 4 days. It would accomidate a large family very nicely with 2 huge bathrooms, 1 king, 2 queens and 2 murphy beds. The jacuzzi bathtub on the patio was a big treat!. We had a ground floor unit and that was really nice too - although a higher floor would have had beautiful ocean views - no complaints here. The food onsite was really good and the prices were fair. We ordered food to our unit a couple of times and it was fast and as expected for pizza, wings, etc. The drinks at the pool were great and the service from the waiters was even better. The pools are beautiful and the grounds are breathtaking. I walked around on my last day taking pictures of all the oversized planters filled with trees / flowers / water, etc.. just amazing. The location is a bit north of Playa and taxi is $10 each way. I'm not sure I would recommend getting a car - driving in Mexico as a tourist is a risk I'm not sure I want to take (again). There is no bus or collectivo that goes right to the resort. The beach is great for walking on and the water right in front of the resort is swimable but take water shoes as it's a big rocky / sharp rocks in places. They do a good job of keeping the beach clean, etc. We booked several tours from the onsite tour operator after speaking with our personal concierge (nice touch and not pushy) - I recommend Xplor but you might get a better deal booking on a large tour with transportation included or direct on the Xplor website if you are driving yourself. We went to Chichen Itza with them and it was great - we did the smaller / early morning one in a small van and omg the ride was terrible - in the front it was cold, the back was hot - but it didn't take as long, so they said. Hmm I'd go for the more comfortable ride because it's a long drive! Onsite grocery store was good too - we shopped there and did one bigger trip to the local grocery in Playa. Oh and they have an onsite dive operator - those guys were very flirty but fun (not in a disrespectful way); beds were comfortable and showers had great pressure (2 things I care about and hopefully you do too). In summary - the units, staff and fellow resort guests were great and I would return there with a smile on my face!

Reviews.Title: “We still love it after our 5th time!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela3405
Reviews.Content: The Royal Hacienda's is a great get-away location and we've owned a one-week interval since 2006 - the beginning. Service has really stepped up with staff "listening" and "seeing" needs, even prior to requests for something! The beachfront La Palapa Sol restaurant is good - but our favorite is the breakfast buffet. With fresh eggs made to order and a wide assortment of cooked and fresh foods, it really provides a healthy start to the day. Especially in light of fresh juices, including a special mixture that includes papaya and cactus! The villas are spacious and are the best way to travel with a family at over 1200 sq feet of sleeping and living space, including a full-service kitchen that allows for budget saving snacks and meals. ALWAYS plenty of chairs on the beach, and servers that ensure you do not go hungry or thirsty. Beautiful pool with swim-up bar and a ledge for your chair! Grab a drink and float with your friends or family at the edge that looks out over the beach and beautiful Caribbean Sea. We love this area because there is so much to do, and yet we are comfortable "at home" where we relax with reading or laughing with family. The staff is very friendly and eager to serve - we highly recommend any of the Royal Resorts, but this is our favorite in this "low-rise", more space, environment!

Reviews.Title: “royal resort does again”
Reviews.Author: sagitt
Reviews.Content: We were a family of four. Two adults and two kids. The royal resorts are a class company. This resort was beautiful, the grounds and the villas were stuning. This review would have been rate excellent except for one problems with the grounds of the resort. The floors were made of these beautiful tile which at times were very slippery. During our stay we seen a least six to eight people fall and slip on the grounds. This can and is very dangerous. My son fell and hit the back of his head very hard. Thanksfuly he was all right and was able to enjoy our week. The scary parts was that these fall was from walking not running on the grounds. Some of the fall were older people. Please address this so that other can stay and enjoy this wonderful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Home sweet (second) home”
Reviews.Author: haydee2007
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd time back to Royal Haciendas and this confirms again and again that we made the right decision to spend our precious quality vacation time in this place. The villa is like a second home, just better. It is spacious, the kitchen is great - have all the utensils and appliances we need , loved having my own jacuzzi, the maid service is excellent- they cleaned and scrubbed everything. I was able to connect with wi fi and call in to US for several meetings (for work) without problem. As usual, the store in the resort is good priced and well stocked, it has everything we needed (shampoo, bread, eggs, bacon, fruits, wine, off lotion, biodegradable sunblock, freshly baked bread, coffee, juice, cup of noodles etc) for our week's stay. By the way, the spa experience is really something worth trying - buy the package! Lomi Lomi massage is heavenly. Oh - there is also "free" shuttle to 5th avenue. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to relax for a few days.”
Reviews.Author: AaronDB
Reviews.Content: First off, it was the easiest and quickest transfer my wife and I ever had from the Cancun airport to The Royal Haciendas. One nice thing about the resort on the northern side of Playa Del Carmen is that the commute to the airport is only about 25 minutes. Checking in was very smooth and easy. Although the Royal Haciendas is not an all-inclusive, the prices at the restaurants and bars are very reasonable. The food was always delicious and the drinks were always well-made. It's hard to find an all inclusive with both of these perks. As far as the rooms go, our suite was very comfortable, clean and well stocked with utensils, coffee maker, blender, dishwasher etc. We had picked up some breakfast items from the market in the resort and made breakfast every morning in our suite. The pools and beach are very clean, and welcoming as well. It was very nice to have a separate lap pool from the main pool so my wife and I could take a few laps and not feel as guilty about all the good food we'd been eating on vacation. We never had any problem finding a place to sit with an umbrella and the servers on the beach were very accommodating with whatever you like from the bar or grill. The other very nice advantage of the Royal Haciendas is the location to Playa Del Carmen. It is only a 115 peso, 10 minute cab ride to the city where you have access to everything. Also, the resort is a short trip to all of the local more touristy attractions, XPlor (fantastic and lots of fun btw), Xel Ha, and XCaret. We went into town each night to get dinner at the more traditional, local restaurants and was never disappointed. All in all, we were very satisfied with our short stay at Royal Haciendas. I was leery about it not being an all inclusive, but the staff is very good about itemizing and keeping thorough track of all your spending so keeping it in check is easy. Plus, since it's not an all inclusive, we didn't feel as guilty about leaving the grounds and going to Playa and XPlor for dinner and fun. Even though we chose not to take our little 17 month old son with us on this trip, I would have felt very comfortable having him stay at the Royal Haciendas. (One difference I noticed about the Royal Haciendas is that it had elevators and wheelchair ramps unlike most resorts in Mexico.) Great place and we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: car_and_scott
Reviews.Content: We exchanged a week at the Royal Haciendas through Interval, and just returned from a wonderful and relaxing week! I don't want to be repetitive from other reviews so I will list the good, bad and give some tips to people thinking of going to RH for a vacation. Good: -Villas are huge - we had a two bedroom all to ourselves and had so much space - tons of closets, drawers, shelves, etc. -Daily cleaning service - our maid Melby was so meticulous. They say they don't clean the kitchen, but each day she washed all dishes in the dishwasher by hand. The entire resort is spotless. -Welcome party, taco party - tacos were delicious and drinks were free! -Restaurant at the pool - great food, not expensive, margaritas were STRONG! -We had dinner at Los Murales - it was fantastic. We are (admittedly) food snobs and have pretty high expectations. We were impressed by this restaurant. After appetizers, salads, wine and cocktails, entrees and strawberries flambe for dessert (highly recommend) it came to $125USD. That is less than we would have paid at a restaurant at home so we were happy! My steak was perfectly medium rare and my husband's rack of lamb was outstanding. -Loved the hot tub on the porch! Fun! -Check in was QUICK (I was worried from reading other reviews) because we weren't owners, so we went to a different area in the lobby -Thomas More is great - transfers from the airport are only to RH so you don't have to stop at a million other resorts. Also booked Xel-Ha through them - last resort to be picked up and first to be dropped off at the end of the day. -Never a problem getting a palapa at the beach, chairs at the pool, etc. And they said they were at 90% capacity - you would never have known! Very peaceful! -Shuttle to Playa - fantastic service and never had a problem getting a reservation - they say 24 hours in advance but we always did it the morning we wanted it, no issues. -Our personal concierge, Octavio, was SO nice and helpful. We didn't go through the sales pitch - he never even approached us about it until Wednesday, we were going to meet with them on Friday but had to cancel due to some issues we had with our flights that we had to straighten out. It was nice not to have any pressure! Bad/Complaints: -Our villa wasn't super clean when we checked in BUT the head maid came by to check and they came and took care of everything right away. Not a good first impression but they made up for it. -Palapa del Sol - buffet - WAY too expensive for what you get. It was prime rib night when we went but still really expensive (about $90USD for 2). Then, on the way out we saw an ala carte menu that looked way better. I recommend using that menu because the service and atmosphere (you can sit out on the patio looking at the beach/ocean) is great! -We would have loved another casual and less expensive evening option for dinner. If the pool bar was open later, that would be ideal. Even if they were open later, until 8 or 9. We ordered room service one night and it was just OK. -They offer a shopping trip to Cancun (free) for a day sponsored through Diamonds International. DO NOT take this trip! It was not worth it. The first mall in Cancun was very run-down and then we had to wait like 45 minutes after the designated time for people to all get back on the bus. We went to another shopping center which was much much nicer, had a great lunch at Taco Grill, but everything was insanely expensive so it wasn't worth it. We did complain to the resort because it was so disorganized. Maybe they will improve it! Tips: -Take a shuttle into Playa and head to the Mega. (Many suggest Wal-Mart, but Mega was an awesome experience.) We shopped for the week for breakfast items, snacks, and beer/wine. It was so much fun to figure out what was what. We recommend taking a cab back because if you don't, you have to lug groceries about 4 blocks which isn't fun. -Definitely venture into PDC for meals - we had incredible meals at Carboncito's, Ajua Maya and El 10. Decent prices, especially if you venture off 5th a bit! -When you get your bill on Friday morning, you have the option to settle everything on Friday - we did this late on Friday night after returning from PDC and then didn't have to worry about checking out on Saturday. Much easier! -The pool in phase 2 is WAY quieter for some reason, so if you want less kids, go there! -I emailed the resort prior to our stay to request an ocean front room. We didn't get it but were very close to the front of the resort in F339. It was spectacular, great view and SO quiet! Didn't hear neighbors once! We had such a fabulous week, we didn't want it to end. We highly recommend staying at the Royal Haciendas, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Just a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Dryitout
Reviews.Content: Our family shared three two bedroom condos here. First, the condos were absolutely beautiful and very spacious - ideal for families. The multiple balcony areas were very nice, although August heat and humidity meant they weren't used all that much. Second, the service at Royal Haciendas was excellent - unlike that of most all-inclusives in the area. The shaded pool bar was a nice gathering place, and it is large enough that the multiple families with kids weren't too much of a bother to us adults. We had excellent food at the restaurant on the beach, and the grouper was a huge hit to everyone who tried it. I found the prices to be reasonable, and the quality was very good. There is a daily "theme" buffet, but most of us passed that up to order from the menu. Nice selection too. The location is a good one, as the Haciendas are just north of Playa del Carmen, approximately 35 minutes from the Cancun airport. I rented a car, which made it easy to get to attractions such as Xel Ha and Akumal Bay, each within 40 minutes. There are nicer beaches on the Riviera Maya, but the one at the Royal Haciendas was fine. At its center is a large reef, with swimming areas to each side. There is very little wave action here, since Cozumel, which is directly east, tends to block them, but all in all it was a great place to chill with a book. By the way, the blue flag placed on your palapa brings the bar server running, so thirst is not an issue. I'd definitely return here, and I much prefer it to the "5-star" all-inclusive I've used.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort and wonderful staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zsuzsi
Reviews.Content: We have visited this resort on numerous occasions and we love it. It is a timeshare so you don't get a lot of teenagers partying into the middle of the night. The grounds are beautiful and the accommodations are modern. Playa del Carmen is less than 10 minutes away and there are so many great restaurants there. If you don't want to leave the property, the resort has nice restaurants there as well. The infinity pools are our favorite. You can stay in there forever. You won't be disappointed here unless you want a resort with a bar that has a lot of action. The bar here closes at 11pm because it is a timeshare so that is the only bummer at night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay- coming back for more!”
Reviews.Author: Haliay
Reviews.Content: Went there for a girl's getaway trip. We knew this would be a nice, relaxing vacation after reading this was not a place for partiers or spring breakers. The resort is definitely that. We were the only 'singles' at the entire resort (minus the teens with their parents). I absolutely loved our room, double bed, small kitchenette area and large bathrroom. Perfect size for 2 of us, probably a litle tight for four. The resort has a convenient grocery store/shop that we stocked up on breakfast supplies and mid-day snacks. We only ordered from the grill twice I believe, prices aren't the cheapest there. The Happy Hour Specials are great! The staff is very friendly and accomodating. We made great friends with the outdoor pool bar servers. Always attentive to what we may have needed. We also frequented the gym, but still think the price per day is a little high (I think it was $7 a visit). Next time I'll buy the week pass vs. per visit. The resort is located just before central Playa Del Carmen, we averaged a $10 cab ride (in USD) each way and went into town each night. I HIGHLY suggest venturing out to the restaurants in town vs. hotel. The hotel dinner menus seemed extremely overpriced. Ended up buying a vacation plan through Royal Resorts and am excited for my return visit!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sushinestate
Reviews.Content: Is a beautiful resort, very well mantained very accomodating. This resorts was extremely accomodating from the minute we arrived there. I could not asked for better it exceeded our expectations. A lot of times we ate at the palapas del sol restaurant.. one of the resort restaurant excellence service, totally accomodating as my husband and I are vegan they went out of their way to accomodated us with the buffet, one of the waiter at the restaurant name Roman was wonderful excellent waiter.we will never forget him . the whole crew including the cheft and the manager were excellent,,, not complaints at all, they really have a top notch service, this was my first time to Mexico I was very inmpres with the Riviera Maya, the place is beautiful clean and warm I had a very memorable experience,, thinking of going back next year... I was taken by the culture, beauty and the warm people of mexico that maded it very pleaseant., I loved playa del carmen" breath taking beach" over in 5th ave at playa del carmen you feel the mexican culture, totally beautiful... we also did excaret, tulam, and the other mayan ruins and the beautiful blue lagoon, also snorkling on the underground rivers ... and swam with the whale sharks in open water. We are looking foward to go back to the Riviera maya but only if I can stay at the hacienda ... only 10 minutes away from playa del carmen. We also visited cancun while there but I prefer the Riviera maya ,,I was very impress... will defitnely go back..

Reviews.Title: “Average resort”
Reviews.Author: alpalecaso
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here for 4 nights (July 23-27th). I picked this place, because of its location near Playa Del Carmen (PDC), good reviews on TA, and the room size. The location did not disappoint..it is on a nice beach and 5 minutes away from PDC. We had a rental car, drove ourselves to PDC and had no problem finding parking there. We stayed in a 2 bdrm/2 bathrm, beach front villa which was very large with a full kitchen and a large balcony facing the beach. I guess we were not that impressed with this resort, because we had just stayed at Westin Lagunamar and had higher expectations. This is probably a 3 star resort. After arrival, we were in the check-in line for about 30 minutes, eventhough there were only two groups in front of us. There was a hotel staff in the lobby with free horchata and jamaica with a tip jar with "Tips" written on it next to the drinks, which we thought was pretty tacky. When we got to our room, we noticed a used soap bar and an empty bottle of water in one of the bedrooms. Their cleaning services definitely need improvement. There's a sign in the kitchen about a $75 cleaning charge if the kitchen is not clean and a kitchen inventory list that needs to be turned in...things that we didn't see at the Westin. Since it was late (around 10 pm) and we were all tired, we decided to order food from La Palapa restaurant. The tortilla chips were stale, the pizza was terrible, and the buffalo wings were hard and chewy and tasted like they were warmed in the microwave. After that, we decided not to eat at any of their restaurants, which is hard since there's no place to eat nearby. So if you don't have a car, you are at their mercy. We ate at the restaurants in PDC and Akumal while there. The pools were large and nice except that we noticed some reddish, foamy stuff at one corner of the pool floating on the water that looked like vomit. It's a very loud place and while on the grounds you can hear people talking on their balconies, kids screaming, and loud music coming from the rooms. There are kids everywhere, which is ok by us since we have kids of our own, but it was kind of strange seeing unsupervised kids hanging out by the pool and hammocks late at night. I would not recommend this place to couples without kids looking for a romantic getaway. The beach area is not very wide, but the water is nice, calm, and more clear than in Cancun. There are some rocky areas that can be avoided. We were not interested in attending timeshare presentations (especially at this place) or hearing about the activities and tours since we already know the area and had our daily plans/excursions in place before arriving there. They called us a couple of times to meet with our concierge for a welcome package, but didn't go and were left alone after that. Overall, this is an average place to stay for a family. It's a good base for touring the area. We went to Playa Del Carmen, Tulum, snorkling in Akumal, and ziplining at Selvatica (see separate review). I would highly recommend Carboncitos Restaurant in PDC and the brownies at Ah Cacao. We ate at La Buena Vida in Akumal. The food wasn't that great, but the beautiful location can't be beat! We really enjoyed our vacation and can't wait to go back, but will not stay at the Royal Haciendas again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mickeyfan69
Reviews.Content: We booked this place last minute via a time-share exchange with some friends, so we were little nervous since we didn't have a lot of time to plan. We were we pleasantly surprised. The resort was definitely clean and beautiful as expected. Everyone was a pleasure to talk to and did go out of their way to make sure we had what we needed. Our room was very spacious and comfortable. We did have a penthouse suite which was awesome, but I know the other rooms were just as nice. We did meet with our personal concierge Lenny and Yuri on Sunday at the Welcome Party and they were both very nice and helped us plan our week of activities for 9 people including 5 childern raging from 8 to 21. We also attended a free breakfast including a sales pitch, but they knew both families already owned time-shares and that we were not likely to buy another one. They did ask and show us what they had to offer, but neither made us feel pressured about buying. They were both just so pleasant. We definately will be back and if I ever decide to buy into another time-share, I would consider the Royal Resorts. I understand why everything closes by 10:00 PM. We were so wiped out from all the fun things we did each day, we were in bed by 10:00 almost every night. Our 8 year old loved all the onsite activities from beach soccer, backetball, pool volleyball. Even though he was one of the few who did not speak spanish besides the directors, he didn't care. He loved it. Only complainst: restaraunt pricing a little high for Mexico and later transportation from the resort to and from town.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: arubalove1
Reviews.Content: The Royal Haciendas is a beautiful and clean resort. We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bath villa. More than enough room for 2 (sleeps 6). The grounds are well kept. The food is good, a little pricey. The only negative is the beach...rocks, seaweed. Not as pretty as some other beaches I've seen on other islands (Aruba). The people are the best. They make you feel special and are always ready to help you. Took a trip to XCARAT...very hot, but it was nice. Bring water shoes if you go. Overall, it was a great vacation and will return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing Resort!”
Reviews.Author: wilcomom
Reviews.Content: We wanted a relaxing resort, with a beautiful beach and pool, good food and service, and well-appointed accommodations----and we found it all at the Royal Haciendas! We rented a 1 bedoom suite for our family of 3 and had plenty of room. Our teenager slept in one of the 2 pull-down murphy beds in the living room. The pool bar was excellent---we were pleasantly surprised at how delicious their food was. We especially liked the fish and shrimp tacos and the mahi mahi wrap. The swim-up bar was a favorite in the afternoons during Happy Hour (3-6) with half-price drinks. Everyone who works here is friendly and helpful--we had wonderful service all week. A great breakfast is the fresh pastries at the resort market--delicious and inexpensive! A couple of downsides I have to share.....the options for dining (especially at night) are pretty limited. The pool bar closes at 6, and the remaining 2 restaurants are a bit pricey, one more than the other. They do have a great take-out restaurant, which we used frequently and were very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. Not surprisingly, dining can be expensive here but definitely not any moreso than other resorts of this type. Also, the resort is a bit isolated--about 10 minutes from Playa Del Carmen--and seems to be fairly family-oriented. It's not a place for people who need lots of entertainment and organized activities or who like the nightlife!! Also, the way the resort is set up, most of the rooms don't have much of an ocean view. If that's important to you, make sure you reserve a "beachfront" condo. Overall, I would definitely recommend the Royal Haciendas, especially for those who'd like to get away from the craziness of the mega hotels!

Reviews.Title: “First time at Royal Haciendes and looking forward to returning soon...”
Reviews.Author: jen10021
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Mexico and Royal Haciendes is a beautiful resort to stay in. The people working at the resort is very friendly and always greets us with smiles and a quick willingness to assist with our needs. Also very easy to get around with the assigned guest card so we can borrow anything we would need, i.e. towels, tennis racquets, as well as shop in their little market for quick bites. The resort is also very kid friendly with lots of activities for children. You can drop your kid(s) off for arts & crafts (bracelet making, mexican doll making, face painting, etc) while you hang out and play ping pong or borrow a book to read in their air-conditioned activities room. Trust me, it's so darn hot, you'll appreciate their activities room. Steps from the suites is their beautiful beach where I spent almost every morning walking alongside the waves. Truly relaxing. Because we were a large group, we chose to buy groceries and prepared most breakfasts in our rooms. But we did get to eat at La Palapa del Sol and what a view (look right out to the beach and water) with great selection of fresh food. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Royal Haciendes and can't wait to head back.

Reviews.Title: “I come to this resort ever year & it is the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: cneiman
Reviews.Content: My parents own a time share at the Royal Haciendas for one week, & they have been trading to get a second week. I have been to a number of other time shares & all inclusive resorts in Mexico. This resort blows all the others away. The customer service is top notch, the grounds are kept emmaculate, and the rooms are awesome. The beds have very nice mattresses, which usually wouldn't be that big of a deal, except I have slept on beds at other resorts in Mexico which were like laying on a slab of particle board. The food at the restaurants is very good, but it can get a little pricey. I recommend going shopping and cooking in the kitchen in your room if you want to save a few bucks. I also recommend purchasing your beer and liquor at Walmart. You can bring it back to the resort and it will save you from having a huge bar tab. The drinks they make at the bar are very good, but they can add up fast. The pools are great and have not been crowded when I have been at the resort. The spa & gym are also top notch. I am going back in December 2011 for two weeks. This really is a great place to relax!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Pool Bar - Ever !”
Reviews.Author: savvy11
Reviews.Content: Here is a hotel that knows how to present atmosphere without ugly american signage. The place is beautiful with a quiet "Hammock area" for siesta far away from the pool. The pool was one of the best designs I have ever seen on the globe. There was a hot tub on the balcony. My advice is that you spend 90% of your time at the pool or in the water at a hotel. then THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back next year !!!”
Reviews.Author: patty205
Reviews.Content: We own a week 25 timeshare at the Royal Haciendas. It is the BEST ! Even though we arrived very late ( after midnight), we were warmly welcomed. Our luggage was delivered to our villa almost instantly. The Sunday orientation was informative. The Welcome Party had to be held in the Sales Office because of rain and included free rum & coke, beer, and soda. The Mayan dancers from Xcaret put on an amazing show. How fun to have them do the "YMCA" and "Electric Slide" with all of us.The dinners, lunches, and breakfasts at La Palapa Del Sol were delicious.The service everywhere in the resort is wonderful. Our villa, the grounds,the pool, and the beach are immaculate.The Taco Party ( complimentary to members) was delcious.We LOVE the Haciendas !!!!! We can hardly wait for next year.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: walkonthebeach5
Reviews.Content: We did a timeshare exchange at the Royal Haciendas and absolutely loved it! We had a 2 bedroom/2 bath unit and it was very nicely decorated, comfortable, clean, and had a great view.
