Each room had a large wall safe which was very convenient; it was large enough to fit a laptop, cameras, and more. The staff was very friendly, especially our concierge, Melissa who was very helpful throughout our weeklong stay. The maid service was outstanding. The resort amenities were great and the pools and beach area were so nice and relaxing. We had brought our own snorkeling gear with us, but found out that they actually have some there that can be used (no charge) as well as many other items that can be borrowed during your stay. We rented a car so that we could explore the area and because we had a car to use, we were able to eat out (other than the resort restaurants) and shop at a local grocery store (other than the little one at the resort.) We were so happy that we did this since the resort restaurants were pricey compared to most of the other restaurants that we ate at; most were better too. The nachos and the mixed drinks were great at the poolside though! I would highly recommend this resort and hope that we can go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: chopperdan
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing! The staff were excellent and the food great! We were so impressed that we bought a villa! What an amazing vacation with the kids! and snoozing under the palm trees was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: mbi0323
Reviews.Content: The Thomas Moore Travel agents, located in the hotel lobbly, were extremely friendly and helpful with planning our excursions outside the resort. I highly recommed the ATV Tour throught the Jungle. Don't miss Rio Lagoartos with the tour guide Angel (he knows everyone.) The resort itself is clean, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Many of the them even made the effort the learn my name, and I was only there a week! The resort's security made me feel safe. They took down my name and destination each time I left the resort, and noted when I returned. I had a lovey time, and look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding timeshare resort that knows how to please”
Reviews.Author: Robby-Bobby
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check out, the resort took good care of the guests. We were here on a timeshare trade and were staying in a two-bedroom unit that was beautifully appointed and had all modern conveniences. The welcome gift of shampoo was needed since the resort does not provide it. Everything else is there and if you want more, can be purchased at the resort store which is well-stocked. The restaurant food was good, the view seaside dining, outstanding. Everything from snorkel equipemtnt, to kayaks, to golf clubs was provided. The beach was lovely, the water warm. Bring water shoes for the entrance to the ocean is rocky. A few nights in town with good restaurants and a lively atmosphere were entertaining. Seeing the Mayan ruins is a must. Golf at the new club nextdoor was fun and still reasonably priced. A great week.

Reviews.Title: “everything terrific - and never felt safer”
Reviews.Author: pedelson
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful, comfortable, and the service excellent. The beach beautiful, pools all lovely. Went into town on the resort's free shuttle and ate at many local restaurants, never had a bad meal. Bought lots of silver of course. I highly recommend the resort and the area. It is really safe and there is lots of security where ever you go. All the negative stuff you hear isnt happening in Cancun or Playa del Carmen. Eat lots of tacos pastor, and guacamole, drink some Don Julio Reposado Tequila, and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Best Time of my life!”
Reviews.Author: Jayme018
Reviews.Content: I went to the Royal Haciendas Last year for 10 days with my best friend and her parents. They own several properties and timeshares all over the world including Orlando, Mexico(at the Royal Haciendas), and costa Rica. We were there during Thanksgiving and let me tell you it was the BEST Thanksgiving dinner I have ever had in my LIFE. The amount and quality of the food was astounding! We were treated like movie stars the entire time! Anyone who complains about this property is insane! At any place there is always gonna be little things here and there that go wrong. It should be expected...that's life. This is not a HOTEL it is a TIMESHARE. It's more like an apartment you rent but with maid service. They had highspeed internet which worked great. If we had any problems (which we didn't that I can recall) it was taken care of immediatley. I really can't say enough about the place. The staff was wonderful and extremely friendly. I would highly reccommend the Royal Haciendas to anyone anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back & loved every minute!”
Reviews.Author: marygoldon
Reviews.Content: Let me join the masses in applauding this spectacular resort and the (safe!) towns around it! We stayed 6/19-6/26 in a one bedroom villa... a 3rd floor unit and loved the balcony view and hot tub (the Side II had more water views than the Side I)! Used the hotel transportation to & from the airport and visits to nearby towns. We asked our driver to swing by a large local grocery store on the way to the resort (we will NOT support Wal-Mart, especially in Mexico!!). Stocked up with Mexican pastries, cheeses, puro aqua, tomatoes, jalapenos, & purchased eggs, ham, milk, juice from the grocery on-site and enjoyed our own breakfasts & some snacking every day on the patio; stunning! The restaurants and pool/beach side dining were all really good, too (yes, the shrimp tacos are a must!). In a week of eating in Playa & at the resort, we never had a bad meal, and none of us are sick (and we used a LOT of ice!). We bought dark rum & pineapple juice & coconut syrup at the resort store & made pina coladas all the time! Room service was great; we ordered a pizza, hamburger & coconut shrimp; all good too. We enjoyed 2 excursions during our stay. I HIGHLY recommend the snorkeling trip to the reef at Puerto Morelos! Fantastic clear water snorkeling. It was about $50 per person booked at the hotel. They take you on a bus to the city (15 minutes away) and you board a boat and go to 2 sites (the snorkel group was called Almost Heaven - they were great). A 2-3 hour trip; we'll do that again! Also went to Xel-Ha for a day and it was nice (all inclusive and beautiful; great for kids with zip lines etc.)... the snorkeling was OK but a bit murky. The dolphin encounter didn't look good there; we'll go to Xcaret next time & try it there. Back to the resort! The AC was ice cold! Internet & cell phones worked great. Our 12 yr old son enjoyed the game rooms and I loved painting the pottery! They had activites for kids, teens & adults all day M-F. There were a lot of multi-generational families & even babies there; the kids pools were stunning! The room was huge, super clean, lovely! The decor & hand mosaic tiling throughout the resort is beautiful. The king bed was wonderful; the fold downs in the den were a bit hard but the linens are soft & clean! The daily maid service was great... the on-site (staffed) laundry was nice, and the restaurants, food and (strong!) drinks were great too! The front desk always answers the phone on the 1st ring!! We prefer the slower pace of the Riviera Maya (over city of Cancun) and felt safe at all times... use the hotel transportation and stay on 5th Avenue for shopping in Playa; there are policia and check-points all over and you'll have a great time!!! Gosh I wish we were still there............. :) can you tell??

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: MRD123
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location!!! You feel that you are very private. The service is beyond wonderful. I felt very safe. The property is just gorgeous and their #1 priority is for you to enjoy your stay. I highly recommend this wonderful place!!!!! I also loved Playa Del Carmen!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation, relaxation, relaxation”
Reviews.Author: miketothed
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing. A+ service in a A+ location at an A+ facility. The design of the resort is well planned so it never feels too crowded. The service is second to none. My wife and I are here for the second year in a row now and couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: “So far our favorite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kenie
Reviews.Content: We did a day trip here while in Cancun in Feb, 2010 and decided we had to go back. So this year we went for 2 weeks in May. The 1st week we had a 1 bedroom and the 2nd week a 2 bedroom. The units are large and very well kept, and the full kitchen makes it easy to eat in. The only issue we had with the unit is that the 1 bedroom doesn't have a bathtub indoors. It is on the balcony. It does have a nice big shower though. The grounds and pools are very well kept and the beach has lots of palapas and lounge chairs. We found all the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful and we were never pressured to attend the timeshare presentation, although we did take it for the breakfast buffet. Very painless. I used the time to get my PADI certification with Dive Balam, the on-site dive shop. A great group of people and a wonderful experiance. Hats off to Aurora and Cristian. We found it easy to get to Playa with the shuttle or a $10 cab ride and did most of our food shopping at Walmart and Mega. The on-site store was not bad price wise but didn't have the selection the big stores have. The wife walked into town along the beach one day while I was diving and she said it wasn't a bad walk. We will definatly be going back and may even purchase a there if we can find the right week. We thought the on-site restaurant was a bit pricey and we went into Playa for a quite a few dinners. Some great restaurants.....and good prices....

Reviews.Title: “Loved it with some reservations”
Reviews.Author: babs079
Reviews.Content: The entire resort was georgous, clean, spacious and everything I've read about. It was, however, quite remote and while there was a shuttle it was really of little use to us. We took the shuttle into playa the Sunday we arrived. It only stops at one location, which was many blocks passed the store where we wanted to stop. We do have trouble walking, so had to take a cab back to the Mega, then in order to avoid carrying all the groceries back to the "stop" we took another cab back. When we returned to the resort, the bellboy got a grocery cart and brought everyhing to our villa. The bell boys and beach boys were the most helpful and yes the maid spent 2 hours a day in our rooms cleaning. Super clean. It definitely is not Cancun. I also agree with the person, I believe Augus, who said about the pressure to buy. There was not one day that our concierge did not approach us (with the excuse to be of assistance) and insist we meet with Andrew who would explain everything to us. I told her no. She insisted. This lasted for at least 45 minutes to an hour ---- every day. Also, there was a taco party scheduled for Tuesday or Wednesday that week and it did rain in the morning but stopped about 12:30. The taco party was scheduled for 1:45. No notice that it was cancelled, but the worst part is that when we went inside the lobby area, there was a note on the door by the bar, "taco party 2:00". Too late. Three games of bingo. Really? 3 games? All the way there for 3 games. Then, the last game had 2 winners and had to pick a number for the winner. Really? Every resort we've been to has had bingo by the pool. Many empty areas that could have been used for bingo. The Palapa buffet was excellent - but costly. $35.00 each, but it was excellent. The pool bar was ok. The drinks were very good, even the happy hour drinks. The topper was when I finally told our conceriege that it was too remote and I would not consider buying there, that we were informed of a "free" bus trip to cancun. Free. Right. Another high pressure sales pitch from Diamonds International and you had to follow the leader into the store and meet them there to go back. I also asked our conceriege about discounts that I told were given out by bellboys, or others at the resort and I was told , Oh that's why you have to meet with Andrew. he can explain about them and we would get a free breakfast. Right. So, while the resort WAS beautify and mangnificant, it was aggravating every day to know that at some point the sales pitch would begin. We would not return to Royal Haciendas. We've been to at least 10 different resorts and never had this problem. No usually meant no.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for timeshare vacations”
Reviews.Author: Limey_10
Reviews.Content: As usual we were met by our personal concierge for our 4th visit to the Royal Haciendas. All staff meet you with a big smile and a happy Ola" everyday and all day. Excellent food especially in the "Los Murales" restaurant. Lost of new friends to be made on each visit as well as seeing the wonderful staff, some of which have been there for over 15 years. We were so satisfied that we purchased a second time share week and look forward to many years of great times at the Royal Resort properties.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: renee_grant1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights at a time share with another couple and LOVED it! From the rooms, housekeeping, beach, pool, hammocks.....you just can't go wrong. Who doesn't love having cocktails delivered to you on the beach? I loved the whole ambiance of the place. We didn't use our full kitchen as much as we should have--just breakfast and a couple of dinners. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Family Vacation !!!”
Reviews.Author: vse323
Reviews.Content: After spending a week at the Royal Sands, our children and grandchildren met us at the Royal Haciendas for a family vacation. We had 2 units and the resort went out of their way to move our second unit closer to us so we could all be close together. The rooms are very roomy and lots of closet space. We really enjoyed the hot tub on the balcony. The pools on both sides of the resort were very similar. There were also hot tubs which I really enjoyed with warm, not hot water and kiddie pools as well. We enjoyed taking naps in the hammocks and sitting under the palapas on the beach. It was nice having our drinks and lunch delivered to us out on the beach. Since there were 9 of us we took a cab to Walmart to buy goceries. It was only 8 minutes away and 11.00 each way. We ate several of our meals at the beach front reasaurant and also at the pool Grill in the shade. The prices were a little higher than they were at the Sands. We thought the buffets were a little pricey but the kids really enjoyed the Mariachi Band at the Mexican Buffet dinner. They loved the breakfast buffet as well. We also made alot of trips to the market for ice-creams and other snacks as well as to the Bar to get the yummy carrot cake. We loved the Happy hour with the music playing and the Bananna Monkey drinks. If you have children with you, make sure you take them to the kids playroom to play. It is very nice with alot of things to do. They loved painting t-shirts and just running around and playing with the blocks and in the playhouse. They had activities for them also. They enjoyed fishing and playing soccer on the beach. They also had movies for them at night. We took the shuttle into Playa and enjoyed shopping and having dinner. It is really nice there especially after dark when it is all lit up. It was very easy to get a cab back to the resort. They even got a van so we could all ride back together. The resort was very clean and our rooms were spotless. The only complaint I would have is that they took so much time in our rooms cleaning. It was hard to give our grandson a nap. We did ask a couple of days if we could just get clean towels and have the trash emptied. Even though we loved the Royal Haciendas, we felt it was more expensive to eat there than in Cancun. We also love the beautiful blue ocean in Cancun better but we did enjoy gioing out in the water on the beach at the Haciendas.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Neat Resort”
Reviews.Author: Augustlioness
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Haciendas from May 28 through June 4, 2011. Upon arrival from Cancun Airport at 11:00 p.m. the place was deserted and we were told by the front desk that EVERYTHING closes at 10:00 p.m. We had had a long day of traveling and not being able to get some drinking water, snacks, etc. was a little frustrating. I had booked two rooms from Expedia and when we were checked in the two room were on opposite sides of the resort which was annoying. We were told we could move to a suite but it would cost $250 extra for the week. I had also booked an ocean view room on Expedia and we did not have a view of the ocean at all. The room was nice and clean and maid service did an excellent job (except for Sundays, when they do not work - not a big deal at all). The room boasted a HUGE tub/shower, a small kitchenette with a microwave, fridge, coffee maker, sink, towels and dishes, nice furnishings and a comfy bed. My only complaints are the little ants that kept coming in from outside and I would have loved to see some complimentary packets of coffee. The next morning we received a call from our "personal concierge" inviting us to the welcome party. Thank goodness we didn't go because I later found out it was all a big sales pitch in an attempt to sell us a time share. The personal concierge called us almost every morning at 9:00 a.m. to invite us to come to different parties or just to meet him. He managed to find us one day at the pool and "grilled" us for 45 minutes while were attempting to relax. I didn't like being bothered while trying to relax on vacation. The daily water aerobics classes were very fun and made you feel like you were getting some sort of exercise to burn off the calories from the drinks. The pool bar was great, the bartenders are very pleasant and accommodating - I thought the drinks prices were a little steep (unless you drank during happy hour). The food from the pool bar was excellent (we had the steak wrap, shrimp tacos, steak tacos, mahi-mahi wrap, hamburgers, steak sandwich, ceviche and nachos and all very fresh and delicious). We went to the Palapa Restaurant one evening; service was VERY slow and a limited selection on the menu. They did have a Mexican buffet that evening but was a little pricey at $30 per person. The Lapu Lapu Express was nice (it took the place of room service). We ordered a pizza one evening and on another night had the whole roasted chicken, mashed potatoes and gravy, salad and steamed veggies which were all delicious and reasonably priced. The market was great and had a nice selection - pricey though ($8.00 for a box of cereal or a bag of chips). There were morning coffee selections offered in the Rotunda (lobby) Bar that were decent and reasonably priced. We did not use the spa or the gym (would have loved to but it was an additional $8 per day) and we did not visit the seafood restaurant off the Rotunda Bar, but wish we would have, as I heard from other guests it was fabulous. The resort was always immaculate and the staff friendly and gracious. If I was to go back I would personally prefer to stay right off the 5th Avenue so we wouldn't have to pay for taxis back and forth every night at a cost of anywhere from $12 to $15 USD for a 15 minutes ride. There is a free shuttle that the resort offers but I believe the last one leaving the resort is at 4:30pm and the last one leaving 5th Avenue is at 5:30pm. Upon checkout you HAVE to be out of your room by 11:00 a.m. and they come by at 11:00 on the dot to make sure you're out. The lobby is very crowded with visitors waiting for their transportation to pick them up. We ended up just going out by the pool and grabbing a bite to eat so we would have a place to sit. I believe check-in is at 4:00 p.m. so I'm wondering why they wouldn't give you until noon to check out? All in all, it was a nice visit and I would recommend it if you're not concerned with being close to the main area of Playa. If you don't want to hear the sales pitch, DO NOT talk to your concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ajeffers
Reviews.Content: Our second time there. Great activities for adults and children. Close to Playa so if you need nightlife it's available. But what we love so much is the service, cleanliness,and beautiful setting. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “We love the location We hate how much money we spent”
Reviews.Author: dordonez
Reviews.Content: Yes this is a beautiful place to visit, we hate how expensive this place is. Maintenance started about 600.00 usd and now we payed over 900.00 usd. On our first day there we made the mistake to order tequila shots which cost us 20.00 usd each. Later that night we decided to have dinner at the Palapa Del Sol; and were offered a "Seafood Buffet" for a 27.00 usd per person cost however seafood was very hard to find. The problem with this timeshare is that it is somewhat far from other establishments so you are at their mercy when it comes to dinning. One the last day of our stayed we were informed that we had burned our mattress and we would be responsible for the cost; so we asked the front desk to send someone to discuss damages because we are non smokers and we did not do any damage to any mattress in our villa. Upon arrival the person sent by the front desk did not see any damage so they sent someone else to evaluate the damage. This person told us that it was not the mattress but the "expensive polyester quilt" which according to them if you saw it under a specific lighting you would be able to tell that it was burned. The total cost of this expensive polyester quilt would be around 39,000.00 pesos (about 390.00 usd) which he would give us a break and we could pay him 150.00 if we accepted responsibility for this damage; which under no circumstances we accepted any responsibility for any damage. At the time of check out they had added this 390.00 usd to our bill which again we explained that we would not be paying for this charge however the explained that this was added to our bill in error. This is our second third time visiting beautiful Hacienda at Playa Del Carmen on our second visit we had numerous charges added to our bill in error. So be careful when visiting beautiful Haciendas. As beautiful as this place is no place to relax when it comes to money matters. We made a big mistake buying 1 lousy week in the Haciendas.

Reviews.Title: “From one owner to another...”
Reviews.Author: FDHOTEL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our annual stay in one of our 3 weeks of timeshare purchased through Royal Resorts. To say I was dissapointed this time around is an understatement. To start with the good news..., facilities, villas, housekeeping and pool staff are remarkable, the best I have experienced for a timeshare resort. Now for the bad news, they know we are trapped on the resort grounds unless we want to get ready each evening and head to Playa del Carmen for dinner, drinks, etc...My wife and I ate in the beachfront restaurant a few nights, although excellent food, we both felt they were taking advantage of us at $27.00 per person for a dinner buffet, with equally high breakfast and lunch pricing. This is supposed to be a non profit organization and as they share in their resort "guidelines"...don't bother complaining as they will not offer compensation as they cannot afford to do so.? As a traveler to Mexico for the past 35 years, we have always found it to be economical and a great value for the dollar, NOT this time...Royal Resorts is getting greedy and pricing themselves higher than most 5 star resorts in the Riviera Maya? We also had dinner in the resorts newest 'fine dining' restaurant and proceeded to bring 2 bottles of $80-$100 wine to enjoy for my wifes Birthday and my mother joining us from their Royal timeshare in Cancun. We were asked by the host to see the bottles as he had to look them up on the menu to determine 'what' to charge us? he then proceed to inform us that he would charge us 50% of their price on their menu simply based on vintage and varietal? WHAT?? 5 star restaruants in Vegas dont charge more than $25 for corkage and they want to charge us 50%? I remind you of their 'non profit' claim? We decided to forego our wine and just purchase theirs, which started off our evening with a very bad taste in our mouths...the food was forgetable to say the least as they are trying to be a 5 star fine dining experience. That is not why we travel to Mexico each year, we expect good food at reasonalbe prices...the prices by the way are more than most US restaurants? Lastly, be prepared to pay for use of the workout facility...$50 for the week? every major resort offers this amenity for free! As an owner of 3 weeks with Royal Resorts, I am now considering selling all 3 or simply exchanging them for future years to other resorts in the Carribean and the Riviera Maya...they have forgotten their roots and the owners...probably tyring to make up for all of the money they recently lost in the fund closure of Club International?

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at Royal Haciendas, Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: cozumel1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 day stay at Royal. This is our second visit and loved it just as much as the first time. Last year we exchanged through our time share. This year we found a great deal on-line directly at the Royal Haciendas website. The development is extremely clean. The staff is completely courteous. We stayed in a 1 BR suite. There is a complete kitchen with all the necessities for you to cook if you choose. Aside from the 1 BR, there are two murphy beds in the living/dining room. Perfect if you have two kids or if you have last minute guests who don't mind sleeping in twins. The bedding is comfortable and very clean and spacious. All the units have balconies, the suites have a jacuzzi which I absolutely took advantage of. There is a grocery store on site that has literally everything (including shopping carts) if you choose to make breakfast/lunch a few days a week. There is a fitness center that I took advantage of everyday, how often can you work out looking at the ocean. $38 for a week pass also gives you access to the spa. If you don't use all the punches, save it for next year. The equipment is no different than home. Perfect! The Palapa restaurant if you want to dine in with family. The food is very good. If you want to eat in, there is also take out or they will deliver to your room, including pizza. There is also a 2nd restaurant for fine dining. The Rotanda Bar for after evening drinks. There are two phases and each has its own outdoor grill area. There is happy hour from 3 - 6. The resort also provides beach towels and there are a multitude of games for the kids, both water and in the game room, volleyball, tennis and if you golf, the property is right next door. Royal has its own beach including chairs and palapas to cover the sun. There are chairs that have been designated for the handicap. The Royal is exactly 10 minutes to Playa del Carmen, 5th Avenue where all the action is. The resort is South of Cancun. If you want to explore the Yucatan, every park is between 30 and 40 minutes. Thomas Moore is on site and arranges the excursions. Don't rent a car, its too expensive. If your adventurous, you can go to the bus terminal in Playa del Carmen. The buses are about $2 - 3 depending on where you want to go. My husband and I took the bus to Akumal, a fisherman's beach. It was beautiful. There is also a shuttle that the resort provides that you should take advantage of to take you in town. It doesn't run past 6:30 pm. You can catch a cab back to the resort for $10 US. The resort also has laundry facilities. 5th Avenue in Playa is a blast. There are a variety of restaurants from inexpensive to a bit more expensive. There are sports bars to catch the games, there is 12th avenue where all the clubs are. I can't say enough about this property. You may be asked to attend the time share presentation, you can say not thanks or give them 90 minutes of your time. Up to you!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility and Security”
Reviews.Author: MAC553
Reviews.Content: The staff is well trained and attentive. Many amenities . . . too many to use! The beach is beautiful with many 'palapas' and chaise lounges. The Spa is beautiful and the restaurants have varied menus. The on-site "mercado" is well stocked with moderate wines. The concierge can find what you need if it isn't on site!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Haciendas!”
Reviews.Author: californiadeb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Royal Haciendas and absolutely loved it. As everyone else has stated, the resort is lovely and unbelievably clean. We did an exchange through Interval International for the full 2 bedroom unit. We have stayed at two other Royal Resorts and really liked this one. I will try to give some information that others have not so as to be useful to other exchangers. We did receive the unit number that was indicated with II and it was a great room. We were on the top floor (fourth) with an ocean view to the side, looking down upon the central grounds. Because we were on the top floor, it was very private and also had the extra high ceilings. It was extremely quiet, we never once heard any neighbors around us. I never saw any insects other than an ant or two down at the beach, nor any lizards. This is a huge deal to me since I hate large bugs! Maybe it was the time of year we visted but we never saw a single cockroach (palmetto bug) anywhere we went the whole trip, which is very unusual for the tropics. We arrived around noon on Saturday and check-in was a breeze. We were directed to a special desk for exchangers but we had no wait and it went very smoothly. Our room was still being cleaned but we were given our keys and told we could go on up if we wanted to. We checked it out, then went down for lunch and drinks. By the time we finished lunch, our maid was done and we were able to settle in (around 1:30). Perfect. We were on the beach by 2:00! Everyone is assigned a personal concierge for the week. Our guy was very friendly and not too pushy about asking if we wanted to do a timeshare meeting. We politely declined and that was the end of it. He never bothered us again. Whenever we wanted to make shuttle reservations or dinner reservations in town, we just called him and he took care of it immediately. The unit has magnifying makeup mirrors in both bathrooms, which is really great for us women. The master bath has an amazing walk-in shower that is perfect, great water pressure and plenty of hot water. The jacuzzi tub on the balcony is wonderful, we used it every night. It fills up in about 5 minutes. Very romantic! We did have 2 power outages during the week but it happened during the day and did not affect us other than limiting the bar food and drink choices while the power was out. The pool bar service is great, we were served every day down on the beach, you just put up your flag and they come. The happy hour drinks were good and huge! My favorites were the mango daquiris and the mojitos. Cost was only about $5.00 for a grande during happy hour. They also gave you free chips and salsa with your drinks during happy hour and the salsa was great. We found the service all week long to be outstanding wherever we went, on resort and off. There was no delay ever for anything. The kitchen is well stocked and even has a non-stick pan for cooking eggs. There is no garbage disposal in the sink, which we found irritating and they do not provide paper towels or liquid dish soap for any hand washing of dishes. You can easily buy these at the on-site market. However, we had daily maid service which was great, she did a fantastic job, she even washes out your shower every day. We tipped $5 a day to the maid, she does more than just change your towels. Also, they provide free wi-fi in the units which is a huge benefit for me as I have to check in for work periodically since I am self-employed. The internet connection worked fine the whole week. The on-site market had everything we needed to make breakfasts and lunches for the week, plus make cocktails. It was not terribly expensive and we were very happy not to have to make a trip into Playa to get get groceries. It is very well stocked. For the convenience and time saving alone, I recommend just using their market. We never had a problem getting a palapa and chairs at the beach all week, in fact we got a front row one everyday and the earliest we ever went down was 10:30. The pool chairs do fill up fast but we are beach people so we only went to the pool at the end of the day, if at all. The sand is beautiful, white and powder soft and it never gets hot. We stayed in Phase 1 and having checked out the whole beach down both sides quite a ways, I have to say that the Phase 1 beach is by far the best spot. The water is calm and crystal clear. Yes, there are alot of rocky areas but there are also 2 large sandy areas where you can walk out a very long way in clear shallow water. The water in front of Phase 2 is murky and much rougher with seaweed. I would not have been happy with the beach if that had been our only choice. As you walk even further north on the beach the water is even murkier and full of seaweed and seagrass. The beach going south toward Playa is very rocky in the water. So the best spot is dead central in front of Phase 1. We did try snorkeling out here but when we out it was so shallow over the rocks and coral that I cut my knee so we did not go out again. We did spent an entire day snorkeling down in Akumal at Yal-Ku Lagoon and Akumal Bay and that was excellent. We saw a giant turtle, must have been 5 ft. long in Akumal Bay. We hired a taxi driver for the day for $100 and he took us to each place and stayed until we wanted to go to the next place. I won't go into all the places we ate in Playa other than to mention that you must go to Alux Restaurant. It was closed for a few months but is open again and it is amazing. It is inside a dried cenote/caverns and was really fascinating. The food was fine, not great but not terrible, actually the filet mignons were excellent. But go because it is a setting you won't believe. After our dinner, our waiter took us for a private tour through the caverns and it is just beautiful. We had an amazing trip and loved everything about it. The weather was perfect all week, not a drop of rain and was in the 80's, although by the last day you could feel it getting hotter and more humid than the whole week had been. We will definitely be going back some day!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Condo Resort on the Beach and Near Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: sharney29
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at The Royal Haciendas (TRH) in Playa del Carmen (PDC) for the week of April 16-23, 2011 (week before Easter). We booked with them over Expedia and chose the resort after seeing what was included and the age requirement for making a reservation is 25. We weren’t interested in crazy spring break partying. Most of the travelers were older couples whose kids are grown or families with young kids. There weren’t many couples, and we were definitely the only two single travelers together. The resort is so large that you don’t get the feeling there are many people there, although many of the rooms were booked. I had read somewhere that the staff might not be that helpful because of the property being condos for buying rather than a hotel. I found quite the opposite. Everyone seemed even more hospitable, interested in our stay, and extremely helpful. The resort is enormous and beautiful. All of the villas, landscaping, grounds, pools, shops, etc. are very well cared for. There are two sides to the resort, and both sides are surrounded by the rooms (they call them villas). Each side of the resort has one lap pool, a child’s pool that is 1.5 feet deep, a larger pool (about 4 feet deep) with the swim up bar, and a hot tub. There is also a gym, rec room, tennis court on top of the hotel, bar/pool area inside the hotel (The Rotunda), fancier restaurant (Los Murales), and then the main restaurant (La Palapa) that has a nice menu, buffet, and express/take-out option. Each of the main pools also has a bar/restaurant with seating. There are also sports desks and towel desks for both sides. The sports desks have the scuba tours through Dive Balam (closed on Saturdays), with instructors and equipment. The towel desk offers towels whenever and is open from about 7:30am to 10:30pm. For everything you do at the resort (eat, shop, use towels, etc.), you will be asked to give your villa number. All charges are made to the total room bill and paid at the end of the stay, except for tips. You will receive your final bill the morning the day before you leave, and can pay it that day making check-out easier. After you pay the bill, you can then use credit card or cash. For the towel desk, they will run your card and then keep the white/yellow copies of the charge slip. When you return the towel, they give you the yellow copy for your records. You can check-out and return towels as often as needed. On each side of the resort are lifeguard stations to watch the beach, flags indicating the level of caution for swimming, and beach chairs with umbrellas. The chairs and umbrellas are available for anyone. They just ask you do not leave you stuff for hours at a time and prevent others from using them. Later in the morning or afternoon, a hostess will give each group a flag to indicate if you need food or drink service, and she will wait on you at the beach. The waves were pretty rough most of the day when we were there, and the flags generally alternated between yellow and red. The lifeguards and beach monitors keep a close eye on the guests to keep everyone out of the water when the flags are red, and especially as night falls. There are a couple of smaller spaces off the beach for swimming, but otherwise the beach has a lot of rocky areas. Don’t let that deter you from visiting, though, because you can walk around the bend to the south toward the Grand Coral and find very wide shallows for great swimming (soft sands, brilliant clear water, no rocks or coral, etc.). We only saw the Grand Coral from the beach, but it seems to be much smaller, less developed or progressing, and maybe condos? There wasn’t much to it, and there were very few people which made for great enjoyment for us. From TRH beach, you can see Cozumel in the distance and approaching cruise ships. You can’t make out the size of the island, but can see the taller buildings. We booked the junior suite, which is the smaller side of the villa. The floors are all tiled, the walk-in bath/shower is tile, there is a separate dressing area with a double vanity; small kitchenette area with a sink, microwave, refrigerator, basic dishes, and toaster; two double beds, small desk and chair, another small table by the terrace/balcony, large armoire with the TV and drawers, and excellent closet space. Within the closet was the large ironing board and iron, hangers, storage above and below, and a closet safe. We were on the first floor, and therefore had a small terrace that was accessed through sliding doors. There were two chairs and a small table outside to view the resort. The resort has free WiFi, and you will be given the code when you check in. We had no problem using it, and were even able to access it with just my sister’s ipod (not an iphone). We took the Thomas More transportation shuttle (housed within the resort and other hotels; more comment elsewhere regarding tours). You can Google their website and call/email them directly to set up the transportation. The shuttle will be billed to you room, so you don’t need any money on hand to pay except for tips. We were warned by other travelers online that when you arrive at Cancun airport many people will try to stop you to provide you transportation. The voucher emailed to me in confirmation explained what the Thomas More would be wearing to help differentiate them. Pay close attention to what they say to look for and make sure to leave the airport. If someone stops you while you are still inside, they are not from Thomas More. The Thomas More staff was located just outside the doors (this is after you get your passport stamped, get your luggage, and go through security again for customs). They were wearing short-sleeved dress shirts in bright yellow, with navy pants. You show them your voucher and they hook you up with the shuttle and other parties you’re scheduled with. They will place luggage stickers on each piece and give you copies to claim later from the bellboys at the resort. The shuttle runs every 45 minutes between the hours of about 7am and 7pm, although you should check the times when you are there. The shuttle you arrange only transports between the Cancun airport and The Royal Haciendas (TRH), which means once your shuttle has your party and the other parties scheduled on that shuttle, you go directly to the resort. You will be asked to schedule your return transportation the day before you take your return flight. You can do that at the Thomas More desk in the resort. When you arrive to The Royal Haciendas, it’s a ways back into the arid jungle/brush, near other major hotels (although you can’t see them from the resort). We often entered at the same entrance as Grand Coral and there are signs for others. The trip from the Cancun airport is partially on highway and partially through town. TRH is not located in the downtown of Playa del Carmen (PDC), but is right on the beach. (More on getting downtown later.) The front entry is bustling with transportation going in and out, and bellboys. The bellboys will hook all of your luggage going to your room together and deliver it to your room once you’ve checked in and you call them for it to be delivered. At check-in, the staff provided a book that guides to all of the resorts amenities and gives recommendations for tips. A map was given, with the villa number. In the lobby, is the Thomas More travel agency through which you can book the airport shuttle or tours to local ruins, cenotes, towns, excursions, etc. There is an ATM in the lobby that dispenses U.S. dollars for a charge of 60 pesos. The front desk will exchange U.S. dollars into pesos. There is a daily limit on the exchange (maybe $300/day USD) and the week (maybe $1,500 USD). They typically dispense the larger bills of pesos, so you may want to ask for smaller bills. At the time of our trip, the exchange range was about 11-12 pesos per dollar. They were giving 100 peso bills, which meant initially our smallest bills were $10 USD. Some of the local vendors in town and on the excursions may haggle that they cannot make change if they see you only have a larger bill. The smaller bills ($50 pesos and $20 pesos) are useful for tipping. Also off the lobby, are the spa, market, Rotunda bar, Los Murales restaurant, membership area, and a schedule of activities. We did not visit the spa, Rotunda bar, or Los Murales, so I can’t comment on the services or costs. Los Murales does have the menu posted outside the restaurant, so you are able to check the menu and costs before going inside. The market is a mini-grocery store that offers the basic for all meals (breakfast, fresh fruit and vegetables, frozen meals, juice, soda, milk), snacks, desserts, liquor, souvenirs, a small pharmacy, pool toys, flip-flops, etc. The market is open from about 7:30am until about 10:30pm. Prices are in pesos. Many of the brands are native to Mexico, although some are U.S. brands in Spanish packaging. The prices on Mexican vanilla and honey are reasonable, and better than most of the shops we visited in downtown Playa del Carmen. The honey is real bee honey, and the Yucatan is supposed to have some of the best honey because of the type of bees. Either way, it was better than what we often find on shelves here (most often clover honey) and far less expensive than our pure bee honey. The membership area is where you might meet with the personal host and concierge assigned to you. You will receive cards, notes, and phone calls to join them for welcome parties, taco parties, breakfast, etc. If you choose to visit with them, you’ll hear about the company that owns TRH and your opportunities to become an owner in the property. We did not attend the parties, although we tried to be polite and decline. We booked through Expedia, and were not interested in time share opportunities. You may need to call/visit the membership desk if you want to book a shuttle into the downtown of Playa del Carmen that is at a time not run by the front desk. The other thing that is at the hotel in the middle is a selection of souvenir merchants. They offer many of the same handicraft and jewelry choices as you’ll see in downtown, so you would be better off to wait and see what else you find. They will tell you they are only there for that day, but will magically reappear the next day and thereafter. Transportation to Playa del Carmen is offered free of charge through the hotel. It is generally provided by taxis the hotel calls and organizes around a schedule. (There are many taxis that stay on hand on the property just around the corner from the entrance. They are readily available as soon as you get to the front steps by the lobby. The front steps staff will call the taxi and set up the transportation for you at that moment. You do not need to schedule ahead.). The first taxi going into PDC is at 10:15 and the last is at 6:30. The last return taxi from PDC to TRH is at 6:00. When you check in, they will give you a schedule, along with the limits on how many people can go at a time. If you want to go in the evening, book early. We went out on the last Friday night, and they had four vans going. The limit was 40 people, and they were booked. The taxis are white with sea green strip on them. They are clearly marked as taxis and have the numbers on the back. TRH staff keeps a close eye on which travelers get into which taxi, and will keep track of the taxi you bring back. This is true for the shuttle if you set it up, or if you book a taxi separately. You can arrange a taxi to many of the local hotels, towns, and excursions. The front steps staff has a table with the estimated costs for those trips. If you want to go into/leave PDC at time that isn’t offered on the shuttles, the cost is about $12USD plus tip. The shuttle drops off and picks up at the same spot near 5th Avenue (the main street for food and shopping). It’s at the same area where the taxis congregate, so they’re easy to find if you choose to go it without the shuttle. There are many warnings on other sights online to be wary of taxis and be sure you take one marked correctly. We were very fortunate with our drivers. They were all courteous and helpful with local recommendations. Most were able to speak basic English and understood our even more basic Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, clean, well maintained, with choices”
Reviews.Author: jalec1962
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from the Royal Haciendas resort. The grounds are very well maintained, and clean. The condition of the equipment in the villa was wonderful, although my wife thought the bed was hard. Daughter slept on Murphy bed, which was also hard. The linens and towels were nice and there is tile work everywhere. Loved how the villa was outfitted and arranged. Recommend getting the food in town the first day, but you can get everything you need at the local market, at a bit higher price. The mini kitchen was nicely outfitted, but prepare yourself by getting a cartload of groceries in town and save the $150 extra. The food at the beach side restaurant was average at best, perhaps a 5-6 out of 10. Never tried the buffet, as it was too little for too much money. The lime soup was good but they need more choice in salads. My daughter became ill from food once. The poolside bar guacamole is great, and the drinks were good as well. All staff was courteous, well mannered, helpful, and worked with our very limited Spanish to reach understanding. There were enough social activities to complete and choose from. The surf was posted red or yellow the entire time we were there but we still had plenty to do. Having free internet was very nice, but at reduced capacity. Hotel shuttle capacity to downtown Playa was limited and the staff was reluctant to order more unless demanded. Be prepared to be offered several time-share breakfasts from your 'personal concierge'; we were able to dodge them relatively easily though. There is no night life at the resort, which we appreciated. If we needed to do something, Playa is 10 minutes away. NO SPRING BREAKERS is the rule, and they enforce it well. The evenings on the deck were peaceful and quiet. We did not have enough time to do everything we wanted. Be warned, the resort operates on Mexico time; everything is 10-15 minutes (or more) late. My wife and daughter completed their open water diving training the week before and were working to complete their open water certifications and I was able to go diving six times. The Dive Balaam shop is staffed with wonderful people; Aurora, Gabby, Carlos, Marcos, Christian and 'Ricco'. The dives were fun, enjoyable, relaxing, and I can’t even estimate how many different species of marine life we saw. Drift dives are a lot of fun. Don't golf at the Grand Coral, just in front of the resort, until about the middle of May, when they expect to have it finished, and even then ask how many holes are open. There are only 9 holes available right now. It will be nice, but too broken up right now. The resort has an arrangement with the Mayakoba golf resort, which is half price Monday morning. Great golf course for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of lack of amenities...”
Reviews.Author: ConnieLongBeach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Haciendas as part of a Timeshare promotion fo r4 nites. The timeshare presentation was not pushy at all and didn't take too much of our time. The resort is in a good location and offers shuttle service to Playa Del Carmen uo til 6 pm. The grounds are well kept and the rooms very clean and new yet rather dull and "brown" for our taste...hardly Mexican feeling. The pool and beach palapas are very nice and there were plenty available. Having said that, there were problems with this resort. We were in the lockoff unit. We have stayed in these units at other timeshares but have never beem told that we can have only 1 bath , 1 face towel and 1 washcloth per person per day. If we wanted another one the charge would be $5.00 per day. Also, there were 2 bars of soap but no shampoo, lotion,etc. Also, we were expected to wash our dishes daily, maids only make the beds and clean the bathroom but there was no dishwashing soap. Also, the small frig had a very tiny freezer yet, there's no ice machines so you have to buy a bag of ice every day. I willsay, the beds and linens were great. The take out rotisserie chicken was quite good but the buffet looked sad for the price. There are numerous good restauants in Playa Del Carmen. Would we stay here again...maybe...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: Ryder10Minneapolis
Reviews.Content: The resort was a great value for families with young children. It is a very large resort, so if you're looking to be by the pool and beach, stay in a beachfront room. The pools are great for kids. The beach is also really nice. However the ocean is a little rocky. They have activities for kids every day on the beach (beach soccer, sand castle building, etc), which our kids loved. They have a grocery/liquor store on site which was very conveinient. They also had photographers available to schedule sessions for family pictures. There were a few disappointments. There are only 3 restaurants on the resort, two of which are open for dinner. Having young kids along, a few more choices of restaurants would have been nice. Although the 2 casual restaurants we frequented had great food. The biggest disappointment was the time-share pitch. We rented a 2 bedroom beachfront condo off of their website. I knew it was a time-share property, so I probably should have been aware of a sales pitch to come. However, they would approach us on the beach, in the pool and at restaurants. They wanted us to come back for another meeting in their office. This was after a 1.45 hour presentation we reluctantly attended. They also continually tried to connect us with other families, like ours, to have lunch, dinner, etc. I know they're just doing their jobs, but we wanted to be left alone. So other than that, it's a really nice place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but mainly for kids, not adults.”
Reviews.Author: KES2010
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a quiet place to relax with your signficiant other, this is NOT the place. Of course this may depend of what weeks you go. When we were there we were constantly surrounded by screaming young children running around unsupervised. It took us awhile to find some (small) spots where we could go to get some peace and quiet. You couldn't even go in the hot tubs (where a sign says kids are not allowed) without being splashed by some kid drinking a virgin pina colada. Even at the pool bar (where a sign says kids are not allowed) kids were sitting there drinking/eating along with their parents. Of course this is not the resort's fault, but maybe they could enforce their rules a little more and really create an area that is kid-free. There is a kiddie pool but no one was using it b/c they all prefer the big pools. However that is my only complaint. The rooms are beautiful. The beach and pool are lovely. The staff is wonderful and friendly. The welcome party rocks-free rum and cokes and free cervezas. And newly added guac and salsa bar. Taco party is also great. The activities like bingo and trivia are lots of fun. Not a lot of people play so you have great odds of winning t-shirts and bags. There were 2 weddings when we were there on the beach, fun to watch. Downtown Playa del Carmen is really nice and romantic compared to downtown Cancun. And the weather was amazing all week! Maybe someone can let me know what weeks there aren't a lot of kids there and I'll be there in a heartbeat!! Or I'll just have to wait until I have kids then maybe it won't annoy me so much.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and beautiful - you should stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MoneyM
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a vacation at the Royal Haciendas with an old college friend for a "girls week away." I can't begin to describe how clean and beautiful this hotel was. We decided to stay here becasue we needed to travel on a budget and for the price, this place cannot be beat. We got one of the "lower grade" B-side rooms which was spacious, had a deck looking over the ocean and grounds, a gorgeous bathroom and all the amenities you could hope for - plus a small kitchenette that we used for breakfast and to make sandwiches some afternoons. We shopped at the market on the property and found it to be affordable and convenient. We also ate in the restaurant on-site and it was delicious. Only thing to keep in mind: Shuttle service is sporatic and limited so plan to take taxis in and out of central Playa for the most part (about $12 USD each way). Gym was $8 additonal charge also. These were the only minor, minor things I'd mention. We had a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to rest and share quality family time”
Reviews.Author: SPRINGBREAK2011_mc
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and attention from Resort personnel, from concierge till Restaurant attendance. This place have such a wonderful atmosphere, that you can even just sit and read, and at night go to an excellent restaurant, meanwhile my kids (teenager) have dun in a safty environment

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: madonerider
Reviews.Content: My significant other and I just returned (April 9, 2011) from a week at The Royal Haciendas Resort on an exchange of my time-share through Interval International. We couldn't be more pleased with the resort. All of the people that work there were extremely friendly (usually with a "Welcome Home" or "Hola" whenever you were greeted); security was present, but not at all invasive; the entire resort was just fabulous in terms of creating a completely relaxing atmosphere; the food was very good; the little store on site was very well stocked and the prices were very reasonable; the margaritas and pina coladas were perfectly frosty and the beer was always cold; the various pools were always just perfectly warm; and our personal concierge, Lenny, was extremely friendly and more than helpful the entire week. I have no hesitancy in recommending this resort, and no doubt, i will go back again in the future - probably very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spring Getaway for our Family”
Reviews.Author: dkuntz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Haciendas for a week for spring break. The villa was perfect for our family. My wife and I has a spacious king bedroom and our three girls stayed in the living area. The two older girls slept in the clever murphy beds that pulled out of the entertainment center and a crib was brought up for our two-year-old. The food at the pool bar for lunches or early dinner was very tasty. Tacos and wraps were our favorites. Drinks were very tasty. We ate at the Italian night in the beach side restaurant. We would not recommend this. We went into Playa a couple of times to shop for groceries to have in our villa. The on-site store was a bit expensive but very convenient and had an excellent selection of snacks and food for meals. The staff at Royal Haciendas was exceptional. Very welcoming, courteous, and seemed genuinely interested in our comfort. Octavio, our personal concierge, checked in with us several times over the course of the week to make sure we were enjoying our stay and to see if we needed anything. Other reviewers have mentioned that the personal concierges are only there to sell timeshare space. I would have to disagree. I had one conversation with Octavio about timeshares and rentals and felt no pressure whatsoever. He gave me the information I wanted and answered my questions with honesty. The common pool was a perfect blend of shallow areas for our younger daughter and deeper water for our older swimmers. It was windy for most of our stay so we didn't spend much time on the beach. However, the beach area was clean and the water warm. If one is looking for a party place or rowdy spring break trip, Royal Haciendas is not the place. Our stay was very laid back and relaxing. Activity really quieted down after dinner time which allowed my wife and I to have some relaxing time on the patio after our girls were asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Clean, but the Salepeople (aka concierges) went too far this time”
Reviews.Author: bethy424
Reviews.Content: We are owners at the Royal Sands and decided to take a second trip this year to the Royal Haciendas for a change in scenery. Plus our kids just adore the gentler surf and the whirlpools on the balconies. We rented through the Royal Resorts rental program. This resort has outstanding faciilities. The tilework is breathtaking. The maids keep the villas spotless. The maintenance team works nonstop to keep the resort sparkling clean. We would recommend this resort to anyone who would like a quiet, relaxing, comfortable week at a Carribbean beach. And our weather was stunning. All that said, we are going to Hawaii next year. Even if we can't rent out our Royal Sands week - we'll just take the loss. Part of it is that we honestly are probably just ready for a change of scenery and a little dose of a different culture. But the other reason is that we need a break from the salespeople (aka concierges). I am totally burned out on dealing with them. We are already Royals owners and own a couple other quality timeshares as well. I think maybe this makes us a desirable target for the sales team but the truth is, we are HIGHLY informed timeshare owners and users and know exactly what we do and don't want to buy. We have the perfect TS portfolio to meet our family's vacation needs. We also do non-TS travel (imagine that!) We stated all this politely to our concierge during week 0 at the very beginning. But he was way too aggressive. He knocked on our door too many times. Once when I answered the door for room service (in my robe) he was standing there, too and would not go away so I could get dressed and serve my family their food while it was hot. He tracked us down at the beach, etc. He patronizingly lectured me (a woman) about how we MUST meet with our contact (his superior) at the Royals during every visit just to "maintain the relationship" and that doing so had nothing to do with promoting sales. I am not an idiot. Finally, when all else failed he and a woman concierge stalked me ( I could see them watching me as I moved around) at a resort activity/event and then approached me so she could give me the same spiel in a softer, less aggressive tone. Ugh. I just sort of sick to my stomach all week having to deal with this. I totally understand and sympathize that these folks are just trying to make a living and support their families in an increasingly precarious tourism environment in Mexico. But scaring guests (and owners!) away and making them not want to return is not the way to keep the pipeline open! All that said, I do love the Royal Resorts in general for the quality of the buildings and grounds, cleanliness and lovely beaches and look forward to returning refreshed in a couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic Resort in a great location. Only a few minor details keeping this from achieving a "10"”
Reviews.Author: chibuilder
Reviews.Content: Royal Haciendas is a truly beautiful resort. We had a great week in Playa del Carmen (3/26 – 4/2/11) and would love to go back. As others have said, the resort is kept VERY clean and the location is exceptional. We stayed in unit G447 which was a penthouse unit near the lobby in the Phase 2 section of the resort with a great view over the pools, hammocks, and out towards the beach and ocean. This location proved to be very good for our family as we loved the morning sun, the great views over the resort and liked the upper floor location. As a penthouse, this unit was one of the Deluxe Villa layouts (as opposed to the normal flexivilla plan) which meant we benefitted from an extended size master bedroom with a sitting area and very tall, vaulted ceilings in each bedroom and the living room. We had friends travelling with us that stayed in the 1br suite portion of G354 which is also in phase 2 with very good views but because it is on the 3rd floor is not a deluxe villa plan and was missing the vaulted ceilings and extra sitting area in the MBR. Even so, it was more than adequate and very nice. We thought the pool and poolside restaurant were superior on the Phase 2 side of the resort but the beach was better on the Phase 1 side. It was always easy to find some pool chairs and there seemed to be plenty of palapas out on the beach. As others have noted the villas are very clean, well-laid out and nicely furnished. They have full kitchens with stovetop and oven (an actual oven is rare in Mexico), plus microwave and dishwasher. Granite counters in the kitchen and both baths are all very nice. The tile work throughout the villa and especially in the showers is very nice and upscale. Tile floors throughout and a nice whirlpool tub on the balcony. Keep in mind that due to the tropical climate, if you open your patio doors and don’t turn down the AC, your floors will collect condensation and that will quickly turn them from beautiful tiled floors to basically a hard-surfaced slip n slide. There are only a few things that, in my mind, keep this from being a true “10.” For reference, I consider the Four Seasons Residence Club at Aviara to be a “10” so have admittedly very high standards. These minor flaws include the lack of in-unit laundry (there is a central laundry at the resort but no machines in the actual units), no automatic ice-maker in the fridge/freezer (seems like a petty oversight given the otherwise top notch kitchen, no maid service on Sunday (or Mexican holidays) vs. 7 day service at a truly luxurious resort, a somewhat mediocre spa experience (one might chalk it up to the therapist…not the resort/spa), the staff is generally accommodating but not quite world class like you might experience at a Four Seasons resort (though they do try and some are excellent….others are still learning and I know that even a resort representative mentioned this as a continuing point of learning for their staff), and the resort shuttle to/from Playa del Carmen is very limited in times and capacity and not so easy to reserve. There is a strong taxi union in the area and the Royal Resorts Shuttle has a very limited schedule and must be reserved a day in advance. Since the resort is in Mexico and renting a car isn’t always comfortable for travelers in a foreign country, I view a robust shuttle as essential and don’t see how a taxi union could gripe about a private property servicing its members only. Several days during our stay, we were unable to reserve space on the shuttle. There are plenty of cabs, and the cost is approximately $23 round trip (for 4 people). None of these things will keep you from having a great trip and the resort is truly very nice but these items are what separate the 10’s from the 9.5’s in my mind. Each guest is assigned a personal concierge. Nice, but my personal preference is a staffed concierge desk with people available all the time (our personal concierge was there during the days but not in the evenings). The pools were great. Everyone in our family loved the hammocks scattered throughout the resort under various palapas and the beach is fantastic (though I recommend water shoes in the ocean as there are several rocks under the sand. The breakfast buffet was also very good and a decent value if one takes advantage of the early-bird deal (from 7am – 8:45am). Lunch at the two poolside restaurants was ok. Not great, but very passable for a poolside respite. Happy hour is from 3-6pm each day at the pool/beach and the drink selection was good and reasonably priced. Happy Hour then moves inside to the lobby bar (Rotunda bar) from 6-9pm. The onsite market is definitely adequate but we always enjoy visiting the local grocery. There are also some very nice restaurants in Playa del Carmen. We particularly enjoyed Tacqueria El Fogon (across from the MEGA) and Madre y Tierra (on 5th Avenue). We ate at El Fogon 2x and our final meal was at Madre Tierra and it was clearly the best meal we had (and they had a GREAT kids menu). We also ate at Wicky’s on the beach which was very nice but also VERY expensive. I’d skip Wicky’s in favor of Madre y Tierra. The spa is pretty nice but cramped into a mostly-lower level space. My wife enjoyed her massage in the spa and I had a beach-front massage that I would very clearly say was mediocre at best. It was supposed to be deep tissue but when asked about the pressure, I replied that I preferred deep tissue and was told that “this is for relaxation only” and the therapist continued with a more traditional Swedish touch massage --- Overpriced and less than satisfactory but not enough to ruin a vacation. Our kids enjoyed the t-shirt painting and ceramics at the activity center, too. My kids really love their new t-shirts (not sure how to wash them, but they are very nice). The attendant at the ceramics spot is a true artist and will help turn your child’s (or your) items into true works of art. We were sad to leave and after a week at Royal Haciendas one clearly gets to understand why so many people love Royal Resorts. We met lots of multi-week owners and owners who owned at various Royal Resorts. This is a great resort in a great location and we really enjoyed our time at Royal Haciendas and would enjoy a return visit. Definitely one of the better places we have stayed and great for families. The very few minor things that keep this from being a 10 in my book are all VERY minor. If you do visit Royal Haciendas keep in mind that all charges at the resort are made via your room key and paid for at check-out and they do not accept American Express (or Discover or Diners Club) so you need to have cash, travelers checks, or MC/VISA.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect combination of luxury and family atmospheres”
Reviews.Author: IAmom083
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a large group of family, we had several villas. We have a young child. The rooms are spacious and nice, give everyone their privacy. I am guessing every room has a view of the ocean, as well as the beautiful grounds and pools. They have a fabulous baby pool. Only wish I had a chance to take a nap in their hammocks! The spa is HEAVENLY. Tina gave me the most fabulous facial. She is amazing! The beach is great for lounging or getting your feet wet in the water. Not a great swimming beach, but that's probably why they have amazing pools. So nice to have shade on the beach so our daughter could play with her toys and not be scorched. We did go into playa a couple times. It is NOT a cheap cab right. We also went to Puerto Morales to snorkel for a day, great little town! Nice shopping, nice people. The grill at the RH is incredible. I love love love their shrimp and fish tacos. Best around. I definitely wish I had their recipe for the spicy onions they give you with chips and their salsa. Can't wait to go back! *The only thing I would have changed is the crib we had for our daughter. It was very small for her, I was so afraid she would fall out of it. It was also kind of rickety.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Excellent resort that doesn't feel like a timeshare. Get rooms! Lots of activities, good happy hour. On-site convience store has extensive supply of groceries at prices close to stores in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in Playa”
Reviews.Author: torontodunphy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Royal Haciendas. It is a brand new resort and our family were quite happy. We had a two bedroom suite on the 2nd floor. Rooms - We had beautiful views from the large terrace. Every room has a hot tub on the terrace (a large bathtub it is true, but then again, you get fresh water every time you fill it). Important plus for Mexico - the water is totally drinkable (we drank it extensively without side effects of any kind). The kitchen is fully equipped and we used it to make most of our own meals (well stocked convenience store on site; WalMart and Mega Mart a $10 cab ride away for main shopping). Resort: Start wtih the staff: unfailingly polite, helpful and omnipresent. I read a review critiquing the bar- I had beer at the bar (hard to ruin that) so I can't really comment. My kid's non-alcohol pina colada's were a bit weird tasting - so I guess they may need to adjust the mix they use. So what? The resort has two HUGE and beautiful main pools that never seemed crowded even though this was spring break. The water is crystal clear (not easy to do in a large resort with large numbers of people in the pools). In addition, a lap pool, some large hot tubs and water features all over the place. All the staff are polite, say hello and mean it. The grounds are beautifully maintained. We posted a picture of the view from our room which gives an idea. Our kids (13 and 14) quite happy. Good dive shop (Dive Balam) with competitive prices (we compared with prices in town). Masks and snorkels available for signing out at any time. Good family restaurant also does take out main dishes (which is great if you are using the kitchen in the unit- pick up a roast chicken and make your own vegetables). Location: about 2 miles from the ferry dock north of town. Cab fare is US$10 and takes about 10-15 mins. There is also a free shuttle during the day. Critiques: not many, mostly growing pains for a new resort. WiFi works around the resort, but was pretty spotty in our suite. They had trouble with their satellite TV for a few English channels while we were there. Some of their prices were quite competitive (dive shop, convenience store was no more expensive then any convenience store relative to a WalMart). Spa - prices were crazy relative to all around (massages US$120 on the beach vs about $35-$45 everywhere else). Hot tubs - were very large, but generally kept at such a low temperature as to detract from their utility (on the other hand, private hot tubs on each terrace that you can fill at whatever temperature you desire). I guess they could adjust the mixes they use in the bar, but not something I notice much as I don't drink mixed drinks often. If you travel with a family, the ability to do cooking in your own suite for at least some meals every day is a huge, huge plus. Highly recommend it to anyone traveling with kids or looking for something quiet, elegant and relaxing. This is not a hot spot for college kids to party hearty (a few tried - they were actively discouraged).

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: GrammaH
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Royal Haciendas several times! Every time is better than the time before! We are never disappointed. The staff is outstanding! Amenities are many, you can be busy all the time or you can just relax, it is your choice! The Royals are a wonderful way to vacation with children! We always feel like we truly are returning home!

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE!”
Reviews.Author: CalgarySue
Reviews.Content: Timeshare resort that also operates as hotel - Absolute paradise - first class service, impeccably clean, amazing pools (heated!) and beach - you can walk for miles in either direction - grocery and amenities store on-site, two beautiful restaurants with amazing food - not cheap but worth every penny! Less than 10 minutes cab ride to the centre of Playa Del Carmen, also shuttles. FIRST CLASS! Ask for waiter Rene in La Palapa and tell him Mr. and Mrs. Babush from Calgary say hi!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but would stay somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: JulieB84
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort and it looked beautiful but when we arrived we were put in a room on the bottom floor and if you have small children like we do, they could fall off a major ledge and get really hurt. It also had no view of the ocean.we switched rooms and were very happy with our top floor room it had a much better view as well. We had a two bedroom which was very spacious and nice. We were unaware that if you buy anything from the store or eat at a restaraunt that it would be charged to the room, you are not allowed to spend any money on the grounds, you get a huge bill at the end instead which we didn't love. The best thing to eat was breakfast at lapa lapa we drove into town every day pretty much which took 15 minutes if there was traffic. Luckily we rented a car and could go where we wanted when we wanted. Drinks by the pool were pretty disgusting as well. WE bought our own stuff and made way better drinks. Margaritas too sweet and a bloody mary in the morning was so bad we couldn't drink it. Another con was we didn't know we would have to switch rooms on Saturday. It was a pain. Grounds were beautiful and the beach was pretty nice. The Royal Haciendas just wasn't our thing it was beautiful but a little too large and too many activities going on.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: laanski
Reviews.Content: we were at the Haciendas the first two weeks in February..we love it there!!!! Our home away from home!!!! We have made such good friends with quite a few who work there....they are awesome and work hard!!! We miss them all already! Looking forward to next year!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful 5 star resort”
Reviews.Author: poopsy17
Reviews.Content: I am a Interval member and had switched my Las Vegas timeshare for one in Cancun. We wanted to go for 2 weeks so I was looking on line for a deal on another week. I found a travel agent called Heavenly Travels who got me a week at the Royal Haciendas. Keith Adolph was excellent to deal with. Thanks for the deal. I was reading reviews for 9 months on trip advisor and figured it was going to be a sweet resort. I booked my transportantion thru Cancun Valet on line. We brought our 3 kids with us for our first time in Mexico. ( 7, 10 and 11). A van was waiting for us at the airport and took us directly to Walmart first and then to the Haciendas. We found Walmart was very expensive but there was nothing cheap when it came to groceries. When we got to the resort it was WOW. This place was BEAUTIFUL. We checked in and went to our room. Could not get over how nice and big the room was. Went down to the pool with the kids first thing. Big pool with a perfect temperature. Seen a lot of people complain about the hot tub. It was OK. I seen someone complain about kids and a sign saying no kids but I did not see any sign. The beach is beautiful. Yes there is a big section with rocks but there is a big area to swim for sure. The food was great in the resort. Cost was no different than going into Playa. Did X Carat. We found it was OK. Also did Xplor. Fantastic. Kids loved it. Definitly need to do it for the day. Price was 350 USD for 5 of us but that included food for the day which was excellent too. We had no issues with food anywhere. It was excellent everywhere we ate. We did a 90 minute timeshare presentation and that was it. Didn't bug us after that. The staff and the place is top notch. High speed internet was fast. Loved it and would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best vacation after our second time there”
Reviews.Author: laurieowl
Reviews.Content: We chose to go back to the Royal Haciendas on a promotional deal we bought last year with an added four days - 11 days total. We love the place! We tried the spa this year; we had a jacuzzi, steam room, sauna, cup of tea and fruit during our time in the spa - then we had a reflexology treatment - heaven! I actually came down with a second bout of bronchitis after a week there - the Dr. at the resort was excellent. He took super care of me and asked me to continue coming in for check-ups during the final 4 days of our stay - at no cost. We went on a trip to Tulum through Thomas Moore - we really enjoyed ourselves - Henry - the tour guide is phenomenal - over 20 years experience. The resort is immaculate, the people are so kind and friendly. We were there for the Superbowl -they had a big party in the Rotunda room - great football food and great fun. My only complaint is the two double beds in the lock-off room, which we had. It was a little cramped for my husband and I to fit into one of the beds. But, that is a small price to pay for the excellent value of this resort. Added this year - a new welcome party - great entertainment by local Mexican dancers and free food and drinks!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, BUT NOT TO MUCH FOR PARTY LOVERS”
Reviews.Author: Ronyer77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Service is absolutely amazing, food is very good also. Rooms are extremely clean and neatly maintained. The beach is beautiful also.
