Of all the big hotels located between Cancun and Playa this is the closest one from the party center at Playa del Carmen, just 10 minutes and 100 pesos away in a taxi. But if you are traveling exclusively to party, you might want to consider hotel located inside Playa. There are a lot of cool options as I could appreciate. Highly recomended for families and and lite party people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beach and great staff”
Reviews.Author: KeppenK
Reviews.Content: The resort was really very nice. Well maintained and a great staff. We never had one issue the entire time there. Free shuttle to and from downtown Playa, or if you don’t know what time you’ll want to come back, only about a $10 cab ride. Location was pretty good. GREAT Beach. Lots of fun activities during the day. Food at the restaurants were really high quality and delicious. Rooms were big (even the standard room) with a microwave, refrigerator, silverware, plates, etc. Nice if you had leftovers or wanted to have an easy breakfast or lunch. We did have a few things we didn’t like, and it was more about personal preferences than the resort itself, for other these may be things they really like about the place. 1. After about 10:00pm everything was closed and dead… absolutely zero nightlife (even on Friday and Saturday nights) 2. Lots of little kids and retired folks… we’re both 29 and would have loved to see more people our age. Great alternative to the ‘spring break’ resorts and I know a lot of people appreciate that. But like I said- no night life at all. (I guess that’s what downtown is for) 3. Hot tubs were suppose to be for adults only (clearly marked), but every time we were in them, a group of kids (all ages) would be in there too. Not a huge deal, but it would have been nice to have an adult only zone. 4. Kind of pricy. Not that bad, but its Mexico and I expected to see some cheaper prices but it was like vacationing in Miami (as far as prices went). Still, affordable, but by no means a bargain. With that said, the value was pretty good. 5. It is a timeshare- they aren’t pushy about it… but you will hear about it a little. Because of that, check in is Saturday to Saturday and if you want to stay any other days, you’ll most likely have to change rooms (if you don’t go there on a timeshare). Saturdays are a zoo because of that. And absolutely NO late checkout- $100 for every hour you overstay, no exceptions. But because of this they are able to offer early check-in sometimes if you need it, so that’s nice. Overall we had a really nice trip, but next time we’ll be staying somewhere with a population a little closer to us in age.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: MacTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Royal Haciendas is a beautiful resort with a fun pool, white sandy beach, clear blue ocean and nice big rooms. The place has little added features, such as hammock gardens, kayaks, water fountains and private whirlpool tubs outside on each balcony. We had heard good things about the resort, so I exchanged through Interval. We were only asked once to attend the timeshare sales meeting and once we said "No Thanks", we never heard from them again. Here is what we really liked: The staff is extremely friendly and went out of their way to put a smile on our face. Our young kids enjoyed the pool and hot tubs, the outdoor chess game, and activities center. Make sure to take the short drive to go shopping in Playa del Carmen - you'll find a mix of typical Mexican merchandise all the way to high-end boutiques and name brand stores. The resort's convenience store was "convenient" but pricey and small. The resort's restaurants were OK - we enjoyed La Palapa del Sol because it was casual and on the beach. The rooms are very big with lots of storage, free wireless internet service, nicely decorated and had all the amenities needed to call it "home" for the week. It looks like just about every room has a view of the ocean. We were lucky enough to get a fourth-floor room -- very nice views! The negatives: The resort itself is very clean. However, if you like walking the beach and leaving the property, I'm warning you that the grounds on each side of the resort are filled with garbage/litter -- very, very sad. It is not the resort's fault, but a definite slam on the area overall. At the resort, things are pretty pricey, especially the food and drinks and convenient store. I would highly recommend stocking up and filling your kitchen, if you want to save some money. The resort still lets people smoke - it would be great if they could have a "smokers" section on the beach so the rest of us didn't have to be around the smoke. And one last thing...they need to turn up the heat in the hot tub. The pool temp was fine, but the hot tub was only a "warm" tub while we were there. Overall, the resort is beautiful and I would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: chflounder
Reviews.Content: I'll try not to be too long. This was our second time to the Royal Haciendas. We stayed in the A section the last time, and in F this time. This place could not be any better. From the pools, beach, and the landscaping...it is all top notch. We have been to Playa 3 times and would not consider staying anywhere else. The employees are very friendly, and take pride in their work. We stayed in a villa, which has the living room, kitchen, dining room, as well as two seperate bedrooms. Everything was clean, updated, and a great place to relax at the end of the day. So...the negatives. The restaurants are over priced and the food is not that good....with the exception of the pool area dining. We have never had a complaint about the things coming out of there. Javier was our concierge for the trip. He was great. He had many recommendations on where to eat "outside" of the 5th Avenue tourist trap. Let me highly recommend a restaurnat called La Fagoda(SP) on 30th Ave and Constitution across from the Mega. You will not find better Mexican cuisine anywhere.....and the prices are incredible!!!!!! We were not pressured at any time to buy a time share, and in fact, we were left alone the entire trip. A huge bonus!!! We booked right on the Royal website and found incredible deals.

Reviews.Title: “This place is amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: 42Magoo42
Reviews.Content: What more could you ask for out of a relaxing vacation? The rooms are beautiful and we had an amazing view. The pool area is so big that you never feel crowded. The wait staff catered to our every need and want. The beach and graounds are immaculate. Happy hour is from 3-6pm every day so drink prices are reasonable. The food is good for resort food, not amazing, but definitely quality. Overall- fantastic place, fantastic experience and will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Sunny Oasis with spotless grounds”
Reviews.Author: kimm74
Reviews.Content: Recently took a 3 night getaway with my husband and was pleasantly surprised at how nice this hotel was. We had a lock off unit (only had 2 full beds which was the only down side of our stay). The room was immaculate and I am very picky and travel a lot for work to many high end hotels. This is a non smoking property (which is wonderful). There was never a piece of garbage on the ground anywhere. We went to the breakfast buffet. Quality, and selection was good for the price. We ate dinner at the seafood restaurant and everything was terrific! We had drinks and food at the pool bar/restaurant and had a blast. We took the free shuttle downtown into Playa Del Carmen and that was well worth it. One recommendation we had was for the bar to be open past 10:30pm. Midnight is definitely more appropriate. We also had a couples massage and it was good - not great and pricey ($251). Overall, this was a great resort and would definitely recommend it (already have) and will be back if our destiny is Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: AnneyZ
Reviews.Content: My five-year-old son and I just returned from a wonderfully relaxing vacation at Royal Haciendas. The resort itself sparkles it's so clean and beautiful. The staff is courteous and hard-working. I was particularly impressed with the activities staff. We had a few rainy days and they worked hard to make our days as fun as possible, given the lousy weather. The pools are amazing! My son spent nearly our entire vacation in one pool or another! The drinks are yummy (and strong). There is a grocery store right on site and it's prices are perfectly fair and reasonable. The hotel is right on the beach. Sigh. We miss it already! The downsides were few, but here they are: (1) the food is expensive and only so-so; (2) while you can take a free shuttle into downtown Playa del Carmen (and our favorite restaurant, El Fogon), you have to make reservations way a head of time AND the last shuttle leaving Playa is at 6:00 p.m., which means that you have to take a taxi home; (3) there is only a free shuttle to the hotel's sister resorts in Cancun on Thursdays; (4) if the weather is uncooperative, there isn't really a whole lot to do at the resort, particularly for little ones; and (5) even if you rented through Expedia or something, you WILL be subject to a pitch to buy a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: jwl55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Royal Haciendas for two weeks (10/30/10 - 11/13/10) and had a wonderful time. Our stay was a combination of an Interval International exchange and a purchase of a week. The resort is immaculate, and the service and staff are great. We were assigned a personal concierge (Alan), who was gracious and helpful. He even arranged to have the NY GIants football game on one of the Lobby bar TVs for me because the Sports Bar was showing two other NFL games. There were several complimentary lunches and cocktail parties, which we enjoyed. Our one bedroom suite was spacious and nicely decorated, with a full kitchen and a hot tub on the balcony, which we used alot! The onsite store was reasonable, although the selection is pretty limited. Many of the guests take the shuttle to the Playa Del Carmen and walk to the local Walmart for food shopping (we did NOT do that ourselves). The on site restaurants are good (Los Murales is GREAT), and there is also take out and delivery from the La Palapa restaurant. We often had lunch poolside or on the beach, and the food was great. I took the opportunity to get my SCUBA certification at the on site dive center (Dive Balam). The staff there is great and very professional (shout out to Gustavo and Javier!) If I had to list a complaint it would be that the large outdoor hot tubs (all 4 of them) were lukewarm at best, and only a few degrees warmer than the pools. We will definitely return to the Royal Haciendas, as we purchased our own unit. We can't wait to go back this year.

Reviews.Title: “A Quality Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAngeleno
Reviews.Content: The Royal Haciendas is a timeshare, so the experience is entirely different from what one would expect at a hotel (i.e. no "real" room service or concierge). We are members and have an oceanfront villa, one week out of the year. The grounds are beautiful and well kept, as are the Villas. I will say we are very happy that our villa is located in Phase II which has a quieter pool and a better beach. The gym is well worth the daily use fee, all of the equipment is excellent and the room is well maintained. It is standard at most resorts to charge for the use of the gym these days anyhow. My favorite things -The spa on the balcony -The kitchen is spacious and has everything you need -Housekeeping does a great job -Everything is super cheap - drinks, food etc -The market has a good selection - just wish they brought back the Mexican chorizo -The food at the pool is delish! -Plenty of spaces to relax -Calle 5 in Playa- great food, fun and bars. We come here for the laid back vibe that is so un-Cancun like. -The bartenders and beach attendants are always friendly and always fast Things that could be improved -The food choices at night- we got sick at the new restaurant one night even though the food was really good, the food at the Palapa del Sol is consistently "blah", wish they served casual, authentic Mexican food at night like at the Royal Sands...carne asada, Mexican style lobster, ceviche, tacos... -Entertainment at night- How about a good local, live band- maybe some reggae, something fun?? Anything for those of us who like some lively nightlife and don't feel like going out to Playa every night. - How about turning the pool at Phase II into an adults only pool? Would be nice not to have kids sitting on the pool bar, splashing water and yelling. -The concierge/salesperson calling you at 9am in the morning. We are on vacation to relax and sleep in! -The bedding is horrendous; the beds have a thin flimsy mattress and scratchy sheets -When checking out, they really rush you out of the room, sometimes even bringing the next guest into your dirty room before you are even out the door. This happened to us at 12:05 (check out is 12:00) and they were calling us at 11:45 am asking when we would leave!! Overall, if you are looking for a good value and nice accommodations in a great town- this is your place. Having an oceanfront room makes all the difference for us, as we typically stay in 5 star luxury resorts, and an equivalent room in terms of size and location at the Fairmont or Mandarin in the Riviera Maya would cost three to four times as much. It is equivalent to staying in a 3-4 star hotel, like a Hilton or Marriott. Overall, we are happy to be members and have noticed that the resort has made some needed changes since it first opened and we are hoping they will continue to evolve for the best. Playa del Carmen is a great town which keeps us coming back.

Reviews.Title: “HAH HAH HACIENDAS”
Reviews.Author: bmalma
Reviews.Content: This could be a perfect desination for an ethnocentric american family. It can feel like one never left the midwestern excited states. There are planned daily activiities for children and their parents. Indeed, there is a feeling of a christian summer camp. If that sounds good to you, this is a great place. This huge property of over 250 2 bedroom time shared condominium units is in the middle of nowhere. But then, all of the resorts in the Playa del Carmen area are in what was once jungle. The native landscape has been razed to make way for the construction of resorts and time share pyramids. Parenthetically, the 2010 environment summit conference was held nearby while we were staying here. A very interesting juxtapostion... Anyway, all food and beverage service in this resort shuts down at 10 P.M. The restaurants, the bars and grocery store close are all closed by 10. So, one must get in a cab and go into Playa del Carmen after 10. It is widely advertised that it's a 5 minute cab ride. No way. It can be a five minute walk or more just to get from one's cell to the taxi stand of the resort. The cab ride (fixed price of 100 pesos, about 10 bucks, tip not included) to the center of Playa del Carmen is at least 15 minutes, and can be longer because of traffic. That said, the rooms are as advertised. Spacious. Comfortable. Really clean. The hot tub on the deck is terrific. Yup, the rooms themselves are just great. BUT, one doesn't spend an entire vacation in a hotel room. There are no bidets. There is no room service. One is constantly reminded, this is a TIME SHARE property. SALES of the TIME SHARES are of paramount importance. There are security personnel everywhere. If you want to enjoy a meal in the ocean view restaurant (beautiful), it seems there's always a cop, (some uniformed staff person) blowing the view. Incessant whistle blowing at random times of the day. Organized excercise activities. Boot camp. Light sleepers might want to take a pass. There is a constant air-conditioning noise from adjacent apartments. Not too loud, but always there. 24/7. A note about BEGGING. A small envelope left by the housekeeping staff reads: “Royal Resorts is proud of its Housekeeping staff and their excellent work. We keep high standards and will continue to give you the attention and service you deserve. We would like to thank you for tipping our maids and may we suggest that you use this envelope. You can leave it in the Tip Box at the Front Desk, of, if you prefer to give it to your maid in person, please feel free to do so.” It's begging and it's not classy at all. If the corporation is so proud of the excellent work of the staff, how about paying them enough so there is no begging. By the way, if you get sucked into the time share spiel, you might want to have a look at the resales of this property first. For example: http://www.sellmytimesharenow.com/timeshares/index/content/search_sell/offset/0/SearchType/resales/Operation/5/SearchResortID/7165/order/price/ Beware of thinking you can cancel a reservation once made and paid for. This is not a hotel. Once payment is made, the house policy is there are NO REFUNDS. BEWARE! One could make a reservation for a few days to test the water, and extend the stay if the accomodations suit. There is no charge for internet service in the room, but it's not very good. Too slow to stream video for example. Good enough to pick up e-mail etc. There is a do-it-yourself laundry. It can be a very long walk to the facility. I don't know why it's closed on Sunday, but it is. The pricey mixed drinks at the beach bar are severly watered down. Severely. A cheapo grind. Not classy. I never tried the lobby bar. It was closed the one night I tried to get a drink at around 10:30. Each visiting group/family is assigned a "concierge". It's a misnomer. At this place a concierge is someone who is going to try to sell you the TIME SHARE. These are professionally trained pests. There is no conventional hotel concierge on the property. After all, it's not a hotel. There are no screens on the windows and doors, and they are needed. If one likes fresh air, maybe when one sleeps, one is going to be bitten. We were here in the high season, a couple of weeks in December, which is the one of the coolest and least humid times of the year. The bugs are a’ bitin’ anyway. One can only imagine what it’s like here when it starts getting sticky. It is in a jungle after all. This could be a perfect desination for an ethnocentric american family. It can feel like one never left the midwestern excited states. There are planned daily activiities for children and their parents. Indeed, there is a feeling of a christian summer camp. If that sounds good to you, this is a great place. If I had it to do over again, I would definitely get a place that was either in the town of Playa del Carmen or within walking distance. There are many.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: JessLCH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royal Haciendas over the New Year. We are frequent Caribbean travelers and could not get over how relatively inexpensive Royal Haciendas and Mexico in general was. We rented directly from Royal Resorts. Here are our pros and cons. Pros: nicely landscaped grounds, terrific heated pools, wide, sandy beach, never had to fight to find a pool chair, awesome hammocks, friendly, efficient, service, plenty of services and amenities (spa, kids' activities, tour desk, etc.), very inexpensive. Cons: poor food quality, have to switch rooms on Saturdays, some in our group found the beds and pillows uncomfortable, poor lighting in bedrooms, trash on beach near resort (they clean up directly in front of resort but if you take a walk further on beach, lots of trash), music blaring from noisy New Years Eve party kept some in our group up until 1:45 am. Despite the cons, we would consider returning because the price was so cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay relaxing by the Caribbean”
Reviews.Author: Khumbu60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I exchanged for 2 weeks at the Roay Haciendas. We had a great stay, We had a studio (sleeps 2) which had limited cooking but was fine for us. The room was spacious and comfortable. We found the food at the restaurant OK and there were plenty of good restaurants in Playa Del Carmen. The shuttle service provided to get us into Playa Del Carmen worked well. The maid service for the rooms was excellent and everyone at the resort were friendly and extremely helpful. We thought this to be an extremely well run resort and it lived up to our expectations. We took a number of excursions and all the tour guides were very good. I may well return.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Haciendas never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: donnyawesome
Reviews.Content: Our stay in late November/early December was fantastic, as usual. The resort has the best entrance of any I've seen, all lit up with LED Christmas lights, it was beautiful! And again, as usual, the resort and rooms were spotlessly clean, with friendly staff everywhere. Food was good, happy hour (3-6) was wonderful....viva Miami Vice (strawberry margarita and pina colada layered....mmmmmm....The welcome party and taco party were flowing with copious amounts of free drinks and for some reason the tacos were much better this year than last! The only issue we had was with the hot tubs....or warm tubs....they were mostly only lukewarm, only one night one of the hot tubs was actually hot enough to be comfortable, but that was it. I wonder if there is a problem with the heating systems, or are they trying to save money? They were much warmer during our stay in February. Kudos to the staff for getting the Grey Cup game on the net and broadcasting it in the lounge....there's always next year, Rider fans! All in all, though, everyone had a wonderful vacation. Can't wait to check out the new golf course, we managed to walk a few of the holes and it looks fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Second time back - still great”
Reviews.Author: hartzog
Reviews.Content: We came to RH last year for the two weeks around Christmas/New Years and liked it so much we came back again. The resort is still great. Rooms and public areas are exceptionally clean. Staff is very friendly. The beach area is quite beautiful and we never had problems finding a beach palapa with chairs. Store on site has most things you need but prices are double of what you would pay in PDC at the grocery store so shop wisely. One thing to keep in mind is if you want to take the shuttle into PDC in the evenings, make your reservation way in advance or you'll need to cab it. Overall, this is a wonderful resort for families and I highly recommend it if you are looking for a fun, friendly, and peaceful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back for the next 40 years!!!”
Reviews.Author: Periojustin1967
Reviews.Content: We love the Royal Haciendas! By far the nicest of all the Royal Resort properties, we purchased our time share one year after construction began. Each year we return, we feel like this is our second home. The facilities are wonderful. The staff always greets you promptly with a smile. The housekeeping staff is excellent. The food was initially not-so-great, but had improved significantly for the 2010 season. Our salesperson, Jorge Lopez, is the best and he always checks in with our family each year we return. The villas are large and can sleep six comfortably (our first year we slept nine in one unit!) with Murphy beds in the living room, a king in one bedroom, and two full-size beds in the second bedroom. A fully furnished kitchen is present as well as flat screen tv's and DVD players in both bedrooms and living room. The on-site store has just about everything you might need. A laundry is also on-site with an attendant to help. The Hacindas is not a high-end resort where everything is white-glove. You just feel like it when you're there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place But Pretty Quite”
Reviews.Author: TCarn
Reviews.Content: I am really delayed in writing this so I will try and keep this short. The pluses: *The rooms were as good as you can get (we only had the main room because there was only 2 of us, didn't see the attached room). The bed, the hot tub was used most every day, the fridge, the shower all were great. *The grounds were really well kept, if you like big pools then these are great for you, each having a nice swim up bar, with good service. Didn't really pay attention (although right there) but if you like to just chill and read a book they had hammocks all over. They also had two hot tubs to go along with the pools *The beach was really nice, the water pretty clear, just ok for snorkling *The party on Saturday was fun, the only time you felt like there was a crowd there, they give you free beer, food, etc. and had different games where you won prizes which all in all was a good way to start the vacation if you like to have a few beers *The location was good, easy cab ride which we did most every night, we walked to town a couple time, think it took about an hour. This wouldn't be for everyone but it is not bad to do if you don't care about walking. Most of the walk is pretty quite except you hit a few hotels, the water isn't really great for swimming if you wanted to jump in along the way *The price is almost unreal I think given how nice the property is, when we told a couple of the condo owners how much we paid they finally started to wonder why they ever invested and didn't just do what we did. *The supermarket inside had most of what you would need and they don't try and rip you off, so if you wanted to make your own breakfast, lunch, dinner or wanted to half drinks available in your room it was very easy an inexpensive. Question marks for you to decide: *Very quite other than the opening party during both the day and really at night. There was a bar but nobody was really ever there. *The owners are normally a bit older than us (30's) so other than a group of 4 other young folks we ran into we didn't really have much in common with the other, but still played volleyball in the pool which was fun *We like to throw things in the pool like a football and initially they were ok with it but then about 5 days in they said we couldn't do it anymore, even thou we bought a ball from them in the market. *The restaurants I could go either way, the palapa had decent food at decent prices, didn't try anything else. *They do try and push ownership, but you could just say no and be done with it, I didn't do that because I just wanted to hear the pitch. Overall, I doubt you could match the quality and price of this place in the Playa area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property - Go Out for Dinner”
Reviews.Author: tdhtravel
Reviews.Content: Member owned property. Shaped like two large Us but with part of the top of the U filled in. 4 stories - be sure to ask for room on 3rd or 4th floor if you want a view of the ocean. They call all the rooms ocean view, where I would call them partial ocean views. There is no way rooms on the 1st floor at bottom of the U can see the ocean. The landscaping and grounds are immaculate. We had a basic room with small kitchenette (microwave, toaster, coffee maker, small fridge). They don't provide coffee - you must purchase. There is a nice store on the property. No ice makers - you must purchase these huge bags from the store which is stupid because their is no place to keep the ice. They don't provide any dish soap, shampoo, lotion, etc. Nice pools, but not heated. Separate pools for kids, but didn't see many people using these. Very large beach area with large number of palapas and lounge chairs on the beach. Saw staff out in the mornings picking up garbage off the beach. But, you still have the people that get up at 6 am to grab their beach chair, particularly those on the front rows at the beach. Drinks are expensive at the pool bar - so wait until happy hour (3 pm) when they are half priced. Definately a family oriented resort. Lots of daily activities for kids, teens, adults. We took spanish lessons, salsa lessons, participated in a ping pong tournament, and took out the sea kayaks. All of these activities were free. Warning - do not eat the food. Most expensive meal of our vacation. Horrible. Last night of our stay we were tired so ate at the resort. They have different buffets every night. My husband had the italian buffet, I ordered grilled fish (I'm thinking you can't ruin grilled fish - wrong). Fish was overcooked. My husband's food was not worth the calories. The best part of the meal was the chocolate ice cream with caramel sauce. Plenty of good places to eat in Playa. Just drive in or take a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: seasonaltraveler63
Reviews.Content: We are sadly leaving the Royal Haciendas on Saturday, December 4th, 2010. This has been a wonderful experience. This place is phenomenally great. The people are so sweet, kind and eager to help you with everything. The place is so clean and we are here right after Thanksgiving into the Christmas holiday and the entire hotel is so decorated beautifully. There is something for everyone. We had two small grandchildren with us 6yrs old and 2.5 yrs. the kiddie pools are wonderful! The kids activity room is unbelievable for all ages. They have gone out of their way to ensure every age has something to enjoy. Yoga on the beach, black jack night, hot tubs that are huge and fun, beach areas that are so beautiful and security everywhere. We felt safe, relaxed and enjoyed every minute. If you come here you can not miss going to the La Palapa Del Sol Restaurant right on the beach. We sat outside on the veranda and had a wonderful mean of Salmon and Grouper. The salads were huge the drinks were terrific and our waiter was the most pleasant and helpful individual. I hate the thought of going back to the USA with the lousy service you get in most restaurants after our experience there. The hostess was so sweet and complimentary. This is a jewel in the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ra2415
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel with excellent service. From the moment you check in you are treated like royalty. We checked in 4 hrs early and got our room right away. We had a one bedroom suite which was comfortable, clean and had plenty of room. The balconey is quite large with comfortable furniture. The service everywhere on the resort is excellent, especially in The Veranda restaurant. The restaurant next door to the hotel, Hacienda Sisal served delicious food and had a nice show. The Royal Sands is located 10 minutes from the party area of Cancun. The beach was large and the ocean was beautiful with nice waves. We are going back again!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax and a wonderful place to be”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler061
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to this part of Mexico, and I must admit that we were a little put off by the scene at the airport. Saturday is a big day for arrivals in Cancun, so the customs process was quite slow with long lines. The people waiting in line did not seem like the type of people we would enjoy, and I thought maybe we had made a mistake. Once through customs, we were greeted by some official-looking people wearing badges. Beware! They are not officials of any kind. Their only business is selling you a time-share. They offered free trips, taxi rides, meals, etc., and it took awhile to figure out what they were talking about. They never did mention timeshare, but we finally left when they indicated we had to decide right then and there if we wanted their offer of these freebies. Another hint was their request for a deposit. We finally shook them, but I’d recommend walking right past all of them. Finally we got out of the airport building, met our transport, and were so pleased to be away from all the commotion. The quietness of the Royal Haciendas proved to be just what we wanted. We stayed here for 1 week in November, as an exchange from Interval International. This is a lovely, quiet resort. The staff was efficient, helpful, and friendly. We did meet one staff member who did not fit this description, but she stood out because she was so unlike the rest of the staff. The resort is very well-maintained and clean. Unlike some other time-shares, there is daily maid service except Sundays and Mexican holidays. You are also assigned a personal concierge, but we really didn’t need his services. We did enjoy the complimentary wi-fi in our suite. Our reception was good, but apparently this is not true in all rooms. There are a number of TV channels, some in Spanish, some in English, and some with Spanish subtitles. There are a number of activities available on the grounds, including use of 2 large infinity pools, 2 lap pools, 2 children pools, and 4 large whirlpools. There are also many covered hammock areas and many lounge chairs around the pools and at the beach. While one small area of the sea at the beach is rocky, there are plenty of good sandy swimming areas and the beach is quite large. There are plenty of organized activities for adults and kids, an activities center, and a number of complimentary perks including use of sea kayaks, tennis racquets, and snorkel equipment. Non-complimentary activities include the spa, use of the gym, and scuba diving. Royal Resorts has their own travel service (Thomas Moore), which provides transportation to and from the airport (for a fee), complimentary scheduled transportation into Playa del Carmen, and numerous excursions to theme parks, archeological sites, and adventure places. Those are all on their website, with prices. Overall the resort shows quality construction and our room was well sound insulated. The whole resort seems to be handicapped accessible right down to the beach, with wide ramps that are well-designed and fit with the overall architecture. The tap water is filtered and potable, but doesn’t taste very good, so you may want to go with bottled water. They recycle cans and bottles – another plus. Smoking is not allowed inside the rooms/villas/suites. The rooms/villas/suites are listed as either ocean view or ocean front. Be aware that you can’t really see the ocean from some rooms. Well, I guess if one squints between the palm leaves, you might see a hint of blue, which could be the sea or the sky, but it’s not like you’re looking at the Caribbean. Our one bedroom suite was on the ground floor, close to a children’s pool. While I had been concerned that we would not have much privacy from people walking by, this was not a problem. The children’s pool is a ways off, and until our 5th day, we never saw anyone use it or even sit on the surrounding chairs. While you probably wouldn’t want to use the deck hot tub au natural, it’s private enough. Actually the only people you see from the deck are the maintenance people who occasionally walk by. The kitchen in our suite was well-supplied with dishes, utensils, pots, pans, bowls, blender, coffee maker, toaster, and regular appliances. Salt and pepper shakers and dishwasher detergent were supplied, but we missed having paper towels, sugar, detergent to hand wash dishes, and hand soap at the kitchen sink. Also, unlike hotels and other time-shares we’ve used, they did not supply daily shampoo, lotion, and that type of amenity. We did receive one small bottle of shampoo and some body wash from the spa, but that was it. The store on the grounds is somewhat expensive, but it is handy. They sell basics, with some fresh vegetables, some frozen foods, etc. There are several restaurants on the grounds including one new upscale restaurant, which we didn’t try. The main restaurant, open all day, has excellent food. There are also some hamburger bars, etc. near the pools. There is at least one bar, and you can get drinks in the restaurants and at the pools, of course. Overall we were pleased with our stay here and would recommend this place to others. While I mentioned a few things that they didn’t have, this was more to warn others what to expect and is not a complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Playa del Carmen doesn't get any better than this”
Reviews.Author: cRoss55
Reviews.Content: We visited here last year for a weekend, this time for a full week. We travel a lot and never were interested in buying a time share as we like to visit different parts of the world. But after our second visit here we are looking to purchase. First it is a Royal Resort - first class in every way. Most everyone we meet has purchased multiple weeks which shows how they treat their owners. Second - as with other Royal Resorts we have visited, the place is immacculate, service staff is terrific, rooms are large and comfortable, beach is awesome. Even when the resort is full, there is plenty of room with multiple pools, hot tubs, hammocks, etc. And Playa del Carmen is a 100 peso ($9) taxi ride away for nightlife and GREAT dining. I can't name a city that has the number of fine dining restaurants, most at about half of what we would pay in the states for the same meal. And did I mention hot tub on the balcony of the unit? Nice!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff at the Royal Haciendas”
Reviews.Author: jmcclary42
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our two week stay at the Royal Haciendas. What a beautiful new timeshare resort. All rooms are two bedroom, two bath villas. Exchange or rentals can be obtained through Interval International at: www.intervalworld.com. Located on the Riveria Maya just a few minutes north of Playa Del Carmen. This is by far the best resort in the Royal Resort's stable of six plus resorts. The major factor that separates the Haciendas from the many nice resorts in the area is the staff. Daily housekeeping services and each guest is assigned a host and personal concierge. Our host was Yvette and our concierge was Octavio. We have been going to various Royal Resorts for the last seventeen years and Octavio was the best person we have ever had the pleasure to work with in planning our events. If your are traveling to the Riveria Maya try to book the Royal Haciendas and by all means request Octavio, he will significantly enhance the quality of your vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CaboJefe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Royal Haciendas on a trade for our Cabo timeshare at Casa Dorada. I went with the idea that it woud be fine but nothing would ever compare to staying at the Hilton Los Cabos (Casa Dorada Golf & Spa). I was very mistaken. This place was every bit the equal; in the accomodations, in the service, in the food quality, in the beauty both of the facility and of the Riviera Maya. We had read many reviews on Trip Advisor so I knew that RH came highly recommended. We had read some of the minor complaints posted which after having been there seem even more petty. The unit we had was a one bedroom suite. It was two years old and was beautifully appointed. The bed was extremely comfortable, the full kitchen was well equiped and had granite counters. The living room and balcony were very spacious and the view of sunrises every morning were spectacular. There are two restaurants. The Palapa del Sol is the more causal of the two but the food for both breakfast and dinner was VERY good. (The hostess at dinner, Rusely, deserves special mention. She was truly a delight and her smile could light up the entire resort.) Los Murales, the more upscale restaurant, was excellent. My wife have the grilled sea bass and I had the tequila-lime shrimp. Both were outstanding. The pools were immaculate adn pool service excellent. The beach also was beautifully maintained. We would highly, highly recommend the Royal Haciendas. We will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...but quiet.”
Reviews.Author: bandits47
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days at the tail end of weeklong vacation in Cancun. We were in a B-side (smaller side of condo), but there was plenty of room for just the two of us traveling without the kids. 2 beds, big bathroom, nice balcony. Very nice! Beach, pool and grounds very well maintained. No shortage of open spaces at any of these areas. Equipment rental/borrowing (snorkeling, tennis, golf) on-site. No complaints about any part of the physical resort. Downsides: for our tastes, kind of quiet, and not that much to do. (We might feel differently if our kids were traveling with us). That said, only a $10 cab ride to Playa del Carmen. 2 choices for restaurants on site. We ate off the menu at the "buffet" restaurant, and not at the more expensive one. Food was fine, nothing special. Bread was pretty bad. $25 per person for the Italian buffet, and $35 for the steak buffet. Rene (our waiter) was fantastic-excellent service. The "concierge" staff needs some work. Those at the desk twice turned us away with no help whatsoever, but one woman saw it happen and chased us down and assisted us. Internet was spotty, sometimes really good, sometimes pretty bad. If you like quiet, and "off the beaten path" you will probably love this place. Seemed like a bit of an older crowd, or families with younger kids. Very nice resort, just not exactly what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property! Superb customer service!”
Reviews.Author: ewporter
Reviews.Content: Our family has been there at least 3 times and it has never failed us. Very clean and taken care of. All employees very nice and helpful. All the food is great. The pools and beach fantastic! You will not go wrong at this place. It is far enough away from Cancun where you can really relax with not alot of parties going on. Our family works hard and we need a place where we can relax and enjoy life..........Royal Haciendas is that place!!

Reviews.Title: “I Absolutely Love this place.”
Reviews.Author: micolvin
Reviews.Content: My family has been coming to the Royal Haciendas for three years, and before that staying at the Royal Resorts in Cancun for twelve years. The Royal Haciendas is our favorite because it is the entire package. The beach is great for relaxing, swimming or snorkeling. The property is beautiful, and meticulously maintained. The rooms are spacious, and have a large patio with a view. Maid service is included in the room price, excluding the tip. The staff is friendly and will strive to meet your every need. Estella was our personal concierge, and you could not ask for a better representative. Playa Del Carmen is a great place to visit at a much slower pace than Cancun. This resort has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: kslstl
Reviews.Content: One of the best, most fun vacations our family has ever taken! Villa was nice and roomy for all. The resort is beautiful, clean, and family friendly. We had 3 teenagers with us and there was plenty of activities to keep them happy - from the huge pools, great food, jet skis, kayaks, snorkelling from the beach to good local attractions like Xplor. We alternated eating at the restaurant (the kids loved the buffet) with going into Playa for dinner. Our concierge was wonderful in helping us with recommendations and reservations for activities and restaurants. Spent a few hours in the Spa which was wonderful. Great margaritas and guacamole by the pool! We felt really cared for by the staff. The kids are already asking when we can go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than average, but OUCH - my back!”
Reviews.Author: kaylie197
Reviews.Content: Overall, the resort was very nice but had a few annoying features. Everyone was offered bottled water upon arrival. We were not members at this resort, so we had a much longer check-in line (~20-25 min wait). We noticed quite enviously that the members had a welcome lounge and free drinks while they checked in. We were assigned a ground-floor villa. The view was of the activities center and the pools and beach beyond. We had plenty of good lighting in the villa, and decor was very nice and modern. Throughout our stay, we heard some noises and guessed it was either noisy neighbors or construction. The villa was very clean when we arrived. The hot tub on the patio was a great feature. Ours did not drain properly, and when we reported it, the attentive maintenance staff arrived within 10 minutes to fix the problem. Maid service was offered each day except Sunday. At orientation on Sunday, we were told to tip the maids $5/day. Tip jars were in view at the welcome party on Sunday (free beers and rum+cokes) and the taco party on Monday. These events, however, were very nice touches to welcome guests to the resort. The resort is extremely quiet in the evenings, with not much going on for entertainment. Free internet; signal was weak at times but was strongest near the lobby. Gym was $8/day or $38/week, which we thought was ridiculous. Snorkel and kayak gear were free, but snorkeling and kayaking were canceled on the days we were there due to rough waves. Convenience store on site had a wide range of items, from alcohol to dairy products and souvenirs. Free shuttle to Playa del Carmen; due to an agreement with the area's taxi union, the last shuttle back to the resort is at 6:30pm, so don't expect to have a free ride back after dinner; you'll have to take a taxi. Spa services offered were similar to high-end services offered at resorts in the US, and priced similarly as well. From the time-share sales pitch, we learned that 80%+ of the owners at this resort are Americans, so the resort seems to charge high US prices for everything. Resort grounds were very clean. The beach was clean with gorgeous white sand, and there were plenty of chairs at the beach and pools. Hammocks were arranged between the resort buildings. Two lap pools and several kids' pools. Two very large pools with swim-up bars. Two pool-side restaurants served lunch and happy hour. Waiters were very attentive to those at the beach and pools. Prices: ~$9-15 for wraps/sandwiches/burgers, ~$3-7 for happy hour drinks. We found the wraps and sandwiches to be acceptable, but the happy hour drinks were weak. The large beach restaurant has a very nice ambiance, with high thatched-roof ceiling and beautiful view of the ocean; we went to the ~$25 "international night" dinner buffet and found the food to be bland though acceptable. There was a high-end expensive restaurant on site, but we peeked in one night and didn't see anyone in there, and we certainly didn't eat there either. The kitchen in the villa was well-stocked with cooking equipment, and we went to the Walmart in Playa del Carmen to buy reasonably-priced food supplies. The resort very conveniently had filtered water, so drinking the tap water was okay. Our biggest problem was that the pillows and beds were very firm and not very comfortable. The resort also did not provide shampoo/conditioner/lotion. Our personal concierge, although very friendly and nice, seemed to be most interested in getting us to have a free lunch with the sales staff. All the restaurant, activities, cleaning, maid, front desk, and maintenance staff at the resort were very friendly and responsive to inquiries or requests in English. Transportation to and from the airport was through Thomas More Travel ($45 roundtrip per person for shared 40-min shuttle ride). Thomas More Travel was also the on-site agency for arranging all excursions ($65 for snorkeling, $100+ packages to eco parks and Cozumel). We didn't do any of these excursions so cannot comment on their value. We had a relaxing vacation at this time-share resort but may try an all-inclusive resort next time, mostly so we don't feel the need to cook.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GREAT STAY BUT.........”
Reviews.Author: suzy0525
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Hacienda October 2nd. This was our third time there via a trade through Interval. First, we ABSOLUTELY do love it there, or we wouldn't go back each year. BUT, I do agree with the previous comment about how we had to check in. Our prior 2 visits we were warmly welcomed with water and directed to the check-in counter. This year, we were instantly asked if we had been there before and were we owners? Before anyone even said hello. We were then directed to the one employee in the back corner of the room. The most offensive part of this check-in process for me was the "rope" separating us from "them" (the owners). I truly felt like a girl in high school, and I wasn't the popular one! (Thank god I WAS popular once I got outside to the bar!!!) While waiting at this "desk", I then heard a blender. I looked over, and the people on the "other side" of the rope were being given Margaritas! Wow. Another vacation slap in the face. After being up all night to get to the Hacienda, and I didn't even deserve a welcome beverage. And boy, with the near hurricane weather on arrival day, I so badly needed it. We were given a ground floor room, which was not my first choice, but it was in the building we have been in each year, and requested, so I lived with it. I also inquired about a change of room, but was told no. We met a fabulous couple day 1 at the bar who told us you can only move to an available Interval room, and there aren't usually very many. If no availability was true or not, I don't know. There are alot of vacant room this time of the year, but oh well. I am also an owner at a Marriott property, but I've never felt like an outsider in any other property like I did at check-in this year. It was very poorly planned by Management. If they think this is a way to make their property more desireable, they are sadly mistaken. I was so upset I considered never returning, but my favorite waiter outside at the Aqua Bar (Juan Jose) quickly changed my mind about that! NOTE TO MANAGEMENT: You never know who may purchase at your property, and first impressions are HUGE for most people, especially in this recession. Making new customers feel like outsiders is not a great selling point. I would also point out that non-owners spend just as much money at your property as your owners (if not more). So I would STRONGLY suggest you re-think this new change before next year. Moving on to the positives, and there are many. The property is beautiful, from the room on. The pools and beach are beautiful. We love the bar, and spend most of our time at the pool having tasty beverages and meeting new people. The bar staff is excellent, a main reason I return each year. September is hurricane season, so the first 3-4 days were VERY wet, but eventually the sun returned. The town is alot of fun, and easy to shuttle to. On 5th Avenue there is every possible shop, restaurant, or bar you may want. I love this resort mainly because it is gorgeous, and you can just relax. Not alot of kids, which I also enjoy. And makes for a great romantic adult vacation. Happy hour prices are great, and we travel alot., so we've paid much more. The bar food is also great. My one comment, we wish the pool bars were open MUCH LATER and served food past 5 pm. This is always our main complaint, and granted it is minor, but there is really no place to "hang out" and socialize with other people unless you go to the lobby bar, and no one does. Your evening choices are the La Palma or the new steak house. Both have great food, but when I'm on vacation I would much rather have a cold beer and bar food. And the lower prices that go with it. This year was the first time they had "events' in the evenings, and it was great. (Thank you Hacienda for listening to your customers). But no one knew about it! They had a live band that was FABULOUS! And there were 6 people in the room. They had karaoke the next night, maybe 20 people, but again, hardly anyone knew. How great if they advertised their events with maybe a newsletter? Or signs at the bars? Long story short......we do love the Hacienda. If you want a crazy, event filled vacation, this is not the place for you. Try Cancun. But we love the staff, you can usually count on the weather, and the property is beautiful. Even with my sad and disappointing start, I will most likely return. And hopefully I will return to an employee with a warm smile, and a cold tasty beverage to welcome me!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler999
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Royal Hacienda for a week in August 2010. What a wonderful resort! The rooms were amazing. The are several pools with two HUGE infinity pools. The villas have top grade furniture and extremely spacious and well laid out. Staff - amazing service, from front desk to ground keepers. Everyone greets you with a smile and go out of their way to help. Location was very good. Only about 10 minutes from Playa. One of the most impressive aspects of the resort is that it does NOT nickel-and-dime its guests. Parking is free. Rooms include free wi-fi and EVERYTHING at the sports desk is free, from noodles (for pool), to Snorkel Gears to even Kayaks! Food prices are also very reasonable, comparable to casual restaurants outside the resort. Finally, exchange rates at front desk is better than anywhere else you'll find in the currency exchange booths. It's an incredibly well run resort and one of the best we've ever stayed. We were most impressed with the service, quality and integrity instilled into the entire hotel staff from top down.

Reviews.Title: “Best timeshare I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: LynneHemenway
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place. The employees are absolutly unbelivable for friendliness & service. Especially the front desk personnel & bellboys. The resort & grounds are imaculate and we get daily maid service (no extra charge) -- not just making beds, but cleaning floors -- everything including clean windows and fresh daily linen , soap, towels & completly furnished kitchen including diahwasher. Lots of planned activity -- you name it, they have it. Each villa has large terrace deck with table & chairs, plus a hot tub that the maid cleans daily. Outstanding orientation meeting with coffee & rolls. The water is triple filtered and even tasts good from the tap. The pools are fantastic and the resort is on the ocean -- just a few steps from the pool which meets up to the ocean. All villas have beautiful ocean & pool views. Several fantastic restaurants on site and Playa del Carmen only 1 1/2 miles away with free shuttle from the resort several times a day. Cozumel close by and can be seen from resort. Fantastic spa, exercise facility & tennis courts. A full 18 hole golf course is now being completed as part of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Haciendas!”
Reviews.Author: sr_voyager
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Zona Hotelera in Cancun last year and wanted to stay closer to Playa del Carmen. We booked the Royal Haciendas through Interval International, so had a two bedroom suite, which was huge! Firstly, we had booked a transfer from the airport through Thomas More and the van was waiting when we got out of the terminal, so that was very smooth. We were a bit early and didn't expect to be able to check in to our room until late in the afternoon. Our room was ready, however, and the staff was great about checking us in earlier than usual. The rooms were spotless and very comfortably furnished. The balcony was my favorite - spacious, with very comfortable lounge chairs as well as a table and chairs where we had breakfast every morning! Then there's the hot tub! What a treat! We only tried the restaurant by the pool, which was great for lunch and snacks. Very nice wraps and salads. We did shop at the store and made a light dinner a couple of nights, which was very handy after a long day. The Thomas More tours were great, we went snorkeling in Akumal and visited the cenotes. Other days we took the ferry to Cozumel from Playa and took a taxi to Puerto Morelos. I took one of the early morning yoga classes, which was great - next time I'll be sure to plan that into every day. All in all, the Royal Haciendas was a great base for everything we wanted to do. We plan to go back early next year with my in-laws - can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: grneyedmustang
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Haciendas in June for 7 nights. LOVED IT! The service was wonderful. The resort itself is beautiful and the staff is friendly. The room was really nice, we stayed in a lockoff unit, but they put us next to my friend who had a villa. We opened the door and made one huge unit. We had access to a kitchen - but the lockoff unit also has a fridge and a microwave. The bathroom is REALLY nice. in both units. We ate at the buffet one evening, it wasn't cheap but it was worth the price. We had prime rib (all you can eat - if you can make it LOL) - baked potatoes, and 8 million other items to choose from. Make sure you hit happy hour at the pool bar in the afternoons, they have complimentary chips and salsa. The drinks are good as well :) Since this is a timeshare, there is a presentation. We snuck out of the presentation and no one else said a word about us purchasing property. Make sure you go to Playa Del Carmen and visit the town (I highly recommend Ula Gula for martinis). Cozumel is nice as well. I'd definitely go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: AmadorWinelover
Reviews.Content: This timeshare resort is just what everyone says it is... great rooms, spotless everywhere, yummy food at the pool bar, lovely beach and fabulous pools. Only one thing to complain about and we weren't the only ones to encounter this. Royal Haciendas timeshare sales, are you listening??? Asking your guests to leave a tip when lunch is on you is just plain tacky. Tacky and embarrassing when we have to decline, because we don't carry money with us at the resort. You get a bill to sign... add a tip like the rest of us do!

Reviews.Title: “Second trip. Love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: RadMom58
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love the RH. We went in March 2009 with 5 to 6 families for spring break with our high school students. The teenagers loved it and we loved that they were safe and had fun. There are a lot of activities and even our 17 and 18 year-old boys were participating in pottery painting, bracelet making, kayaking, etc. While our teenagers love it, this is not a place for a wild spring break. Security is strict and unruly behavior would not be tolerated. But our teens liked that and so did we! 2009 was such a great hit that in 2010 we were back with 20 to 25 families. Food is great. I agree with another review that best buy is the lunches by the pool. We went into Playa most nights for dinner which is 100 pesos one way by taxi ( approximately $8.00). I used the hotel transportation during the day - it is reliable and free. As for the rooms - they are amazing. Spotless with lots of room and a great kitchen. Basic room has a large patio with private hot tub, living/dining room, full kitchen and two bedrooms with two baths. Very, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to average.”
Reviews.Author: basildogpuppy
Reviews.Content: I would describe the resort as very nice, with a few comments that I agree with many other reviewers that the resort can change and make the experience even better. My husband and I travel to Playa del Carmen approximately four times a year and usually stay at small inns in town. We decided to change it up and stay at the resort this time, we thought that this resort would be walking distance to town, it really is not. The negatives first. They have a nice fitness center, but it cost $8.00 a day. I think that is ridiculous and it should be included. Let me guess next they will charge for towel rental and a pool service charge every time you take a dip…I HATE being nickled and dimed. On top of the fee, the hours for the gym could have been longer. If you are going to charge you better have amazing hours. Plus the place is closed on Saturdays, so when you purchase a "one week rate", it is not for the whole week at all for some ridiculous reason the gym is closed on Saturday. It would have been very nice to work out before the long day at the airport and sitting on an airplane. It was a nice gym that was very well equipped with state of the art equipment. I did not go right away in the morning a few days and waited until the afternoon or evening, numerous times I had the place to myself so that was very nice. Do not expect to come here and enjoy a cheap spa vacation. The spa services where all rather expensive, that was disappointing. I was able to use a portion of the spa, due to my daily $8.00 gym fee. It was a very nice spa and everyone working there was extremely nice and helpful but services where extremely costly. Regarding the room: The sheets and comforter where ok, I think the quality of those items could have been better. The mattress was nice. We hated the huge tub you had to jump in to use the shower, that was ridiculous. The patio and the view was amazing !! Free WI-FI was extremely nice and the offering of TV channels was wonderful on the day that it rained all day and night. The rooms where extremely quiet and we never heard anything from the neighbors or the hall. AHHH..shuttle service, this would be a cheap fix for the resort, we are really only ten minutes from downtown, run a shuttle service every hour from 9:00am -9:00pm. It would not cost that much and it would give you huge bonus points from your guests. We had issues with the shuttle service, it could be improved. The market place has an excellent selection and they did not take advantage of you on their prices. The pharmacists went out of their way to be helpful. The big pool was amazing !!! But I did not understand the kiddie pool that they had, that no one was every at. Change the kiddie pool into something else so this is not a waste of space!!!!!!!! Back to the big pool, wonderful, wonderful bartenders and wait staff. Drinks at happy hour had great prices, why they do not run happy hour longer, I do not understand. Loved the pool super huge and nice!! The wraps and the Lime Soup where excellent. The prices at the buffet where ridiculously expensive, $18.00 for breakfast- that is crazy, we went to town for under $5.00 for an amazing breakfast. The beach was beautiful, but it was rather rocky, bring your beach shoes/sandals if you want to go swimming. The beach was very nice and so was the water temperature and the beach furniture. The resort hammocks where very nice, bring a book or a magazine and enjoy a few hours in the wonderful hammock area. The resort was nice, but nothing over the top !!!..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay !!”
Reviews.Author: namelama
Reviews.Content: I will not echo the many reviews before ours but I will say the resort is a fabulous facility but its too new to have an established entertainment value. If you're looking for a quiet place with not much activity unless you go into the city, this is it! Phase I or II are both excellent locations although most of the activities originate in Phase I. There are more activities for children in Phase I and almost all of the welcoming parties are in Phase I. The restaurants are average and not much to rave about. If you go into town, the meals are cheaper but it costs you $20 for a roundtrip taxi. We stayed here the 3rd week in August and the place was not very occupied which was nice. The Villas are equipped with free wireless internet, a fully stocked kitchen, flat panel TV's in every room, and nice furniture. Depending on what you're looking for, the place is only 4 years old and it could use some entertainment help with better communication between visitors. You see people come and go without ever knowing their names or where they're visiting from. I would highly recommend two things for a perfect vacation facility, all inclusive meal program and quality entertainment so that people do not have to leave the property in search of the unknown in Playa del Carmen. The beaches are nice and the water is warm. Snorkeling equipment, kayak tours, water vests, and many other outdoor equipment available to check out for activities. All in all, it is a fabulous facility and I would return providing I was looking for some place to just sit quietly for a week. Good for big groups too! No one will ever bother you!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: ElanaS
Reviews.Content: The resort exceeded all expectiations! It was absolutely amazing...scenery was beautiful, grounds were immaculately clean and villas/rooms were also top of the line in decor, cleanliness and ammenities.  The staff was wonderful...charming, attentive, friendly, helpful and there for you in every way possible.  The service was also A++++, especially at the pool bar!  The resort has its own water purification system making it so all of the water/ice is 100% safe to drink.  There was a variety of restaraunts on site, a grocery store, a full-service spa and many other fabulous ammenities that made our trip fantastic. I am already planning my next trip back ! i have no desire to go or stay anywhere else after experience the Royal Haciendas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Fantastic Value, Unbelievable Pool!”
Reviews.Author: VR731
Reviews.Content: We went her the week between Christmas and New Years with our kids, and another family and their daughter. 8 in all in a 2 bedroom condo, and were quite comfortable. The resort is absolutely beautiful, with pristine grounds, and very classy and clean rooms. There was lots to do between the resort, down town playa del carmen, and any tours you may want to do. We spent most of our time at the resort. We went to Walmart on the first day to stock up on groceries, and did most of our own cooking. We probably spent only about $600 over the entire week for all of us and the room itself was very reasonably priced. We had just a fantastic stay. In fact it was so fantastic, that despite the 1000's of resorts in the caribbean, we talk about coming back here on our next trip, because we can't imagine how we're ever going to get such a nice resort for such a great value anywhere else. One thing to point out is that we are definitely pool and sun people, and this is the best family pool we've ever been to. With it's shallow portions for kids, perfect warm temperature even in the dead of winter, the swim up bar and grill, the infinity aspect with its view of the ocean right there, and shear massiveness of it so that it is never crowded, this pool is unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sucramfree13
Reviews.Content: My family and I go here evry year. I couldn't possibly see who people could'd have a good time here. The rooms are stunningly beautiful. The staff is extremely friendly. And on top of that, the food is great. It is simply a wonderful place. Lets talk about the rooms. The rooms are highly updated. The kitchen is very updated with granite countertops and stainless steel appliances. The livig room is comfortable a ozy. The master bedroom is nice and the master bath is fantastic. It has a Roman Shower!! The masterbedrooom connects to the balcony. The balcony is large and it has a hot tub! The beds in the master and the guest room are very comfortable. Going do there with my family for the past 5 years, we have never incountered a rude staff member EVER! They are just so friendly! The beach is gorgeous! The water is very calm, and the water changes colors. It is soooooo beautiful! OH, and I forgot. The resort has a laundry matt, spa, grocery store, a jungle gym for children, and a hammock hut. Lastly, they have parties fir you! They have an welome pary for you, where you play games and they give you free drinks. and a taco party, where they give you as many tacos as you can eat with drinks.)

Reviews.Title: “Food at La Palapa Restaurant was great”
Reviews.Author: MarciaL376
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay, could not ask for a better resort. However, it is very quiet so if you want more activity stay somewhere else. Previous reviews say the food is not good. I found quite the opposite. Menu prices were reasonable if you stayed away from the nightly buffet. We ordered off the menu. Alot of choices under $15.00. Baby back ribs, salmon, pork chops were all very good. The food at the Aqua Grill at the pool was great too. While there were rocks at the beach, there was a large enough sandy area in the new section of the resort to swim in the ocean without alot of rocks. I loved how gentle the waves were. Hardly any breakers except by the shore and they were small. Unlike Cancun, if is very safe to swin in the ocean in this area. I would definetely stay here again if I ever go back to the Mayian Riviera.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment”
Reviews.Author: TNJN79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Marriott Timeshare Owners and I always worry when we visit a non-Marriot resort. I must say I was pleasantly surprised with the RH. Check in was smooth, we were greeted immediately by our concierge - Rolando. He walked us to our room which had not been cleaned (we were told this) but we were allowed to go in anyway. Some may not like this but it worked great for us. Rolando gave us an overview of what to expect from him during the week – and he delivered. We were invited and attended events on Sunday & Monday even though we were a little concerned that we might be pushed into sitting through a sales pitch. It was offered but never were we made to feel it was something we had to do - and we did not. Our room was a “lock off” room and was very, very nice, the food at the resort was good, and the pools and grounds were beautiful. Although "Alex" prevented much time in the water or the opportunity to take a trip to Cozumel it was a very nice vacation. For shopping or other dining choices Playa De Carmen is about a 15 minute drive. RH offers free shuttles at specific times – you are asked to make reservations as the number for each trip is limited or taxis are always available. If you like to relax and enjoy the sun without a huge crowd around the resort is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: polarlgirl5
Reviews.Content: The Royal Haciendas felt to me like a cruise ship dry-docked, everything you need is right there...if that's what you like. The grounds are nice, the beach is quite decent, the restaurants are ok, long story short if you are happy chillin' by the pool/beach with 200 strangers this is probably a great place for you. We generally prefer a smaller, less 'take care of everything' type of setting. If you do visit the Haciendas I suggest renting a car, there is nothing within walking distance, and the on-site bar, restaurants, etc close early.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort, Fantastic Staff!”
Reviews.Author: YoungTraveler89
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here on our honeymoon and it was just simply amazing. Keep in mind that we tend to like to relax more than party and if that is your idea of fun as well, then this is a great resort. Amazing staff, always willing to help out. Immaculate grounds and great restaurants! We went to La Palapa del Sol for many of our dinners. This restaurant is right on the ocean with open design that lets the ocean breeze just surround you. Only a short free shuttle drive into Playa del Carmen. The hotel security were very good about advising where not to go to stay safe, it's nice to know that they cared about our well-being so much. I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Royal Haciendas”
Reviews.Author: dlerecon
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Haciendas this year and it was lovely. The rooms were excellently maintained and the staff was very pleasant. The beach was well-groomed and the water was warm and soothing. Their is a dive shop, Dive Balam, on site and you only have to walk to the boat. The staff is very experienced, professional, and very friendly. Had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort just close enough to Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: alavio15
Reviews.Content: We spent eight nights at the Royal Haciendas. The resort is lovely with beautiful landscaping of tropical plants and green green grass. The layout is really nice with pools, hammocks, and plant/water pools throughout. The pool was clean and the perfect temperature, refreshing but not too cold. I liked that you could see the ocean from the pool. The infinity is a nice touch too. The happy hour was our favorite time at the pool bar and the margaritas are excellent! The beach is good but not great. There are better beaches in the Mayan Riviera but we liked the privacy of the beach and that there were plenty of chairs with sun covering and drink/food service. Nothing better than reading a book ocean front! We went to the beach in Playa Del Carmen (Gran Puerto Real) which was fun but I missed the privacy of the Haciendas' beach. The rooms at the Haciendas are outstanding. We had the one bedroom villa and it had three separate rooms. The kitchen is large with granite, bar stools, full refrigerator, oven, microwave,.... We ate breakfast and lunch in our room which saved money. We ate in town most nights. My only complaint is the resort does not provide a way to wash dishes by hand. There is a dishwasher and they provide soap. I would bring a small bottle of dish wash soap or buy one in market ($2.00). The hot tub on the balcony was my favorite part of the room. Sitting in the tub with the fantastic ocean view and a glass of wine was the perfect ending to our days I would stay here again just for the tub. Bring bubbles and enjoy. :) We ate two meals at the resort- La Palapa (ok) and the new sea food restaurant by the lobby. It was very good but pricey. The setting is beautiful and the food was delicious. The shuttle is great! I don't know why people have complained. We had a car for the first half of our trip (Easy Way- strongly recommend). The last shuttle leaves at 6:30, just sign up at the front desk. We took the shuttle into town and arranged a pick up time too one day. They even gave us a cold bottle of water once we got in the van. Great touch! I would stay here again in a heartbeat. It is close enough to Playa to shop and eat out but far enough away to relax with a peaceful beach. Don't miss Chocolate Cafe (Mayan chocolate and brownie) and Babe's (Vietnamese salad with shrimp) or 10 (flank steak).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: mdeltoro208
Reviews.Content: Great beach with no waves white sand and clear water for snorkeling. JAcuzzis and hammocks to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: cavedodger
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to The Royal Haciendas and the first since all phases were opened. Traveling with extended family we rented three two-bedroom, two-bathroom units in the newest section. The units are very spacious and tastefully decorated with a distinctly Mexican theme. The furniture is of very good quality. Our units had fully equipped kitchens that we made good use of, even though there are several on-site dining options. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The resort was apparently inspired by the Haciendas of the Yucatan and you can see that in the architecture. The building colors spark conversation with other guests but I really liked them. The yellow in particular seems to change color depending on the time of day and at night the entire resort seems to glow, just lovely. The whole resort is kept immaculately clean, from the units to all the public areas and gardens. I even saw staff cleaning the beach every day. I was surprised to see a review that criticized the beach as we all thought the beach was lovely. One morning we walked south, most of the way to Playa del Carmen and it was a wonderful activity. While the beach does have some rocky areas these are well marked by red flags placed by the lifeguards. We found the best part of the beach for swimming was right in front of the north side of the property, and during our week the beach actually improved. When we arrived the edge of the water had quite a few rocks and pebbles which made getting in the water tricky, but by the end of the week they had all been covered with sand. Once a few yards into the water, the bottom was sandy and we stood and splashed around for hours talking and enjoying the ever-changing water color. Which is a really easy way to get sun-burned... please note! On Sunday morning we enjoyed a very good breakfast buffet that more or less served as a brunch for us. They have everything from a large selection of local fruits to an array of pre-cooked and cook-to-order items, including huevos rancheros which I highly recommend. The wait staff were very attentive even though this is a buffet. The resort is divided into two U shape sections, each of which has a very large main pool, lap pool and large hot-tubs. We all made great use of the pools, especially the 25 meter lap pool where we attempted to burn off some of the calories that we had consumed at the pool bar :-). Lots of activities were available although as we were here for a family reunion we mainly spent time together on the beach, in the sea, in the pools and in our spacious units - especially the balconies which all had ocean-facing views. Another great feature is the on-site convenience store. I cannot recall another resort hotel that has this feature on-site. While the imported items are a little pricey, the local equivalents are very reasonable indeed and shopping there was much easier than flogging down to a supermarket in Playa del Carmen. But best of all had to be the maid service. Our maid was called Minerva and every day she delighted us with a different animal creation that she made with towels, face-cloths and flowers that she would leave on our bed. It has been a bit of a shock getting home and having to make my own bed! You may find a more luxurious hotel in the Riviera Maya, but I challenge anyone to find another resort with the combination of spacious, multi-bedroom suites with the services and facilities on offer at The Royal Haciendas. There is also a great deal to enjoy in the local area - but the highlight for us was a trip to the Xplor theme park, while not for the faint-hearted with it's high ziplines, it is a brilliantly conceived and run place which I would highly recommend. Playa del Carmen is also worth visiting but in my opinion, the famous 5th Avenue pedestrian-only area is best enjoyed at night. There are a huge number of restaurants, bars, lounges, cafes etc and the atmosphere is great. You will bump into people from all over and hear many different languages, if like me you sit at a bar while your other half is shopping. Just one more thing... while here do yourself a favor and visit at least one of the Mayan archeological sites, they are fascinating.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: mwfiesole
Reviews.Content: While the rooms and property are clean and lovely, we battled small gnats and ants in our room. They were in the kitchen, bedroom, and bath. We ended up staying outside of the room as much as possible due to this problem. Again lovely facility and staff were friendly, but we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “New is something the Royal Resorts needed.”
Reviews.Author: gcwaz
Reviews.Content: The Royal Haciendas is a refreshing addition to the Royal Resorts. It wasn't until staying at the Haciendas that I realized all that is lacking at the Mayan, Caribbean, Islander etc. It's the colors, gardens and architectural upgrades that make the Haciendas stand out from the rest. From the balconies to the rooms to the lobby and restaurants, the entire place is bright and inviting.
