The rooms have all the great standards that have made the Royals special for all these years but they've added certain luxuries that make you appreciate it even more. From small details like a bathing suit hanger in the bedroom to the bigger perks like a jacuzzi on the balcony and HUGE walk-in tile showers, they've set themselves apart. Everything here feels new and clean. Simply walk out onto the balcony and over look the beautiful gardens and fountains surrounded by 6 or so floors of bright, cheerful villas just like yours. There is no mistaking where you are. It's a true Mexican vacation. The grounds have kiddy pools to the back, lap pools in the middle and heated main pools to the front with an over-sized hot tub to each side. So there is plenty of water for the non-sea swimmers. If you're up for a Banana Monkey any other fun drink, each main pool has a grande swim-up bar. There are plenty of seats around all the pool areas, as well as hammocks, or you can head down to the beach where you'll find enough seating around the long the stretch of palapas. After reading certain reviews, we were a bit worried about the beaches in Playa. Where it's true, there isn't the amazing blue waters of Cancun or the fun challenge of large rolling waves, it wasn't so bad. It was fairly calm water and you are able to walk out quite a ways. The first 10 yards or so, you may have to watch your step for some large rocks but once you're out far enough, there were no real concerns of twisting your ankle or stubbing your toe. However, if you are one who goes to Mexico primarily for the Sea, I wouldn't recommend this location. Cancun would still be your spot. You can, however, take out kayaks or snorkeling masks though everyone agreed that the visibility was poor. As far as beach quality, it was powder-soft sand that felt great on the feet. No problems there. We rarely dined at the resort but we did take advantage of the breakfast buffet each and every morning as we have at all the Royals. I find it's always worth the money for the fresh fruit, made-to-order pancakes and waffles, fresh juices and a variety of different pork, chicken and beef dishes as well as all the standard breakfast favorites. It's a great way to fill up the belly so you won't have to leave that lounge chair until the sun goes down. ;-) Overall, I'd have to say the Royal Haciendas is a four star resort. I only have a few suggestions that would make them easily five stars. The staff was friendly but not very efficient. It's expected for the guests to be slow and leisurely but we found the staff to be more so than even us. It usually took a long time to get any service. Especially cashing out. It had to take 30 minutes each time we wanted to sign our bill. In addition, they need to perfect their shuttle system. They have free shuttles going in and out of Playa Del Carmen all day. That is, until you actually need one. They stop the shuttle service at 6pm which forces everyone to take a taxi for $10 each way to dinner. This is not an all-inclusive resort and most would prefer to dine in town. 7 days of $10 back and forth through taxis adds up. Oh, and just one more small thing I have to throw in......beware of the man who comes in every morning to play the flute at breakfast. Note to the Royals: American 80's music through a flute sort of ruins the atmosphere. Not much Mexican flavor to that. Haha, I don't know why I had to add that. If these things are the worst I could find, I'm sure you'll get the idea that the Royal Haciendas is an amazing place to take a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Haciendas is a very good resort that will not disappoint, just not a Beach Lover's paradise!”
Reviews.Author: BeachTraveler228
Reviews.Content: Overall - All in all the Royal Haciendas is a very good resort that will not disappoint. The resort is very new and has lovely grounds, pools, rooms and amenities. The location is very close to thriving downtown Playa Del Carmen. The resort is very clean, has friendly staff and will result in a fun, relaxing time. However, if you are expecting a great beach resort with great beach front, please consider this resort carefully as this is the only major drawback of the resort. From what I can tell from walking the beachfront for hours and talking to many people, most of the Mayan Riviera properties suffer from this issue as well so I am not sure you will find a Cancun beach type of resort in the Mayan Riviera. Therefore the Royal Haciendas is probably one of the better resorts to choose given the quality of the resort and its proximity to Playa. Rooms – the rooms are very spacious and well configured for families. They are very modern with granite countertops, new appliances, large TV’s, DVD players, etc. We stayed in an A/B unit which had 3 large rooms. One room was a kids room with bathroom, wetbar/fridge and 2 double beds. The center room is a huge living area with full kitchen, eating table, couch area and two additional trundle bends. The third room was a large master bedroom with a king size bed a very large stall shower. There is a Jacuzzi tub on the balcony. Our unit overlooked the pool and was the second unit in from the beach. Overall the rooms are very nice and a highlight of the resort. Location – if you are looking for a resort that is close to Playa this is a good choice. While not in downtown Playa proper, it’s about a 10 minute cab ride (about $10 USD each way for up to 4 people – tip, if you are five people don’t take a van since the price goes up to $20 USD each way – squeeze 5 people into a car). It’s about a 1 hour walk on the beach to downtown. You might do it once but it’s a fairly long hike so would not expect you’d do this often. You also wouldn’t walk on the road (Federal Highway 307) as it’s a busy highway. A word of caution, there is nothing built yet to the left and right of the resort so there is not much to walk on the beach. If you like to take beach strolls this is not the resort for you. They are building other resorts in the complex as well as a beautiful golf course but it is not yet finished. Once completed there may be more to walk to, but right now the Royal Haciendas is fairly isolated and the area to the left and right is not great looking. I do suggest going into Playa each night for walking around and for dinner as there are a lot of great restaurants to choose from on 5th Ave ranging from Italian to Mexican to Seafood and Steak. Pools and Grounds – one of the best attributes of the resort is the pool and grounds. Very large, spacious pools with plenty of room so you never feel crowded. Large ledge in pool for sundeck bathing (you can bring your lounge chair right into the water). Great area for small kids to play in (very shallow in areas). Fairly shallow throughout pool so you can walk around entire pool (no real deep end). Great swim-up bars which are a real focal point given their rich red color and ample seating. Also a nice kids pool, but it was never used since it is set very far back in the resort. Also small lap pool (also used for water volleyball) which is quieter. Lot’s of nice hot tubs to enjoy as well. You will spend most your time at the pool. Beach – after reading all the reviews about the beach at this resort, this was my biggest area of confusion. I read all the reviews and can understand the various perspectives. My view is that if you are really beach lovers, this is not the place for you. If you are expecting the beautiful aqua colored waters and waves that are found up north in Cancun, you will be disappointed (just to be sure, we took a day trip to Cancun to the sister property The Royal Sands and the beach was much nicer). The Royal Haciendas is set in a small cove and is in the Cozumel channel so it is not technically set in the open sea as it is up north in Cancun (making it much less wavy). The resort has 3 beach areas – one to the left for swimming (with less rocks), one in front of the restaurant that is all rocks (with no activities allowed due to the rocks) and a reef area to the right (mostly for snorkeling, not swimming). Even in the designated swimming area there are enough rocks you need to watch out when you are swimming. It is certainly swimmable beach, but just not the Caribbean water and experience you may be used to. The water was either really calm or had slight waves on windy days. The water color is more green than aqua blue and at times had a odd odor when swimming (maybe due to seaweed at low tide?). There were nice beach front huts with adequate beach seating and service, but we ended up not sitting there much due to the quality/aura of the beach. So the bottom line is if the beach is not a huge part of what you are looking for and you are content spending time at the pools, this should not be an issue. However, we were disappointed with the beach. Restaurants – the Royal resorts are not all inclusive so you have to do your meals on your own. The onsite restaurant locations are very limited. The Beach restaurant called La Palapala was okay for breakfast but is a typical theme night buffet for dinner. I would not recommend it for dinner. For breakfast, you end up spending about $18 USD per adult for the breakfast buffet which ends up being pricey (and extremely redundant as the selection did not change at all). I suggest doing breakfast in the rooms or getting coffee and a bagel or pastries to go at the restaurant as it is much cheaper. For lunch, the poolside dining is perfect. The burgers are huge ($10 USD) and the Grouper Sandwich is fantastic ($10 USD). The salads are also very good as is the Guacamole, Pico de Gallo and Chips. Can’t beat the pool side lunches. I recommend sitting at one of the outdoor tables. There is a new seafood restaurant called Las Murales (?) which was good but more expensive than it needed to be – it was probably 2x the cost of what you could find in Playa. My recommendation is downtown Playa every night for dinner. The drink service was very good and overall the prices were not unreasonable for a non all inclusive resort. Great happy hour specials with ½ price drinks everyday from 3pm to 6pm. During happy hour a beer goes for $23 pesos ($2 USD) and a mixed drink for about $4 USD. Great deals. You can also buy beer, wine and alcohol at the onsite store. I recommend bringing a small soft pack cooler if you want to really be economical. Otherwise the daily bar tabs were not that unreasonable due to happy hour. The onsite store is convenient for incidentals and small items. If you are planning on having a lot in your room for meals and groceries, it is probably worth the trip to the mega Walmart in downtown Playa. Otherwise, just shopping at the onsite store will do. Activities – while there were organized activities each day, I would not say the resort has a great activities program. Typical daily activities such as water aerobics, water and beach volleyball, etc. are available as part of the resort. If you are looking for a resort that has constant activities by the pool (an entertainment staff, loud music, games, etc.), this is not it. Sometimes acvities did not have enough people (such as Beach volleyball) to play a full game. Water Sports – a reasonable amount of water sports are included/available at the resort. I recommend taking a Kayak out when the water is calm. Be sure to go out past the ropes and explore. It is very shallow and the water color is better the farther you go out. It feels like you could paddle all the way to Cozumel. I also suggest Snorkeling in the reef by the resort but it is fairly shallow. I suggest going at high tide. Also suggest going outside the ropes to snorkel. If you are really into good snorkeling, you must take a trip to Cozumel (we used a company called the “Fury” which had a large catamaran) and snorkeled off the reefs there. Absolutely amazing. They also have beginner diving at the resort. You can try the equipment in the pool for free. You can spend $99 USD and get a 2 hour training in the morning followed by a dive in the afternoon. So overall, The Royal Haciendas and the Playa Del Carmen area is worth checking out and will be a memorable trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort with all the amenities, short cab ride to Playa del Carmen.”
Reviews.Author: johnarnold824
Reviews.Content: We were owners at the Royal Caribbean and Royal Sands in Cancun. Sold only because our vacation interests changed. Decided on a spring break vacation near Playa. Haciendas proved to be another wonderful resort in the Royal chain. Villas are very nicely laid out. Sleep 6 comfortably, offering murphy beds rather than a pull-out sofa. Service was great, and the villa we stayed in absolutely sparkled. Enjoyed sunning by the pool and on the beach. Restaurants and grocery store onsite, and more options were available fairly close by. Don't worry about unsupervised spring breakers; you won't see them at the Royals. Great place for couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Our Royal Haciendas diary”
Reviews.Author: pjPonzo
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Royal Haciendas (Playa del Carmen) and I wrote a day-by-day diary of our stay. Though we had stayed at other Royal Resorts before, the Haciendas was best, by far. It was HUGE, nearby Playa del Carmen was delightful and the Haciendas staff were very friendly. Our best holiday in years. Though I could go on (and on) about the various activities, it's perhaps better for y'all to read our Haciendas Diary: http://www.gummy-stuff.org/RoyalHaciendas.htm

Reviews.Title: “Royal Haciendas: the perfect spot to unwind --- even the studio apt. is gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGrandma66
Reviews.Content: On our second trip to the Cancun area on an Interval International Exchange, we were only able to get a studio, but it was beautiful --- had an ocean view, a kitchenette, beautiful bathroom and a comfy and private patio. The grounds are immaculate and beautifully landscaped with tropical flora and fountains and multiple pools. 'Used the fitness center and "wet spa." Walked on the beach to Playa del Carmen (took an hour but beach was beautifully unspoiled and safe). Nice market for basic needs. Great food in restaurants. Shuttles to Playa del Carmen. Plenty of palapas on the white sand beach so you don't have to stake a claim at daybreak. I want to go back every year!

Reviews.Title: “Hammock Huts are the Best”
Reviews.Author: EAF496
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some of the best service I have ever experienced while traveling. Upon arrival, you are greeted by your own personal concierge who will meet with you to plan out your stay. He/she can arrange for excursions and transportation. They give you a private phone number so you can reach them almost any time. The hotel restaurants are a bit pricey (at the time, the buffet cost around $27 per person, but was worth it at least one night). They also have a grocery store in the hotel where you can purchase your own food to cook in your room. This is also a but pricey, but worth the convenience. The hotel also offers daily activities, including snorkeling, kayaking, arts & crafts, salsa lessons and card games. (Some activities, like the salsa lessons, snorkeling and kayaking are free. Others, like Texas Hold 'Em, are not free.) You absolutely must play Bingo, and go snorkeling. And last but not least, the hammock huts scattered around the property are perfect for afternoon naps. The giant jacuzzis are great too!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Haciendas”
Reviews.Author: wnunez76
Reviews.Content: We have been to this resort many times and can't wait to return. Royal Haciendas is a safe, clean and relaxing place.

Reviews.Title: “superbly relaxing.......great choices of activities, food, scenery and excursions”
Reviews.Author: laurieowl
Reviews.Content: the help takes great pride in the cleanliness and friendliness of this incredible resort. My husband and I needed relaxation with choices of activities - that is exactly what we experienced. We loved the option of going to Hatha Yoga, Spanish Lessons etc. each day or of relaxing on the beach or beside the pool. There is also the option of pools; children's only, cool pool for extra hot days, warm pool for a bath-like experience or the hot tub for evening dips :) The snorkeling equipment was free to use and available at the sports desk each day - I was surprised at the number of fish I could see so close to the shoreline in front of the resort. The security on the beach (yes, even at 5:30 am when looking for a sunrise shot) and all over the resort is extraordinary. They are not intrusive; very professional but will say "hola" if you do! One thing I recommend; go to the Walmart in nearby Playa del Carmen (free shuttle to the town from resort each day - many times) early in your visit; we overspent at the somewhat overpriced on-site market out of desperation the first few days; too tired from the flight and getting used to our surroundings. Walmart is really super when it comes to yogurt, granola bars, cheese, crackers, boxed nectar juices, fruit for breakfast and lunches; leaves more money for dinners on-site; we found reasonable meals there. It cost us only 35.00 for two for coconut shrimp dinner including rice and fresh vegetables with non-alcoholic fruit drink. It was excellent tasting and excellent value for the money. There is nothing quite like lazing on the very new, clean lounge chairs all around the pools and on the beach on a sun-filled day - never under 80 degrees F. Just put the blue flag in the hole on the wooden pole holding up the thatch roof umbrellas (excellent coverage from strong sun rays) and a beach restaurant server will take your order! I really like that no money exchanges hands (other than tips u want to give servers - but don't have to) - guests use their room key to pay for everything and to identify themselves throughout the resort. The ONLY complaint we have is the size of the bed in the "lock off" unit we got in our exchange through interval international - we have a studio in Maui, Hawaii. The size, cleanliness and facilities of the unit were excellent, but the bed size was small - somewhere between a twin size and full sized mattress. It was cozy for the two of us; there were two of these beds in the room, but we wanted to sleep together :) I saw that in the other sections of the villa (there are three in total including the lock-off room) the main bedroom has a beautiful king-sized bed, the middle section has two twin murphy style beds that fold up easily into the wall so u cannot tell there are beds in the livingroom! I just wish the two beds in the lock-off unit were true queen sized beds; they are a little small. My husband had a massage at the resort spa; he was in heaven afterwards - he described the 2 hr. experience as the most relaxing ever! We went on a day trip to Xel-Ha - natural wonderland for snorkeling, lazy river tubing, dolphin swimming and manatee watching - super experience - spend ALL DAY there for full value. All your food and drink free all day with this all inclusive deal. We got ours FREE by sitting through a 90min. presentation at the Westin Hotel in Cancun. We did not sign on for anything, but got a free trip to Cancun from the resort including a side trip to Walmart to get our supplies, free breakfast and lunch and fully paid taxi there and back to the resort - we got this at the airport on our arrival from a person paid to get "leads" for potential buyers of timeshares. JUST DON"T SIGN ANYTHING when you go to the presentation. We paid 45.00 at the airport and did get the 45.00 back when we came to the Westin Hotel in Cancun. Other resort people comment that this resort is "out in the middle of nowhere" , but that's why I like it = not in the middle of Cancun which looks like Miami with its never ending string of resorts along the shoreline - way too congested and not private at all. This resort is 45 min from Cancun, but a planned NEW AIRPORT in Tulum will make it only 35 min from an airport but still with a very private feeling. Otherwise, the best vacation ever - hands down!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: hjertsjo
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Mexico. This property is a great place for the money. The staff were great, the food was as expected made for a hotel. Still no complaints, others could complain, but then nothing would please them anyway. If you are practical and like nice places stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, relaxing stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: P-and-J-Travel
Reviews.Content: We booked a week in the smaller "lockoff" side of Villa 402, building B, which is in the first phase of the resort, through RedWeek.com. Excellent value. It was a room with two double beds, an ocean view balcony and a microwave, coffee maker, fridge, and mini sink. This was our second trip to PDC and we were looking for a hotel offering a good beach, ocean views, AND a good swimming pool. It's hard to find all of the above in downtown PDC. While the Royal Haciendas resort is fairly far out of town (a 10-15 minute taxi ride - easy to get a taxi, just ask a bell man at the entrance), it offers a variety of pools, including kid pools, plus a fabulous beach. Since the PDC beaches tend to be rather windy and wavy, at least in the winter when we've been there, snorkeling is not as good as in Cozumel where the water is clearer, but you can try on calmer days. We were always able to find a palapa on the beach for shade, while at times the pool area chairs were filled up. Another plus of the beach is that the palapas are permanent and don't have to come down when it's windy. The sand is lovely for kids to play in. We walked to downtown Playa del Carmen one evening. It's about a three mile walk with some interesting things to see along the way. Stay out of the drying kelp/seaweed though - I got what may have been a sand flea bite on my foot which itched like crazy. We dined at the Palapa restaurant a few times and used the a la carte service to buy a roast chicken. The buffet does seem overpriced - we did the Mexican night buffet and the food was pretty good. We tried the breakfast buffet one time as well but ordered off the menu for two other dinners. Service can be slow, especially on the first Saturday night when many people check in and dine in as well. The chicken mole was quite good, and they do seafood quite well. We had the Mahi wraps at least four times from the Pool Bar/Beach service. Happy Hour drinks are a better deal. The Don Julio Blanco margs are delicious and can be really strong! We were able to breakfast and snack on our own with the in room microwave and fridge. That saves money and time and is helpful. I had been concerned that with the number of activities offered that the resort would be really noisy with piped music at all times etc. However, it was always possible to move to a part of the beach where we couldn't hear any of the activities, and the activities weren't very intrusive. I tried aqua-aerobics a couple of times. Quite fun and a good workout if you actually do the moves. I really appreciated the quiet of the resort. No piped music except at the pool bar area. The resort was very clean - people were always sweeping and cleaning. The pools were fairly warm, which seems somewhat rare in Mexico (where we've stayed anyway). Getting towels, pool toys, snorkels, etc. from the activities desk was very convenient. The bed linens/bedspread and the cheap plastic patio furniture keeps me from rating the room five stars. The beach and pool furniture could be more comfortable too. Apart from that though, the resort is beautiful, well maintained, and very comfortable. We'll certainly consider staying here again. Playa del Carmen has great restaurants and shops. Try to explore a bit off Avenida Quinta (5th). Feel free to email with questions.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Haciendas won't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: dirod
Reviews.Content: Our family of 9 traveled for a 7 night stay and had a wonderful time. The resort is basically brand new, we stayed on the north side which was finished June 2009. We had 2 villas on the ground floor like we requested, that made it great for walking out the patio door and down to the beach or pool. Like stated the buffet is pricey at $25.00 we ate there twice, the deli was convenient and we had pizza,chicken and salads to go. the beach side restaurant was priced OK and they had great food selections. This is definitely a great place to go when traveling with other family members as you each get you own room and bath. FYI....The resorts shuttle will not take you to the Royal resorts in Cancun, but will take you from there to the Haciendas, I think its part of them trying to get you to buy into the Haciendas. Overall we had a great time and would definanitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stress Free and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: liveWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Haciendas over New Year's week and enjoyed the resort and grounds so much that we chose not to leave for any tours. The service was impeccable from the minute we arrived to the minute we left. I never had to ask twice for anything and often what I needed was offered before I asked. My husband and I had the most relaxing vacation we have ever been on. The beds were heavenly and the view stunning. Below are a few of the issues that have been raised on other posts: Value: When I looked at comparable resorts in the area for the week of New Year's, this one was easily 200 dollars a night less expensive for the size and quality of the unit. Add the fact that there is a full kitchen and no extra charge for room service and it almost becomes a bargain. I definitely received more than I felt like I paid for. Food: I have to agree here that the food options could be better, but realistically they are unlimited with the kitchen and free shuttle to town. The new restaurant was stunning and delicious as well as a good addition to the resort. Room service had a great pizza and the market has fabulous pastries. With lunch poolside our meals were covered. Beach / Pool: We walked all the way into Playa and as far the other way and did not find any spectacular beaches until you came to town. However, the snorkeling on grounds makes up for the lack of easy ocean swimming. The pool in Phase I is heated and was never crowded. Both pools are in great condition and there was not a lack of lounge chairs or umbrellas. Service: We needed assistance on a flight issue from our conceirge and he was not at the resort that day. The sales desk located him and was able to assist us quickly. I couldn't complain about any member of the staff. Our room was spotless and cleaned with respect for our personal belongings. The grounds crew was always busy, but you did not notice them unless you looked. Diving: My husband is an avid diver and he was thrilled that the tours left right from shore at the resort. He was more than pleased with the clarity of the water, temperature, sea life, and professionalism of the dive masters. Spa: I receive at least one massage a month and this ranks in the top three that I have ever had. The facilities are underground and exquisite. The massuese was technical and what I thought was a bit high priced ended up being worth every penny. We will definitely be back to the Haciendas. We had high expectations and they were met.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and so-so view but HORRIBLE FOOD”
Reviews.Author: nflguy49
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean view villa. The room was very nice and clean. It had a balcony with a private spa/bath for two. My only complaint with the room was our "ocean view". We were further back from the beach then I thought we would be. We were too far back to hear the waves etc. They had palm trees and a Pool Bar that also blocked our view of the ocean. We could still see the ocean though so it wasn't a major deal. Just had hoped our ocean view would be similar to what it was at other resorts where you were close enough to hear the waves all night. The Beach was WAY too rocky and rough for swimming. That was a big disappointment. I had heard if you walk down the beach a bit that i would find less rocky areas but that wasn't true. When we wanted to swim we took a cab into downtown playa del carmen and swam in the beaches there. The Two main restaurants at Royal Haciendas are horrible. One of them is right on the beach. They are both very expensive but the food quality is just pathetic. The Bar food was just so-so but was much more affordable then the other two onsite options. We hated that the Pool bar and grill shut down their kitchen at 5pm and closed the bar at 6pm. It would have been nice to spend an evening or two at the pool bar but apparently the resort wants to force you into one of their crappy main restaurants. They do have an onsite grocery store with prices that are okay. Fine print on the final bill says if you make any messes in your villa kitchen that you must pay a $75 fee. They have a small room service menu that is available until 10pm. The choices were mediocre and the prices somewhat high ($12 bucks for a plain hamburger) We quickly discovered that the food and ambiance was better at the beach near downtown Playa Del Carmen. This required daily taxi rides which costs 20 bucks round trip plus tips. We found a small restaurant on the beach in playa called Fusion and LOVED IT! When we checked into our room at the Royal Haciendas we were told we had a personal concierge. We only heard from that person twice. Once to confirm our timeshare presentation and a 2nd time to confirm that we had attended that meeting. There were no recommendations for things to do or places to eat. The timeshare presentation wasn't too bad. Just a bunch of dog poo about the value of the timeshare only going up and stuff like that. It only lasted 40 minutes. If we return to Playa I would rather stay closer to downtown Playa where the food is better, the beach is better and you can avoid taking a taxi everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, super clean.”
Reviews.Author: MichelleMN1966
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there in December 2009 with friends. We were very impressed with the cleanliness of the property and rooms and with the customer service. We had a great time and will go back! It is a short ride into Playa del Carmen so we went there almost every evening for dinner. My only advice if you stay there and plan to go into Playa on the resort's shuttle is to reserve a spot on the shuttle early as the van holds 17 people and tends to fill up on the late afternoon runs. If it fills up and you have to take a taxi it is 10.00 into Playa in a cab (each way), not bad for one trip but if you go often adds up.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: LUVTOTRAVL13
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Timeshare owners and have had moderate success trading outside the Marriott properties, so were a bit anxious about the location. HOWEVER, Royal Haciendas met all our expectations and then some. The property is huge, well maintained, spotless (the maids help the men raking and cleaning seaweed off the beach each morning) and the staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. I was a bit concerned over all the reviews that mentioned high pressure to attend time share presentations during the stay, but we we firm with our personal concierge that we were not interested and the subject was dropped. We did feel bad though because we assume her livelihood is based off of getting guests to attend. The hotel was accommodating when we were stranded with the east coast snowstorm and were moved to an extremely reasonably priced room for an additional night's stay. We were on the phase 2 side of the property and were amazed at the spaciousness of the pool area and the availability of lounge chairs at all times. Although there was a charge for the fitness center, we found it well worth it for the availability of good quality equipment (elipticals, treadmills, cycles, weights, universal). The food at La Palapa was mediocre as reported in other reviews...even knowing this we still scheduled a dinner on the beach for our anniversary...dining under the stars was well worth the price even though the food was not memorable. The new seafood restaurant opened while we were there and our meal was excellent (grouper entree and crab pasta dish). Our favorite of the week was the mahi wrap and shrimp tacos at the Aqua Grill! We would definitely trade for this location again (especially after the Nick Price golf course opens for my husband). Although they had free wi-fi if you had your own equipment, it was annoying to have to pay for a web card in order to print boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to spend a relaxing and classy vacation”
Reviews.Author: travelgurrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Royal Haciendas from November 28th- December 5th, 2009 for our honeymoon. We traded timeshare that we have in BC for this week. We lucked out with an ocean front room. Everything we had in our beautiful "A" Side unit was wonderful. The units are stylish and clean. We felt like we had won the lottery, they are so luxurious. This was a wonderful resort for lazing around the pool and on the beach. The restaurant has very tasty food but can be a tad expensive. It is worth it to take a cab into Playa Del Carmen and visit the restaurants there or hit the Walmart for groceries. The Walmart was a neat experience because they have an assortment of Mexican food that we do not have here in Canada. We brought back some salsa that we have never seen before. Overall, this resort is fantastic. Really a beautiful place to stay. Our room had a hot tub on the patio overlooking the ocean and we used it every night. Just breathtaking in the evening too- we watched a lot of cruise ships in the distance. We could see the island of Cozumel across from us in the distance as well. Snorkeling in Cozumel is really an experience of a lifetime. The water is so blue and clear. We saw a lot of interesting fish and other sea life and coral. Take some Gravol though, for the ferry ride if you are prone to sea sickness. In Playa Del Carmen, there is a restaurant called El Cantil De Los Tiberones (Cave of the Shark, I think) and it had excellent seafood. Very, very good. Go see Xcaret when you are here, it's only a 15 minute cab ride. Xcaret (pron. "ish-car-ette") is a themepark with Mayan ruines, an underground river you can float down, lots of interesting cultural history and information and a wonderful evening show that depicts the ancient tribes and the changes that have occurred with the Spanish conquistadores. It was well worth our day. We were in Mexico for 2 weeks and we stayed here our first week. It was a great way to start our vacation. Our second week was in Cancun and the hotel we stayed at really disappointed us compared to the Royal Haciendas. We would really recommend staying here if you get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, but left much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: tapinsharon
Reviews.Content: Having researched on Trip Advisor prior to our vacation, I must first qualify my review by stating I had very high expectations. We travel a fair amount and stay at time shares. We only stay at top resorts, so things like cleanliness, beauty, and great customer service are expected. We stayed in the "hotel side" of a lockoff unit. The unit had two double beds - which was our first disappointment. One queen would have been much nicer. The unit was spacious for a hotel unit, with adequate service for two cups/bowls/plate/silverware and a minifridge, toaster and microwave. A nice sized vanity, and a separate bathroom with oversized tub. All quite nice. The room was towards the ocean side of the property - warning - this is quite a walk from the reception area. I'll give you the short version from here - we were in Phase One. Horribly noisy - woke me up every day with either somebody yelling into the microphone organizing activities, or the daily water aerobics instructor screaming out counts and blasting his music. Day one the pool bar music was also blasting, but we did complain to the front desk and that was turned down. Imagine having to listen to techno music as you are lying on the beach. Very disruptive to the relaxation we came there for. Everybody is assigned a personal concierge - who by the way - gets off at 5:00.....Ours was very non-responsive. Gave us curt, vague directions when asked....did as little work as possible, it seemed, and did not follow through on questions and problems. For instance, we had asked to be moved to Phase Two development which is in general quieter - but she never got back to us. I'm thinking a guest miserable because of noise is something to followup on. The workers at the resort are all very polite and greet you as you pass them. And there are many of them. However, none of them seemed to know where things were. I made two full laps of the property being sent in the wrong direction looking for the Gimnasio...Very frustrating. Speaking of which - 8 USD are charged for use of the gym. The shuttle to down-town is inadequate, as has been reported. The property is so far from downtown Playa that frequent shuttles should be offered - and certainly shuttles should continue during the evening. The lack of shuttle access seems to me to be representative of the lack of customer service at this property. Perhaps this is an attempt to keep guests on site for dinner - which brings me to the dinner buffets. First off - the waiters here are the hardest, most dilligent staff onsite (besides the gardners). They were wonderful. But the food was adequate at best, and very little effort was made to keep the salad bar options filled. There never seeemed to be any lettuce.....The drinks from the bar were also poor. We participated in some of the activities, which were more about the activities directors making noise than actually accomplishing something. There are activities from 8 - 4 each day. Some evening activities appeared - but were never advertised in advance. The entire property was a maze and it was very difficult to find out what amenities it had, where things were located, etc. There was no book in the room to share any information. There was a welcome orientation on Sunday, but with the two hour time difference, and after 20 hours of travel, we had hopes of sleeping - though that didn't turn out so well. The beach is rocky on the Phase One side - and the ocean was pretty rough. Phase two is sandier. All in all, I strongly recommend Phase Two if you are looking for relaxation. On the positive side, the pools are lovely. The bartenders and the swimup bar are fun for happy hour. It is quite lovely sitting in the warm pool towards the end of the day holding a drink. The property itself is pretty - but way too much concrete making it look rather stark instead of lush. And aside from a few birds, never saw a single living creature there....though even in our room we had plenty of gnats and mosquitoes. Would I stay there again? Yes - but not if there were other choices closer to town. A lot of hype - and not much delivery....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at Royal Hacienda!”
Reviews.Author: islaluvr
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from one week at Royal Hacienda. The resort is beautiful and clean. Service has improved since last year by 100%. Enjoyed our daily grouper sandwich at the Aqua Grill pool bar! Happy hour is from 3-6p at the pool bars, Raymundo, Edgar and our buddy Carlos made each afternoon a great time. The water was warm, some waves but not as rough as Cancun, so you can swim without being torn up. The daily shuttle can take you for free to Playa del Carmen, reservations a must, but shuttles stop at 6:30. A taxi ride is $10 USD for the way back to the resort at night. Only ate 1 dinner at Royal Hacienda's La Palapa main restaurant. Was good, but way overpriced for selection (was seafood night.) Each night we went to town and had dinner and walked 5th Ave. If you like big partying, this is not the place for you, but if you like a little partying and lots of R&R and pampering, then I highly recommend the Royal Haciendas!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Vacations Ever-Fantastic Resort- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: reydave
Reviews.Content: We visited Playa Del Carmen and stayed at The Royal Haciendas through a timeshare exchange from 11/28-12/5. What a fantastic experiance from the begining. We arrived at the Cancun airport and fought our way through the timeshare folks trying to give us a deal. It is best just to ignore them, We got outside and met with a Thomas Moore rep. We had made a reservation with Thomas Moore shuttle through the resort. The fare was $22.50USD per person. The ride was about 45 minutes and the shuttle had a total of 8 other folks going to the resort too. The shuttle fare was charged to our resort room. The resort offers a great exchange for USD to pesos. I recommend you exchange some money at the resort as they offer better rates than the exchange companies at the airport and downtown. You can use USD to purchase things in town and you get better rates at gift shops and souviner shops. We arrived at the resort and we're greated by the friendly staff. The resort had started to put up Christmas decorations and there was a nice tree up and we were greated by Santa inside. We checked in and were told that we were assigned a personal conciere. We went to our room, 1-bedroom with a kitchen. The room was very clean and spacious. The room had a full kitchen. The bathroom was big and had a big walk in shower with a hot tub located on a balcony outside the room, that overlooked the ocean. The bedroom had a King Bed and full closet with plenty of room. There was a TV in the bedroom and in the Living room. The resort was very nice and right on the beach, it was truly a 5 Star Resort. The resort had a big pool with a swim up bar (happy hour from 3PM-6PM). In addition, there was a lap pool. There are two resturants, one by the pool for casual dining and the other on the beach for more formal. We had the breakfast buffet one morning ($15 USD), worth the experiance. The other option was the resorts grocery store that has pretty much everything you can need at very competitive prices. We stayed away for lunch and dinner based on previous reviews here. The resort lead us right to the beach where there were plenty of palapas for guests to use (no charge). The water was calm and you could walk out about 100 yards and still be waist high. The resort is located about 20 minutes from town and the resort provides daily shuttle service into town. You need to reserve this the day before. The other option to get into town to take a cab, whcih is about 100 Pesos or $8 USD. The hotel has a list of taxi fares outside the lobby, which is fixed. We would normally take the shuttle into town for dinner and take a cab back to the resort. Overall, we had a wonderful time at the resort and will be coming back next year as one week was not enough. The best part was the resort amenities,the beach, the pool, happy hour, the service, and the fine dining in the town. The resort services such as the grocery store and exchangin money were a plus. You can spend the whole week there, but there is also plenty historical sites to see. We made it to Chichenitza ruins with an outside travel agency. Only areasfor improvement at the resort would be the travel company located there and the personal consigere. I do not recommend Thomas Moore, the travel agency inside the resort as they charge $99 USD per person for a tour of Chichenitza. We booked a trip through Odessey Travel for $45 USD per person. The company has a few locations through out 5th Ave (downtown). I will write a seperate review on them. The personal consigere was there for us from the begining. She gave us great dining recommendations, but she kept asking us to attend the resorts time share presentation. We agreed to attend, the experiance was ok, no high preasure like other Mexican resorts. We did not hear from her after we attended the resort. On the way home, we took a cab for 380 Pesos $30USD, which we reserved on our own. This saved us some $ instead if using Thomas Moore. All else was fine at the resort. We will be back in 2010, maybe for 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort!!! Can't Wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Luvbeach2
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott owners & exchanged out timeshare through Interval to stay at the Royal Mayan this past February. While there, we met a guest who told us about the Royal Haciendas. We took a "timeshare" trip there - honestly, just for the free lunch, & a change of scenery. Once we got there - WOW! - we fell in love - and BOUGHT a Christmas-week villa on the spot! we couldn't help ourselves - the grounds were gorgeous, the staff friendly, & the beach incredible!!! We then came back the next day & wished that we could have spent the rest of our vacation at the Royal Haciendas! The resort is quiet - but this is the beauty of it - we own in Aruba & live in NYC, so we got tired of the noise, crowds, and fighting over the lounge chairs (fuggedabout getting a palapa on the beach at the Marriott Aruba!). At the Royal Haciendas, any palapa we wanted on the beautiful white beach was ours just for the asking....unbelievable!!! We are going back this Christmas for 8 days with our best friends and just can't wait!!!! Now if someone would just buy our Aruba timeshare.......

Reviews.Title: “Royal treatment at the Royal Haciendas”
Reviews.Author: mijinkal
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about the service at the Royal Haciendas. It seemed like there was 2 staff members per guest at the resort and all of them were extremely friendly and helpful. Each guest gets a personal concierge that is always there to answer your questions and help you have a good time. There are enough activities to keep yourself busy at the resort for a week without leaving. We took part in the salsa lessons, Spanish lessons, pottery and snorkeling. There isn't much of a nightlife so we took a cab to Playa del Carmen each night (100 pesos). The restaurant closes at 10:00 and the resort almost seems deserted by 9:00. We decided not to eat at the dinner buffet at the in house restaurant because of the price ($30) and ordered off the menu. The food was very bland, there was almost no flavor to it at all. The service was fast and professional but we decided to eat in town for the remainder of our trip. The rooms are spacious and clean. We slept through the night in the comfortable beds and the curtains kept all the light out in the morning to allow us to sleep in. All of the appliances and electronics are modern and in excellent shape. The beach was always clean and tidy. They have workers that rake the beach every morning. There was more than enough room for all the guests and we never had a hard time finding a place to sit. There is free snorkel rental available and the snorkeling just off the beach was full of fish and sea urchins. The snorkeling wasn't as good as Xel-Ha but it was great for being steps from our room. There were not many younger people at the resort as we had hoped. We noticed less than 10 people around their early to mid 30's. There were a few families and a lot of seniors. Everybody still knew how to have a great time, especially at happy hour in the swim up bar. We will definitely be going back to the Royal Haciendas in the future and are seriously considering purchasing our own villa at the resort. I hope this helps you decide to visit the resort. You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “People need to know...”
Reviews.Author: lsyreno
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a hotel, it is a timeshare. Thus, you have to do a little more for yourselves and follow the rules and regulations set by the managers and owner's association. This is not a place for loud partying --they discourage spring break hordes-- but is to be treated as your home while you are there. Granted, it has lots of amenities, great spa, tours, pools restaurants and the like, but first an foremost it is "owned." When we see people trashing our property, being rude because they are not getting the service from they think you deserve from staff (many of whom are nearly family members of the owners who return year after year) it is really annoying. Stop an consider, too, you are in another country with different ways of doing things and a more relaxed way of life. That's why we go--that's why we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: pgoldner
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Royal Haciendas for the last three Christmas vacations. We are going back this year as well. The beach is beautiful white sand and the water is calm an aqua blue. There is an activity center for children, several play areas for children and several baby pools. The restaurants are convenient and there is a small grocery store by the front desk area. The resort also has laundry facilities. This is not an ideal place for young couples to party or for infirm people as the resort is very large and requires some walking. The staff are very helpful and the workers keep the resort in immaculate condition. Our dish washer in the room broke last year and their maintinance people wheeled in a brand new one, took out our broken unit and in less than an hour we had a working machine. I thought the service, decor to be excellent, the food is very good but not gourmet.. This is not a Four Seasons or a Mandarin Oriental five star resort, but it is a good solid four star establishment and I would not hesitate to recommend it for young families I have attached a copy of the view from our window in unit E135, you can see a bit of the jacuzzi (the little kids loved that). There is a full spa on the grounds. Paul Goldner.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT an AWESOME Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: chopchop72
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and inlaws went to the Royal Haciendas in Playa Del Carmen September 26th - October 3rd 2009 and we LOVED it. Both pools were open for business, the view from the room was spectactular, the food at the Hacienda was "OK" but we did not see a difference in the quality until we went to Playa Del Carmen for dinner...so while the food at the Hacienda was good, the food in Playa Del Carmen was 10x's better :) The Service at the 2 outdoor cafe's was OK at best. As an American, we tend to want prompt service and quick turn around for food service. Forget about that when you go to Mexico...if you can deal with that then you'll be A-OK! The diving was spectactular, the service from the staff was first class all the way. You want it, they will get it for you. Swim up bars were fantastic. Margaritas and Funky Monkey's were the BEST drinks. The rotunda bar inside was terrific. Remy Martin XO and top shelf Tequilla. The bartender took about 45 minutes with me to educate me about Tequilla. I was very impressed with that. Snorkeling was fantastic and the SCUBA Diving was religious! WOW what a beautiful place. You have to be flexible and go with the flow in Mexico, otherwise you'll not have a good time. Chill out, relax and remember you're on vacation....so its ALL GOOD!

Reviews.Title: “You can never go wrong in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: StineeeNY
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at The Royal Haciendas in April/09. We had a wonderful vacation. Not only were the rooms and the hotel immaculate more importantly the people were so friendly. Great pool area and swim up bar. Also a great kiddie pool. Lots of lounge chairs and palapas at the beach. Though if you want a prime spot it is always good to get up early a save a chair. Food was very good. Usually had lunch by the pool. My brother went deep sea fishing and the chef working the grill was more than happy to cook the fish for us for a few bucks...seasoned the fish perfectly. Dinner in town, Playa De carmen, was fantastic. Never had a bad meal. Lots of great shopping in town, fun to walk around or grab a cold corona at a bar. Overall a great trip and would return again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “I love the royal haciendas!!”
Reviews.Author: JESSICASBIZARREGIFTS
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many places, but I must say this resort has been one of my favorites. You could tell the people that work there love thier jobs, which in turn means they treated us wonderfully. The rooms are great we had three 2 bedroom villas and every condo was clean and comfortable and were great..... very roomy. The ocean doesn't look real with the beautiful blue colors, and this resort is right on the beach, we had so much fun in the pool in the evening. But make sure you get back to your condo by 6:30 and get that bug spray on the mosquitos are so aggresive, we thought it was strange the first day we had the pool to ourselves after 6:30 and then we figured it out. That is the only complaint we had, so we just made sure we applied alot of "bug off"at dusk. Chichen itza was nice but our favorite was x-caret, I wish we would of gone earlier in the day, there is quite a bit to do, the buffet there is excellent, I love that yucatan food. The resort had excellent food in the restaurants and at the pool bar but we didn't care for room service food. the mexican buffet is excellent and the wraps at the pool restaurant are yummy!! I would definetly go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Place to Kick Back and Be Lazy!”
Reviews.Author: thefitzgeralds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Royal Haciendas in the Riviera Maya in September. We recommend this resort for familes and / or couples who are looking for a low-key getaway to a place that is all about relaxation! We visited this resort by timeshare trade through Interval International. The resort is EXTREMELY clean. We were impressed day in and day out by how much care is put into making the place look perfect. The staff clearly takes pride in making the resort, including the suites, common areas, beach and pools, beautifully maintained. Our goal for this vacation was to simply relax, so we spent the majority of our time relaxing by the pool or on the beach under one of the umbrellas, and it was great. The resort conveniently has a market where you can buy basic groceries. The prices vary ... some items I found to be reasonably priced and comparable to what you would expect to pay here in the US, but some items were expensive. We tried to just be selective and bought what we needed for breakfast, lunch and snacks. Although we didn't use the service, the resort also offers free shuttle transportation in and out of the town of Playa Del Carmen. A nice feature, if you are looking to head into town for a day. Our only complaint about this resort was that there is really one place to eat dinner. You can order food at the pool bar until 4:45 p.m., but then they close their kitchen. Going into town is an option for dinner, but if you are looking to just kick back at the resort, there is just one restaurant and the prices are high. They have a different "theme" each night so if you are a picky eater or are in the mood for something specific, this is a pain. Overall, we thought this was a nice resort and we would definitely consider going again!

Reviews.Title: “A week in a DELUX BEACH FRONT VILLA at the HACIENDAS for FREE !!!”
Reviews.Author: jnk001295
Reviews.Content: Apparently, when someone purchases a time share at a ROYAL RESORT, they get a certificate for a free one week stay. The one I got from a charity auction that reads: "This certificate entitles the bearer to a one week stay in a delux beach front villa (sleeps 6) at the Royal Sands Resort in Cancun, Mexico. Check-in is on November 15, 2008 and check-out is on November 22, 2008. The Thomas Moore Travel Agency will provide airport transportation." The nice young man (hard to understand with heavly accent and not so good english) taking the reservation asked me to allow him to change the reservation from the Royal Sands in Cancun to the NEWEST, MOST BEAUTIFUL AND LUXURIOUS ROYAL HACIENDAS RESORT near Playa del Carmin. I asked about snorkeling and ocean reefs and he advised the best snorkeling and reef on the whole coast was right in front of the Royal Haciendas. How could I say no. I agreed. We completed the process and he was very nice, telling me all about the beautiful villa with a large fully equiped kitchen, a large master bedroom with a private bathroom, 3 flat screen televisions with DVD players, a private balcony with sun beds, table and chairs, and a whirlpool tub for two on the main terrace. Sounded wonderful. He gave me the phone number for Thomas Moore Travel and advised I needed to call them within two weeks of traveling to make the arrangement for transport to and from the airport. THEN: He needed my CREDIT CARD NUMBER so he could complete the reservation. No problem. "You are all set Mr. 'SMITH' and by the way, there is a $315 charge because this resort has higher rates the Sands." So now my free stay will cost $315. That's not so bad. When the time came to arrange transport, I called and found the airport transport would cost $150 for four people. Now my free week will cost $465. I was wondering what would be next. There was a death in the family and we had to cancel. "No problem, Mr. Smith. We will hold your reservation in escrow and you can reschedule anytime in the next year and pay only a $50 rebooking fee." That sounded very nice. Maybe it was luck in disguise. I now know that only part of the resort was completed last year and the dirt and noise ruined the vacations of some of the guests. I wonder if that is why that kind young man wanted to switch me to the HACIENDAS so much. So here we are getting ready to go during the school break this month and I call and guess what. The reservation specialists hand me off to a seniorita that is laughing for 30 seconds when she picks up the phone and speaks almost no english and explains that THE SAME ROOM WILL COST YOU $1085 MORE THIS YEAR. Eventually I give up trying to understand her and speak to the booking manager BLAKE. The price is higher this year because 1) the prices have gone up and 2) last year my certificate was valued at a "special promotion" rate, this year since I am rebooking, I do not qualify for the "special promotion" rate. "But it is a certificate for a weeks stay," I attempt to clarify, "and you are the ones who put a value on it, not me." There us nothing we can do says BLAKE. So can I get the NOT DELUXE NOT BEACH FRONT two bedroom? Yes, it is only $450 more. Let me get this straight, MY ABSOLUTELY FREE ONE WEEK STAY IN A DELUXE BEACH FRONT VILLA IS NOW IN A ONE WEEK BOOKING IN A SMALLER AND NOT DELUXE NOT BEACH FRONT ROOM AND IT IS GOING TO COST ME A TOTAL OF $915??? Yes Mr. Smith, and you are getting a good deal. We are looking forward to seeing you Mr. Smith. You betcha. And I am going to get my money's worth too. Report to follow. I continue to be very truly yours, Mr. "Smith"

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort- will be back”
Reviews.Author: PaulZielinski
Reviews.Content: We visited the Royal Haciendas in June right after the kids got out of school. We own Marriott and traded this within our Interval International membership. This was our first -ever visit to Mexico. At first we were a little cautious due to the H1N1 (swine) flu outbreak, but from all the forums we read (especially TripAdvisor) this area really was not affected. And, as we found out upon arrival, this was true. Sadly, the economy there was severely affected by the bad publicity. After arrival at the airport, the obligatory health survey to say if you are or are not sick (and an occasional, random temperature check by the Health Officials) , and a LONG wait in line through Customs entry (a JOKE!) our group of 5 bought a bus ticket after hearing that the cab rides were not such a bargain. We discovered later that this was not true. In fact, after the bus took us to downtown Playa Del Carmen, we still had to take two cabs back to the resort for about $20 US. In the end, this (bus and cab combo) cost more than 2 cabs which only takes 4 passengers, or a van that can hold 6-7 passengers. Highly recommend taking the cabs for 4 or fewer and a van cab for bigger groups to and from the airport. The trip is direct and more convenient. For the "fun of it" we were hit-up by the timeshare salespeople near the airport's exit trying to set us up for a presentation. They offered to reimburse us for the bus we took, free taxi to and from the resort, provide free brunch (was GREAT!), bottle of tequilla, and some extra cash. We were also offered 2 free tickets and transportation to the Chitzen Itza Mayan Ruins, among other activities which we planned on going to anyhow. All the extra tickets were 1/2 the regular price. We took the bait knowing we would not be buying, we'd save money on the bus reimbursement, got a lot of extra's to boot, and how to handle these sales guys. We did the "Tres Rios Resort" tour. It was a really nice place, but no thanks since we already owned a beautiful Marriott timeshare in St. Thomas. Besides, they had no kitchen facilities there. You HAD to eat at their restaurants on property (inclusive). Getting back to Royal Haciendas, the place was clean, generally well maintained, very friendly staff (Isaac, our concierge was great, and always invited us to all the owners events). They didn't even TRY to sell us a tour and timeshare. We were so impressed by the place though, we probably would have bought a share there. We had to practically beg to have a tour/presentation just to learn something about the property aside from what we saw. While one of the pool areas was closed for renovations, it was not a hassle to go to the other one...this despite what someone had said about having to walk a LONG way to get to a pool. Going from one end of the resort rooms area to the pool area that was open could not have taken more than two whole minutes. Beaches were nice and clean. No pesky vendors either. There were plenty of activities on site offered by the resort...most free. ALSO, the resort has complimentary shuttles from the resort to Playa Del Carmen that run regularly all day. We took one to Playa, walked to the local WalMart for the week's worth of groceries, and then took it back. No cab needed! You just need to reserve a space for time of departure and expected return. We used this service two or three more times to visit Playa and their shops. The resort's restaurant(s) were good, but very limited. Very glad we had a kitchen in our unit to cook. I highly recommend the Royal Haciendas for your couples or family holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Royal Resorts!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cricket0331
Reviews.Content: I traded my Royal Sands week for a week at the Hacienda, and of course it was fabulous. There was pool construction going on, but since the resort was fairly empty, we were able to change rooms to the other side. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Our concierge was Dante, and he was great. Never pushy, but very helpful with maps and tips on the southern areas. Our maid service was excellent, the market is great and so convenient, and the front desk people were wonderful. If possible, register for your checkin prior to leaving the states. Our check in was so fast and easy. The lady checked our name, gave us a key, and we were on our way...no waiting in line. We also had some items ordered from the market to be delivered to the room, and it was nice to unpack with a cold beer. The drinks at the pool bar could use more alcohol, but watching some people, they had plenty in their drinks! I was envious. We walked from the resort to town, but we made the mistake of leaving at about 9am. The heat was unbelievable, so it was nice to jump in the water during the walk. This walk would be great first thing in the morning for breakfast in town, or after happy hour. The resort offers scheduled shuttle service to town, but you do need to sign up in advance. We rented a car, and that was great to head south. I won't drive in Cancun though...too many crazy drivers there. We had an Atos, it was uncomfortable and had no radio, but the AC worked just fine. We had side A with the full kitchen. It was great, I love having a kitchen when I travel. The master bathroom has a walkin shower, and that was wonderful. On the balcony is a hot tub to warm up with after night swimming. Bring a small pillow for bedtime if you are picky like me, theirs are stiffer than I like. Overall, this place is fantastic and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyKyMike
Reviews.Content: Overall it is an excellent place to stay. One pool in phase 1 and 2 is being repaired. But the main pool in Phase 3 and 4 was more than ample to handle the guests during our stay. Rooms are very nice! Shower was best I have had in Mexico. Flat screen Tv's in main area and in both bedrooms. Very nice grounds throughout the hotel. The activities are provided daily and subject to the interest of the guests. This was better some days than others. Happy hour from 3pm to 6pm allows plenty of opportunity to try many drinks without the all inclusive treatment. Drinks at times lacked alcohol. Restuarants are a little limted in the menu selection. Breakfest is ample. Mahi mahi wraps were awesome at the pool side lunch bar area. Other offering were just okay. New main restuarant is coming and will be a nice addition. One major complaint is the charge for refills on sodas. 2 sodas for 80 pesos. Please that is rediculous. It is hot and they should change this asap. Good pizza from take out. Also good desserts. Theme nights were sometimes better than other at La Palapa. Overall food was okay. Night around resort was peaceful and I personally enjoyed this. This resort sits far off the main road and is not friendly to catching buses. You basically need to take taxis to where you what to go. There is a shuttle to Playa De Carmen. Free internet in the room was a nice plus. Maid service daily besides Sunday was nice also. Some very positive things with just a few areas that could have been better. Hector on the activities staff worked hard for the guests during games and made the stay enjoyable. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER go there again!”
Reviews.Author: motogirlrr
Reviews.Content: Traded for my timeshare in San Diego. 1. Room smelled like Old Bay Seasoning the entire time. 2. Hot water on 2nd bathroom sink wasn't turned on. 3. Electricity went out 4 nights in a row!!! 4. Electricity went out while dining in the hotel restaurant. It took the staff 10 minutes to bring us a candle as we sat in the dark and couldn't see our food. They didn't even apologize for the power outage. 5. Asked the waiter how much the lobster was. He said 399 pesos. I ordered it. The bill was for 340 pesos so I sent the bill back. When he brought the revised copy it was for 395 pesos. Made me wonder if he was just pulling numbers out of nowhere. 6. My friend ordered a small bottle of water at the beach. The waiter brought her a large. 7. The resort book in the room stated the gym cost $5 USD per day. When we went to the gym, they charged us $8 USD. They said the new book wasn't printed, yet wouldn't honor the printed price, instead they posted a $8 charge sign at the gym. 8. After the electricity came back on, the cable television was still out...ALL NIGHT. 9. The water also went out one night. 10. The resort forces you to use your key card to bill everything to your room and you pay at check out. They do not allow you to use cash or credit card for any purchases at the resort. 11. My friend's key card would work in one area of the resort and not another. She spent over an hour in total waiting around for the staff to get purchases (drinks, dinner, etc) billed to the card/room. 11. There was vomit floating in the main pool. 12. Anyone has access to the resort, they don't make you wear bracelets like the other nearby resorts. So all the locals stay there and use the facilities free of charge. I realized this after seeing so many locals at the pool and then showering and changing in the bathroom at the end of the day (as opposed to doing this in the privacy of your rooom, if you were really a guest of the resort). 12. I think my patience level is pretty high. After the third day of these occurances, I decided enough was enough and it was time to complain to the Manager. The Manager did NOTHING to comp us for even a spa treatment to help relieve the stress that came from what was supposed to be a relaxing vacation. THIS PLACE IS NOT A 5-STAR RESORT.. I've stayed at the St. Regis in Dana Point, CA, that is a 5-star resort. This one is a 3 AT BEST.

Reviews.Title: “BAMBOOZLED”
Reviews.Author: BermudaloverBoston
Reviews.Content: First of all I'd like to start by saying that we love the Royal Resorts. When in Mexico we truly consider them our home. We usually go for 2 wks and stay at the Royal Sands. Last year we did our first week at the Sands and came to Haciendas for the 2nd wk. We loved the Royal Haciendas and were really smitten. We were looking forward to returning. This year we were a little concerned with the swine flu, but stayed updated daily through the royal web site and decided to continue with our plans. We exchanged to a penthouse unit in Building B with what we thought would be great views over the pool and some beach. Once we got there we were very disappointed to find out that the pool in our area was closed due to renovations. They failed to mention, that the entire area of phase 1 and 2 was under construction. So we had to walk a long ways with the kids past all the construction to use the pool,all activities and the beach. Good thing we didn't bring our parents, the long walks back and forth would have been too exhausting. We understand that they have to renovate their pool. We just wished that they had mentioned that the pool area would be temporarily closed on the web site as Resorts have done in the past. Had we known we would have just stayed the 2 wks at the Sands and been happy. Aside from this experience, we did have a good time last year and we know that when the construction is finished it will be a beautiful resort to vacation at.

Reviews.Title: “We had a beautiful stay at The Royal Haciendas”
Reviews.Author: DOGGROOMER
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 weeks in Mexico for this trip as a girlfriends getaway. Our first week was at the Avalon Reef Club in Isla Mujeres and the second week was at the Royal Haciendas. This place is just beautiful. We couldn't of asked for a more beautiful place to stay for our week in the Riviera Maya. I think the only complaint I had of this place is that it was just too big. We had to walk forever to get to the front desk and it was especially bad when our door keys did not work and they kept insisting that it did and we had to walk back and forth to the desk to get it straightened out. It was especially really bad for me because I have a bad knee and bad ankle. I think they need to get golf carts for the people that are handicapped. After that was straightened out, the rest of the week was great. We rented a car for the week and went to Tulum, went snorkeling at Akumal Bay where we saw sea turtles, Yal ku lagoon (which was amazing), the Jungle Place, Hidden Worlds Cenote, went into Playa del Carmen and just had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “NEGLECTED DOCTORS AT THE ROYAL HACIENDAS”
Reviews.Author: billy0717
Reviews.Content: We were just last week in there and we are so desapointed with the family doctor they have. A two year old boy got really sick with very high temperature and the doctor said he had a throat infection without testing or anything so he had to put an antiboitic shoot right away. I told him we were concerned about the synthoms since they could be mistaken with the V1N1 or swine flu. He laugh at me and sarcasticly said he had read a lot even when he had never had a patient with the flu before. Well, the boy got sicker and sicker until the parents decided to bring him back home in Texas. Guess what?! They flue test came out positive and he and the rest of the family was inmediately put on Tamiflu antiviral but the doctors here do not understand how in the world was an antiboitic given to the child without a test. It is incredible that the resort does not provide a good medical asistence when the whole country has a break out of the swine flu specially in a place where hundreds and hundreds families stay sharing all comunity areas, restorants, pools and weekly villas. If the doctor did not have a way to test he should have turned us to a goverment clinic or somewhere they could dignose the baby properly as we sugested but what can you do when you are in a foreign country at the mecry of a ''doctor'' and you don't have a clue where to go in a place like Playa del Carmen in the middle of nowhere? The worst is that after we let them know all this they did not do anything about it.THE RESORT HAS NOT taken any sanitary alert or anything, not even they let the new family staying in the same villa where the boy had stayed a few hours ago since we belive they are so afraid of spereading the word so people would panic and leave the hotel so they would lose the bussines. It was IRRESPOSABLE, INCOMPETENT AND NEGLEGTED ATTITUDE OF THE DOCTORS AND THE RESORT.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumMember
Reviews.Content: My husband and I joined my parents (who own a the timeshare here) and my younger sister for a week here in June. The rooms were very nice and spacious and have wireless internet access. We had the entire villa (side A and B) and for 5 people this is ample room. The pool area was nice, although the pool in Phase 1 is currently closed. There were plenty of chairs, although we spent most of our time on the beach. The beach has plenty of sand (unlike some in Cancun due to the hurricane) and the water was clear and (mostly) calm. The food at the resort is so-so. There is only one restaurant, Lapa Lapa and the pool bar. We went in to town most nights for dinner. The resort provides a shuttle in to Playa del Carmen, but you have to reserve space in advance and the shuttles only run once per hour (I think). A taxi ride is about 100 pesos. The spa is nice, but I would recommend a deep tissue or sports massage if you want something comparabale to a sweedish massage in the US. Three of us got the "relaxing massage" and agreed that it was less massage/pressure than what you get in the US (despite asking for more pressure). It was more like a relaxing 'rub' is what best describes it. My main complaint is that the AC in the fitness center was broken while we were there - YUCK. It was really hot in there and without any air circulation. All in all, the resort was nice and without the madness that surrounds similar places in Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: ddnd03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 6 year wedding anniversary and we just returned from paradise! We had an amazing stay at this resort and we were blown away over all the attention to detail. Here are some highlights: 1) Awesome staff. They were funny, friendly, and super helpful. 2) Gorgeous beach & sea. 3) Delicious food offered at the resort. 4) Great prices! From the 1/2 price drinks & free chips & salsa everyday from 3-6pm, to overall cheap margaritas & meals, we were so excited that the resort prices were not expensive. 5) Super convenient market on site with, once again... Great prices & everything you would need. 6) Free yoga everyday! 7) Free internet! 8) A beautiful 50 minute walk along the beach into downtown Playa - which is one of our favorite places. 9) Terrific rooms & grounds throughout the hotel. 10) Lots of activities all day long. This includes the huge pool with a swim up bar, free snorkel & kayaks, tennis, & lots of shade on the beach. 11) Location is perfect! Situated near all other places of interest- Cozomel, Tulum, Playa, Xcarat, Cancun, etc. I could go on, but I better get back to work : ) - Nikki

Reviews.Title: “A nice resort, just not for everyone.”
Reviews.Author: Lexlthr
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed at the Hotel in early June for a week. All in all it is a solid resort but i wouldn't stay there again. We stayed at the resort about a month after the big "swine flu" scare and we anticipated that the resort would not be full. My frustration with the resort primarily revolves around its philosophy. In the wonderful reading materials in the room they have a book that essentially says the following..."Royal Haciendas is a time share that is intended to be your home for the week. It is not a hotel and therefore there are big differences.....If you expect mild inconveniences, remember this is not a hotel....we are a not for profit facility and therefore if you don't get checked in right away we cannot offer you free nights stays...etc." The part that I want to point out is that the Resort is essentially giving you an excuse right up front and that philosophy is throughout. During out stay, our #1 inconveniece was our Concierge, Berto. When we walked in the front door, he wouldn't let us talk to the people standing there to check us in. He was trying to be helpful. He wanted to give us "excellent service." He personally escorted us to our room and it was a real effort for us to get him to leave. He wanted to tell us about all of the wonderful restaurants around and all the activities that the hotel could do...etc. He then told us about the events that the resort had....i.e. a welcome party and a taco party...but unfortunately he forgot the invitations to these and would need to bring them back some other time. He also said the resort was 80% full this week, which was total BS. He told us that he would take care of our transportation from the airport and have this credited to our account. My wife and myself were going to scuba dive during the week and we already had our trips scheduled, but Berto wanted to help us with that too. Nice guy...but just a puppy you wanted to kick. Long story short, we never did get our invites and when he came up the next day we couldn't get him to leave again. He said that he would meet us the next day for breakfast and that the resort wanted to talk to us for a brief period, not pressure, about the timeshare program. When we went to meet our new buddy, he was not there but we were instructed to go to the members desk. The lady there wanted me to sign a piece of paper stating that I knew the timeshare presentation would be a full 90 minute commitment. No thanks...I will buy my own crappy breakfast. Our #2 inconvenience was the large pool close to our room that was closed because all of the water had drained from it when the pool settled. We were given a sheet of paper stating that these things happen and it was just a mild inconvience. Our #3 inconvenience was all of the rocks at the beach/ocean that made running into the water a painful experience. I know you can't fight mother nature and win all the time, but they didn't even try to help. Our #4 inconvenience was the mid-week call stating that for $699 we could stay another week. You could find cheaper rates online for the same resort than what they were offering. What was good about the resort....#1...the rooms are beautiful.
