We had one of the smallest rooms and the tile work and furniture were wonderful. #2...the store downstairs is reasonable and has a great selection of food, booze, and gifts. #3...The resort staff at the pool and maintaining the grounds were very friendly. #4..Free Internet. My wife and myself didn't spend another dime at the resort after our breakfast debacle. We did spend plenty of time taking $10 taxi rides to town to enjoy our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: Retiring2Montana
Reviews.Content: This was such an awesome place, we became members. We will be visiting every year for 3 weeks in November (2 weeks here and 1 week at the Royal Sands in Cancun). If you want to be treated like royalty, in a relaxing setting, visit The Royal Haciendas in Playa del Carmen. A 5 minute ride from the city and port but far enough away for privacy and quiet. There are activities for just about everyone if you choose to be involved. This is a very laid back high quality resort with top knotch service.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of paradise!”
Reviews.Author: EQFoodies
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had stayed at the Cancun Royal Resorts in the past and had wonderful experiences, so we decided to give the Royal Haciendas in Playa del Carmen a try by trading through Interval. We were blown away!! The place is basically brand new with a little construction ongoing (I honestly never heard a single hammer all week though). The lobby was great...check in took 5 mins...and there was no pressure to attend any timeshare stuff...your concierge will ask because its their job, but gladly took no for an answer. The staff was great...spoke english fairly well which helped with my broken spanish! The rooms are beautiful with all the amenities. Large bathrooms, granite tops, comfortable beds. I would think most, if not all, have an ocean view. The grounds are perfectly manicured with a lot of open spaces so it would never feel cramped even during the busiest times. The pools (2) are huge and each has a swim up bar/restaurant. There are two large kids pools as well so that would be great for families. There are 4 hot tubs that were not too hot which was nice since its almost 90 degrees there right now! Plenty of chairs so no need to fight for space. The beach was absolutely gorgeous and very large and you get the best of both worlds! There is tons of white sand! Tons of palapas for shade if you want it and no shortage of chairs! About half of the water has very nice sandy bottom for swimming and the waves were always around 2 feet...fun but not dangerous by any means! The other half has rocks and reef which made for fun snorkeling. Its not great snorkeling or anything, but the resort has gear you can use for free. They also have kayaks you can use free as well! The restaurants were all very good. There were basically two at this point: La Palapa is the main restaurant under a huge Palapa right on the water, and the Aqua Grill which is the pool bar/restaurant at each pool. There is a new seafood restaurant set to open this fall though. La Palapa does breakfast, lunch, and dinner buffets (the dinners are themed like Mexican, Seafood, Caribbean) but you can order off a menu at any time as well. We had the breakfast buffet a few times and it was great with made to order omelletes and waffles and truly fresh juices. We had dinner there one night off the menu and it was also very good. The Aqua Grilles were also very good...we tried shrimp tacos (killer) and a mahi wrap (even better). The setting was great as you could get a little shade but still have ocean views. My only issue...and we knew this going in...was that it is a little ways out of town...too far to walk for sure. They definitely know this and provide a shuttle to PDC throughout the day. I wish it ran a little later into the evening, but it probably will as the place gets busier. The taxi was only $8 each way so it really was no big deal, but if you really like the nightlife, this place may be a bit quiet for you. The Royal Resorts have definitely done it again...the place is really amazing. I really cannot say enough good about the place! We absolutely did not want to leave...its truly a little slice of paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything, but had to leave early”
Reviews.Author: rosienchrisg
Reviews.Content: I read reviews before we went on our trip; I must say the place is magnificent! Very beautiful and very clean and well appointed. Lots of open space to roam and not feel crowded. The pools were very nice and always a beach chair available even though it was certainly busy. Our check in took 10 minutes, check out the same. Food was wonderful, I am a chef by trade. More than I expected. I thought it a little out of the way; can't walk to anything!!! Pretty much have to take bus, taxi, car etc. to go anywhere. There is no ATM on the grounds so bring cash with you if you plan to shop on the theme night (which is totally worth it). We did all tips in cash; felt they get more of it for those who earned it. So now the sad part, the Swine Flu hit and we left early in case flights were cut off. We were just starting to relax and decided to go home so we did not get stuck there. All other reviews are correct - beach pool and food and booze during the day and go to bed early!!! It worked for us... we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL RESORT”
Reviews.Author: RhodeIslandSunlover
Reviews.Content: we arrived late sat nite, march28th, ckeck in was fine was given a map for our villa. we couldnt find the villa in the darK, would like the resort to bring you to the villa esp when it is dark out and you dont know you way around yet. went to dinner before going to find the villa. the waiter gennardo?spelling was wondeerful. at end of dinner we asked him if someone could direct us the our villa, he came back and sent juan jose to bring us right to our villa that nite. that was nice of gennardo and juan jose. we later had juan jose as our waiter for dinner another nite. we did go to dinner in playa for rest of week. the resort is beautiful, the villas are wonderful and spacious and clean. we did wish they had entertainment at nite so we didnt have to go to playa at nite. we would consider going again to this resort. we ckecked out the nite befor leaving. we was gettting a cab on sat am when we saw juan jose again. we thanked him for helping our first nite. i have to say all the employees were great to us esp gennardo, juan jose. thanks again for a great week.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: suzyq821
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traded our timeshare week in Colorado for a week at the Royal Haciendas and thoroughly enjoyed our stay! We had an efficiency unit while there and it more than met our expectations. Enjoyed our private balcony every night with a glass of wine. We were in the F building and got the morning sun which was perfect for us. People are friendly there and very social although there is no nightlife but that was fine for us. The only negative thing is that there is a cost to use the fitness center, it is $8 a day unless you have an appointment at the spa then it is free for the day. This is not an all inclusive so be prepared to use your room card to pay for all drinks and meals you eat there. Also, the concierge called us a few weeks prior to our stay and set up our airport transportation for us, we were very impressed with this service! I also recommend using Thomas Moore travel which is located onsite, to book tours. I don't recommend renting a car while there, as another guest had billing problems after returning it (they claimed it was returned with damage). There are plenty of taxi's at the resort and it is a short 10 minute ride into Playa for activities and shopping. The resort also offers lots of daily events such as spanish classes, yoga, etc. and they are free. We got lots of R&R while there and spent everyday on the beach. Hope to go back in two years.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: willismother
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed during President 's week at the Royal Haciendas. First of all, it is beautiful and sparkling clean. We saw people manicuring the numerous plants, flowers, grass trees every day- not a leaf out of place. The pools are lovely. The large one by the ocean is heated to perfection. There is a wonderful restaurant, casual , right there to enjoy burgers, fish, sandwiches-served promptly and well-priced. The poolside bar service is friendly and fast. One is never without a soft drink or something stronger. The beach is pretty (but too many rocks for my taste but such a small thing as not to bother.) The villas are something special: beautifally decorated, kingbed in master and two queens in guest. Granite kitchen and loads of space in living room. Stunning decor. We were in c120 which was perfect access to walkway to pool and beach and easy to get to store and lobby. The store is surprisingly well-stocked and had many things at reasonable prices. People at the Haciendas are friendly and go out of their way to attend to requests. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, as would my friends. I liked that it was away from all the hustle of Playa but a cheap, close cab ride to go into town. I am a Marriott owner who traded her week through Interval International. If you are looking for rest, beauty,quiet this is the place. If you want action it's a cab ride away. Loved the place and see more visits in my future. Holly G. New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Royal Hacienda is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: cherietodd10
Reviews.Content: We are a couple that brought our 16 yr old son and 7 yr old son along with our parents. We were very happy with the room at the Royal Hacienda. They are absolutely gorgeous. The resort was kept in immaculate condition. We stayed at C118 Villa and it was conveniently close to the grocery store and lobby. The room-service food was reasonable and very good. The buffet at the restaurant was good, but we thought kind of pricey at $25-30 US/person, depending on the theme night. We ate at the Seafood and Oriental night and they were both VERY good. Kids menu was reasonably priced. Meals from the menu were pretty reasonable as well. The Pool restaurant was a bit pricey for food we thought compared to the Royal Caribbean (we stayed there last year for March Break). There is NOTHING going on after 10 p.m. at this resort. It was really quiet at about 9:30 p.m. The events going on at the Rotanda Bar were pretty lame. They need to get some better entertainment or have some entertainment outside on the beach or pool area at night. It would liven things up a bit. We saw a sign that said they are opening a Seafood restaurant in the Fall of 2009. So, that will give a little more selection on restaurants, as there is only 1 restaurant at this resort at night. We did venture into Playa del Carmen to Senior Frogs and Carlos and Charlies. BEWARE when paying by Visa/Mastercard at these places, as they added a $10 charge to our bill for some reason afterwards. All in all, it was a nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Places on the Face of the Earth Besides Home”
Reviews.Author: shabooyah
Reviews.Content: I loved the resort and the people that worked there. I stayed there for two weeks and never got bored or unhappy. The only reason I would have been unhappy would have been because my nightly walks were cut short for family gatherings. The villas are beautiful. We were staying on the side where you could see the construction, and personally, I enjoyed it. It made me appreciate being there even more. The structure of the buildings and walkways is like art. All of the colors and lawn structures were wonderful. The people are so nice and welcoming if you are nice to them, too. I watched a lot of the employees deal with people who were ungrateful and it made me mad. Just because your on vacation doesn't mean you can't show some respect for others. I am a young person, 17 years old to be exact, but I truly loved it. I recommend you stay awhile. Enjoy the scenery and people. Adios!

Reviews.Title: “Many good features”
Reviews.Author: momlovesvacationing
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Mexico several times. I stayed at Secrets Capri (very nice $$$ adult only resort) last year. I spent a day at NH Rivera ( beautiful rooms). The Royal Haciendas have many things going for it. BEACH: Loved it: The beach is large with nice sand and a good area for swimming or playing. Nice palpas, bathrooms close by and waiters will service you. There are kayaks and snorkeling equipment. You can get as many towels as you need and people don't start saving chairs until 8 or so. Plenty of chairs. CHECK IN & STAFF: Pleasant check in and staff through out the resort. Arnoldo was a wonderful bellboy and helpful. FOOD: Only one restaurant in the resort. They will be opening a second soon. The buffet was okay. The hamburgers were large and yummy. The a la carte food was good. Salsa also very good. You can order food to go or be delivered. Prices were pretty good. Best bet - go to Playa del Carmen: Try Sur for steak (expensive), La Parillas for fajitas (awesome). Many to pick from in Playa. I was told to try Ten for a good inexpensive steak by a local but never made it. ROOM: We stayed in a B side (lock out) room. Our first room had a horrid smell of fumigation chemicals. It was so strong I would not sit in the room. The staff tried to fix the problem. After 5 hours without any change in the odor, the manager finally changed our room. The second room had a similar smell but less potent. However, the smell does not seem to be a problem on the A side of the villas. The beds and pillows are not very comfortable and the decor is a little rustic. The bathrooms and double sink are nice. The maid did a wonderful job everyday. POOLS: The pools are large and nice. One pool is heated so the water is not cold as many people complain about the at other resorts. There is a pool for kids, however, the large pools have a shallow area and you will find many kids in there. The pool is wonderful. There are 3 good size jacuzzis. We found the middle one to be the warmest, however, the temperature could be a little hotter. Unfortunately kids were often in them and would spill their drinks. Some kids would do flips in the jacuzzi. GROCERY STORE: Many things that you might need. Reasonable price but would recommend going to Wal-Mart in Playa to pick up most items including alcohol. TAXI: Taxi rides are negotiable. You can get a cab for 100 pesos to Playa or to the resort, which is about 7 dollars. Don't pay $10. To the airport it is about $35 for 2. Thomas Moore is $44 for 2. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Haciendas”
Reviews.Author: luvpalmtreesVirginia
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Cancun for the last 25 years. For the first 15 or so I only stayed at hotels (Sheraton, Ritz, Hyatt, Hilton etc). While many of these are very nice they are not neccesarily affordable. About 10 years ago I was told about the Royal Resorts and have not stayed any place since. Every one of them is amazing- clean, friendly people etc. This was my first time at the Royal Haciendas but it certainly will not be my last. It seems that with every new resort, the Royal Resorts learn something new. They used higher end products (such as granite countertops) than at the Sands and the bathrooms are much better designed. If you are looking to rent just a lock-off you will be very happy with the room- they have mini "kitchens" and balconys. We stayed in a ground floor unit. I was a bit reluctant at first because I was concerned with a lack of privacy but the ground floor units are great. They are not actually at ground level but raised up a bit. You have a lawn area in front of your unit which is great if you have children. Just beware- the patio doors will lock behind you. A lesson I learned the hard way one very early morning. If you prefer a sunny balcony in the afternoon then try to get a unit in the D section as the B units are shady most of the day (at least in the winter months). If you are used to the night life of Cancun then this may not be the place for you but if you want a relaxing vacation at a beautiful location then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Great!!! We will definately go back”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteCook
Reviews.Content: We just spent a fabulous 10 days at the Royal Haciendas and we did not want to come home. We are a family with an 8 year old and a 1 year old and our children had a great time. There is an onsite activity center with daily activities catering to children of all ages. Not only did every member of the staff treat us fabulously, they made us feel at home. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay a fabulous one. By the end of our stay, almost every staff member we met knew our children by there first name!!! The site is beautiful and this is definately a place that you can make a home away from home. We will definately return to the Royal Haciendas again

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Hacienda is Playa is a good choice....”
Reviews.Author: KLV_Travels
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just came back from staying at the Royal Hacienda in Playa Del Carmen today and I wanted to let you know that if you book at the Royal you will be in good shape, but if you are looking for a bunch of excitement, this is not the place for you. Here are some positive assets of the resort: - The rooms are nice. For me this is a big thing. I can't stand bad hotel rooms. But the rooms are nice, well kept and a good size. Each has a full kitchen or kitchenette (depending on the room you have) which is very helpful. Big tubs (can fit two), balcony, dvd players, safe, good closet space. You won't be disappointed - The grounds are well kept and the view is beautiful - They have shuttles that run Sun-Friday that takes you into Playa for FREE. But if you miss the shuttle it's about $8 american dollars or 100 pesos. Note the shuttle does not run all night and you must put your name on a list the day before to ensure you have a seat. However we never really had a problem. - There is a supermarket on the grounds so if you need to pick up something for the room you don't have to go far. The price is reasonable and you can either pay them direct or they will charge it to your room. - I met some wonderful people and enjoyed my experience there a lot Things that could be better at the resort: - The beds left our backs hurting almost everyday, so that wasn't fun. We could have called for extra padding, but we didn't and every day we suffered. However other people we spoke with didn't have this problem, so maybe it was just us. - There are only 3 restaurants there and this kind of sucked. You want variety and it doesn't have it. The food is just average. But usually we would go down to Playa at night so it wasn't a huge deal for us. - One side of the beach my boyfriend didn't like. But he went to the other side and found it pleasurable. - I felt like there should have been a little more to do there. Besides tanning and very little daily activities, if you didn't plan to go to Playa there would be NOTHING else to do. We knew this going down and we still had a wonderful time at the hotel and most of all in the town of Playa. I would go back and stay in the hotel again. The rooms were nice and to me that's important. I did enjoy the quiet time to relax so it didn't bother us at all. But go knowing that there is nothing to do there at night. Other things to note: - We used Thomas Moore travel to take us from airport to the hotel. It was very easy and they will charge it to your room. For two of us roundtrip it was $44 american dollars. - Don't exchange money at the airport. You will get a better rate at your hotel or in town. Our hotel exchanged our money at 13 pesos to $1 at the airport you will only get 10 pesos for $1 - Places we recommend to eat is Blue Lobster and La Parilla - Go take the timeshare tour at Adventura Spa Palace. We had the best time. We received a bag of goodies, a day pass to spend at the hotel (which is amazing) and they paid for 10 tour tickets. We saved about $300 because of this. It really was a good day for us. YES we spent 90 minutes of our time..but we got much much more in return. If you feel up to it, take the tour, you won't be disappointed. OVERALL... We had a wonderful time and we loved the hotel and loved Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: samerkord
Reviews.Content: Royal Haciendas Date 12/06 thru 12/13/2008 We had a party of twelve and no one wanted to leave to spend the next week in Cancun. The resort is full of stuff to do. The resort and the rooms are very clean. Our personal concierge was able to book our dinners in Playa and our beach messages during our stay. When we first arrived at the Haciendas we were taken by how beautiful the entry to the resort was. There were waterfalls and a large circular thatch roof entry with columns. We were told across the street is where the new luxury golf course will be breaking ground in the spring of 2009. We had arrived early which was around 12:15 p.m. and were greeted by the bell boy as soon as the van had stopped. We had pre registered on line and were checked in within 10 minutes of arrival. They have a nice size grocery store which is like shopping in America. They have tons of stuff like fresh fruit, all kinds of drinks, chips, pasta, under water cameras, and beach toys, etc, and we found out that we could have shopped on line to stock our fridge before arrival at no additional cost. The resort is very lush; full of water falls, streams, hammock areas, six pool areas, four large hot tubs, and restaurants. The room is large a little over 1,700 square feet, with open main living areas, kitchen, kitchenette, two bedrooms, two full bathrooms, as well as storage for luggage and a stroller. The kitchen includes solid granite counter areas, an island, and is fully stocked with utensils, dishes, cups, pots and pans. The vaulted living room includes a large ceiling fan, plasma TV, DVD player, stereo, and two murphy beds. The balcony includes a patio table with 4 chairs, two reclining patio chairs, as well as a corner located Jacuzzi tub with a tile surround. The water pressure for the Jacuzzi tub was amazing. it only took 2 minutes to fill up. The vaulted master bedroom includes a very nice king bed, a seating area for two, large ceiling fan, closets, desk, as well as an entertainment center with DVD player and TV. The master bathroom includes dual sink granite vanity top, as well as a large walk in tile shower. The additional bedroom includes two double beds, a seating area, a kitchenet, and a entertainment center with DVD player and TV, plus includes a full bathroom with a dual sink granite vanity top, a large tub with a tile surround. Note the room was big and very nice. The resort offers a breakfast meeting on Sunday which will provide you information with the resorts activities, diving, fishing, tours, as well as a free transfer into Playa Del Carmen which is nice. We took advantage of the welcome party, piñata party for the kids, as well as the snorkeling tour which is right off the resorts beach. I was amazed with the snorkeling tour. I had assumed it would be a waste of time, I was so wrong. They take you about twenty five feet past the buoys and we could see hundreds of little to large fish all over this reef. You have to do the snorkeling tour. I hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Great resort but very quiet”
Reviews.Author: aprata
Reviews.Content: We are writing this review from the resort itself, we have a full villa (two bedroom two bath) during November 15-22 2008, which we obtained through Interval International as an exchange. I won't repeat all the things already said - but I would like to summarize pros and cons. Pros: 1) Beautiful apartments, modern kitchens, large balconies with jacuzzi, wireless internet in the rooms, the best timeshare apartments we ever saw. 2) Big pool, heated at night, the beach has fine white sand, with palapas and chairs available all day, palm trees on the beach look very exotic. 3) Staff is amazing, customer service is top as with all Royal Resorts in Cancun. 4) The place is spotless - apartments, grounds, beach, everything is cleaned and cleaned and cleaned every second of the day. 5) Free shuttle to Playa del Carmen, although reservation are required and the last departure from resort is early - 1 pm - and the last return from Playa is early - 6 pm. Cons 1) The water at the beach is full of rocks but better than other places in Cancun (better than the Sands beach) and better than some other resort beaches on Riviera Maya itself. 2) This really depends on your taste, but for us, we are a couple in our 40's and it is too quiet for us - not many activities (for example at the Sands the atmosphere is much livelier). It is also pretty isolated, you have to get the shuttle to Playa or a cab for 10 dollars one way) to do something, and by the time you go to Playa and you come back, you can easily waste a half day. 3) The Air Conditioner is very noisy and we had tiny ants all over the kitchen. 4) The way they built the resort, with the U-shape units, the oceanfronts, which are very few (perhaps only 10-15% of the units are oceanfront), are very nice, but they block the view from all other units - we had the second best view in unit C317 right in the middle of Phase I, we could see the ocean between the buildings from a far distance, but it doesn't really make it to a true ocean view. Many units won't even get a glimpse of the ocean. Overall, we may return to this resort when we plan to spend a week doing nothing but sleeping, having peace and quiet, and enjoying the sun and beach (with most swimming being done in the pool). We recommend it for retired travelers but not for teenagers, young people who like the night life (unless you are willing to commute to Playa back and forth).

Reviews.Title: “Solid Resort, not Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Czymnzo0
Reviews.Content: Having been to the Carribean, Cancun to be exact, I was excited to head south for a little Mayan Riviera hospitality. I thought Cancun was beautiful, the beaches wonderful, and the entertainment endless. The trip from the airport is about 45 minutes, give or take, and we were happy to finally hit our destination. The outside of the resort is gorgeous, with the grounds around the hotel lush and extravagant. Your first notice of the hotel will be how undeniably clean and spotless it is. The appreciation I have for Royal Resorts and their interest in keeping the resort so clean has really put them a bar above most resorts. I will break this review down into three sections from here: The Rooms, The Resort itself, the Beach. The Rooms: The rooms are spacious. Each room has a wonderful full balcony out of the first main room, and a half balcony that extends out of the guest room. There is also a hot tub which was used frequently may I add. There was 6 of us, so me and my girlfriend were stuck to the beds that came down from the walls in the main room. I have to be blunt, they are the most uncomfortable beds I have EVER slept on. For a Royal Resort with immaculate grounds, above average service, to sleep on these concrete walls were really a damper in our week. We had no other choice, so we had to make the best of it. We alternated between the beds and the couch, but my back still took a beating. The other rooms have much better beds, so don't panic. All the rooms are equipped with marble, a half kitchen, and beautiful decoration. You definitely receive the bang for the buck here at the Royal Resort - just expect a rough week if your one of the unlucky people who have to sleep on the pull down beds. You've been warned. The Resort itself: You can't deny how beautiful the resort is. It really is lush, with beautiful scenery, plants, bridges, waterfalls. The resort has two HUGE, BEAUTIFUL pools. This was my favorite part of the Royal experience. The pools are kept mild to warm, they are HUGE. The resort during Oct 4 - 11 was crowded, but not once did you feel it with these pools. Each pool has a swim up bar. Just beautiful. Couldn't have been happier with the pools. Also, there are two lap pools where "Volleyball" was held each day. Great fun! Met a lot of couples through volleyball and beach volleyball that we hung out with for the week. Solid job here Royal. As for activities themselves, there are not many at the hotel. Each day, the resort holds activities. For instance, one day there was Texas Hold Em in the lobby. A fun experience, but very short, which kept us from returning. There are not many other things to do, so keep that in mind. This resort should not be chosen for activities. There is only one "true" restaurant. It can become quite tiresome, but the plus here is that the waiters remember your likes, your needs. Everyday, they would have orange juice waiting for me and my girlfriend because they knew we loved it. Just awesome! The Beach: Here is where the resort drops in a huge way. I am a beach connoisseur, I travel to the Caribbean for the spectacular beaches. I love to swim, staring at your feet, wading in the blue water. Well, here at the resort, the beach is terrible. It's so below average that it was such a let down. First, the beach has rocks everywhere. For the famed Mayan Riviera, Royal HAS to fix that problem. You cannot have rocks everywhere on the beach. Next, there is coral everywhere in front of the beach. They say you can snorkel, which we did, but most of the coral is dead. Why it is not removed, well, I'm not sure. So there are no areas to swim, and the water never reaches that "clear, Caribbean" level. We tried walking about a half mile in each direction and we could not find swimmable beach. Believe it or not, this is why I will not return to the Royal Haciendas. You cannot have such a pathetic beach at such a beautiful resort. We went to Cozumel three times during our visit so that we could swim at beautiful beaches. You may have to do the same. Overall: The hotel is solid. It is beautiful, ornate, and spectacular with service. But that does not do enough in the eyes of this traveler. I rarely have anything bad to say about a resort, as you should expect some problems. But having such a terrible beach is not a problem I should breeze by. Many people come from around the world, EXPECTING a top beach, not asking. Many people complained, and Royal said they are doing there best. The resort should not have been built on a coral reef with no life. A real draw back, and for me I will visit another resort during my visit to Playa Del Carmen. 7/10. Enjoy yourself, it's impossible not too. Just don't be too upset when you look at the beach. It is not your typical Caribbean beach, I view this hotel as an exception to otherwise gorgeous beaches. Happy traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: JJSharkman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Haciendas Oct. 18-25 and we were thrilled with the accomodations, the rooms were clean and very well done granite counters and nice tiled floors and bathrooms. Neat to have a jetted tub on the balcany nice for romantic couple or for me great to give the kids a bath while relaxing on the balcony. We had a rainy week and the pool was slightly cold when we first arrived however the 3rd day they turned on the heat to the pools and life was good. Dining in the palapa restaurant was good food and the price was reasonable, every night they offered a buffet and regular menu so you were not stuck getting a buffet. All and all we were very pleased with our stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Assessment”
Reviews.Author: DHAofAZ
Reviews.Content: We did a one week rental. Found staff extremely nice/helpful & they work very hard to please. Resort (really a timeshare) well maintained & condo quite roomy/comfortable. Unfortunately, pool and hot tubs unheated & cold. Only 1 restaurant for dinner which became tedious.Appreciated that when we informed our 'conciege' we were NEVER going to purchase she did not mention it again. We will not be returning since we like to be close to town. Free Royal shuttle to PDC ends at 5:30 (reservation necessary!) & roundtrip taxi is $20, plus tip. It is a 15 min ride & unsafe to walk (& too far for most of us).We went to town frequently - lots of restaurants & people watching. Next time we will stay at a beach hotel walking distance to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great week at The Royal Haciendas”
Reviews.Author: CancunUser
Reviews.Content: We had a great week at The Royal Haciendas, this year we exchanged the two units we have at CIC and enjoyed every day, even the rainy/stromy ones. The staff was very helpful and friendly, they took care of all details. Thanks to the GM - Angel Estrada and his team, Hugo at the beach, Jorge and Jose Luis at the restaurants, Chef Manuel, Salome - the maid, and the Bell Boys. Estela - our Concierge. Greetings from Villas 225 & 327, Week 41.

Reviews.Title: “A nice week at Royal Hacienda!”
Reviews.Author: Caribbean_Crazies
Reviews.Content: Thanks to our brother Jose and his wife Teresa we had the opportunity to return to Mexico for a week of relaxation and fun! Muchas Gracias Jose y Teresa!!! We enjoyed The Royal Haciendas near Playa Del Carmen and have no major complaints to report. It's funny that people complain about the construction side, although we stayed on the completed side, we spent most of our times at the pool and beach on the construction side because believe it or not it was quieter with much less people. The service was above average and the help at the resort was very friendly. I had a fun afternoon playing beach volleyball. We got to experience things we normally wouldn't do staying further South from Cancun. We took a ferry to Cozumel and went shopping and had lunch at the smallest Hard Rock Cafe in the world. We too a road trip to Tulum and got to experience The Ruins on the Caribbean. We visited Cenotes Azules and it was quite an experience (recommend a heavy coating of mosquito repellent!). We spent a lot more time in Playa Del Carmen than we have on previous trips too Cancun. We had a nice lunch at La Parilla and an entertaining dinner at Carlos & Charlies in Playa. My wife Marta and brother-in-law Jose Parasailed right off the beach where we were staying. They caught a ride out to the boat on Jet Skis. The La Rotunda Bar was nice, and had an adjoining room to watch sports on TVs and for Karaoke but seemed under utilized when we were there. I hope they add another restaurant soon, they only have one, La Palapa del Sol, which is a very nice restaurant with gorgeous Caribbean views. We took a road trip to Cancun and spent the day at our favorite resort The Royal Sands and of course Marta and I had a wonderful couples massage in The Spa. I would recommend The Royal Haciendas for couples who are looking to get away from the hustle and bustle of Cancun. We definitely recommend renting a car for a few days to visit other sites on the Mayan Riviera, we went to all the aforementioned sites on our own rather than going on tour buses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: WiPeg
Reviews.Content: We are members of the Royal Hacienda and this was the first time that we have used the week we own, Other then it being terribly hot and humid, which no one can control, This is a fabulous place to vacation at. The everyone from the maid to the concierge (Connie you are wonderful) to the bartenders were the best. The rooms are very comfortable and very clean. This is the place to go if you are looking to just kick back and relax, Even though phase 4 is being built you would never know it . I do wish that they had more resturant choices i felt the evening buffets were a little pricey at $25 a person and the food mediocre. We would spend our evenings with Jose in the Rotunda Bar (he makes a mean Mango Margarita) then go to our room and order off the roo service menu which was cheaper and better food . Other then that I would highly recommend The Royal Haciendas for your vacation

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: tandmgroup
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just left the Haciendas after exchanging through interval. We had stayed at the other Royals in Cancun and were expecting the same level of service and hospitality, and it was what we expected. It was quiet there, the off-season, and the construction going on was not that bothersome. The grounds and the facility are beautiful. I wish that the beach would not have been so rocky in some areas, and all areas of the beach are not swimmable, (some areas are) so if you have young children that really love the ocean, I think that the swimming pool is the best for kids. We also rented a car, the restaurant to us was too expensive at 25.00 a plate for buffet, with other plates, but we drove to Playa every night and found quiet places for under 10.00 a plate. There also is a nice area surrounding Haciendas for walking the beach, although walking after dark is not permitted at all. If you go there, be prepared to relax, have fun, and enjoy the beauty of the Caribbean

Reviews.Title: “Love The Royal Haciendas”
Reviews.Author: HK200519
Reviews.Content: My husbank and I along with my 6 and 4 year old daughters stayed at the Royal Haciendas on August 16- August 23. Its a excellent resort. We traveled different places to the Carribean every summer. I personally feel this is one of the best resort as stay at. The service was great. The villa was beautiful. The pool and beaches are awesome. I really love the pool. Its on the same level of ocean water. I would definitely go back. We had a fun time and enjoy it alot. Every day at 3:00pm, its happy hour, half price on all drinks. The have shuttle buses to Walmart every hour although you would need to make reservations. This is a exclusive area. You would need a take a taxi or rent a car everywhere is go. If you planning to go to different places, I would recommend renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn;t ask for a more beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Cookster63
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place. We had a beachfront villa that we exchanged through Interval International. It was brand new. Granite countertops, huge bathroom, they even washed the comforters in each bedroom. I have never seen a hotel/timeshare do that. My husband and I were very impressed. The staff was great. Very helpful and accomodating. The pictures on the website are very accurate. It looks exactly like the pictures. Just a few minor complaints : only one real restaurant. La Palapa. They have a buffet or a regular menu which is much more expensive. They also have a grill restaurant that you can order from the beach or the pool. Their food was surprising good. We had lunch their every day. Other than the main restaurant if you wanted something else you had to go into Playa Del Carmen. That is a $10 cab ride each way. The Blue Lobster was awesome. Highly recommend that place. We also went to La Casa de Agua. Views were great (of the streets- not ocean) and we wanted fish and they said it was frozen. Who has frozen fish in Mexico. The Blue Lobster brings you 5 different lobster tails and each one has a price and a weight. They were caught within 24 hours of serving to us. That is the way we like it! My husband did a fishing trip through Thomas Moore Travel. Though Mario was very nice, the picture of the boat that Mario showed my husband was not at all the boat that he actually went out on. The picture was of a brand new boat and what they went on was a 50 year old piece of junk. They would not let him fish until the lines had actually caught something and then they would let the guests real the fish in. Not quite the fishing experience he was looking for but he did catch a huge grouper and the hotel rest. was nice enough for a fee to cook it for us for dinner. It is a very large resort but not too many people. We never felt overcrowded. The beaches were beautiful. You were never approached by anyone. They had a guard posted on the beach 24 hours a day to keep strays away. All in all it was great. Carlos at the swim up bar was the best bartender and Eduard in the restaurant for breakfast was the best waiter. Jorge the bar manager at the swim up pool was extrememly knowledgable in tequilla if you are interested. What a great guy! Please be aware that construction is still going on and am not sure for how much longer. They were doing work at the pool when we were there and it was hard to relax. Enjoy and have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Royal Experience”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoHefe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our eleven year old daughter traveled to the Royal Haciendas on August16-23. We bought a time share there last year and this year was the first time we got to use it. All in all we had a great time but there was one big bump. Here is what happened: When we arrived at the airport in Cancun a Thomas Moore shuttle was waiting for us which we arranged to have a couple of weeks earlier. The ride was comfortable and uneventful. When we arrived at the Haciendas the people at check in said that we were not on their list of arrivals and that they did not have our villa available. To make a long story short, Interval international, the vacation club we belong to, made a mistake and exchanged our whole villa and not just the B side like we had arranged previously. The front desk was not very helpful and basically told us to call interval international and deal with it because it wasn't their mistake. I not so politely disagreed stating that we were Royal Resort members and purchased our villa for a lot of money and they should also try to sort this mistake out. We then went to the time share sales office and talked to the lady we purchased our time share from and they came up with a solution promptly however this whole incident took four hours. The resort itself was beautiful. Much nicer landscaping than any of the other royal resorts. Beautiful ponds filled with plants and wildlife dot the area along with a magnificent pool. Very comfortable hammocks are placed all over and the place is immaculately clean. The rooms are very much like the Royal Sands but newer and with a mexican theme. The A-side has a nice size kitchen with granite counter tops, an oven, refridgerator, coffe machine, microwave, and anything else a kitchen needs. The master bedroom has a lot of closet space with a kingsize bed and opens up to a big patio that has a jacuzzi on it. The villa is fully furnished and very spacious and comfortable. The restaurants were good. My favorite was the Aqua Grill which is located next to the pool. The hamburger from here was big and really juicy and the fried grouper sandwhich was awesome. The main restaurant was by the ocean and looked like a giant palapa. It had an amazing view of the ocean but we only ate there for lunch which was a decent buffet. Never woke up for breakfast so I dont know how it is. Room service was good with pizzas, salads, hamburgers, roast chicken and a variety of other things on the menu. There is a nice stretch of beach on this resort but there is a section with a lot of rocks so beware. There are two huge pools with nice pool bars and there are also two lap pools and two kiddy pools. You can kayak and snorkle for free but there is a fee for jet skiing. There is also a shuttle that takes you into and out of Playa del Carmen for free. Playa del Carmen had an awesome night life and an endless array of restaurants both expensive and authentic, inexpensive, local cuisine. Playa del Carmen is only about seven minutes away by motor vehicle. Great place for a family to relax and enjoy themselves in comfort. The service was awesome, the drinks were great, the food was good and the excursion selection from Thomas Moore was nice. This place is about an hour closer to Xcaret, Xel-ha, Tulum and other excursions than Cancun is and that was nice. Taxis service was more regulated here with a fixed price into Playa del Carmen. If you are looking for authentic inexpensive Mexican food go to the El Fogon right by the Huge store called Mega. La Carboncita right off of fifth ave. was great also with good tacos al pastor and unbelievable caldo de pollo. Cueva del chongo had great scenery and very fresh Mexican food also. There is also a Mayan restaurant called Yaxche that was very nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort But...”
Reviews.Author: jmyersrw
Reviews.Content: The resort's grounds are beautiful and the property is kept immaculate. The construction is still going on but it is not intrusive at all. The beach and ocean are pretty to look at but the ocean is NOT swimmable. This is the main reason I would never return. There is some rock but the problem is the sea life. It is good for beginning snorkelers but there is no place to swim! I chose this resort and location over Cancun because I know the damage the Cancun beaches sustained from the hurricane a few years back. I would have gone elsewhere if I had known the ocean at this property was such a disappointment. They told me they just received permission from the local government to clear out some of the rock but I don't see how that will help them. Other positives include 2 large swimming pools with swim up bars, an onsite restaurant with different nightly buffets, outside dining at lunch. These are pluses since I am used to Marriott timeshares without onsite restaurant facilities other than poolside lunch service. The prices are also very inexpensive. Dinner buffet $25 pp and 5 drinks at the bar (4 nonalcoholic and 1 alcoholic) was $11.00. The service is slow but very friendly. Almost all of the staff speak English but there is some difficulty communicating. The concierge is helpful but only to a point, once they know you are not buying at their resort. She gave us bad advice on what beaches to go to for swimming and later after we wasted our day said she realized she probably told us the wrong thing! Some other points to consider: There is no laundry in the villas. There is a laundry facility that is staffed but it can be difficult to get an available washing machine. You also have to be back at a required time to put the clothes in the dryer. This may not seem like a big deal but one of the things I love about timeshare villas other than the extra room for my 3 kids (16, 12, and 10) is being able to do laundry. Not having it in the villa, wasted many hours of my vacation walking back and forth but of course not a huge deal in the big picture. The bar and onsite store close at 10 so there is virtually no nightlife. I would rate the resort a 6 overall. Talking to many people after returning home, the beaches are swimmable at other resorts nearby so choose carefully.
